response: Mix all crumb ingredients and press into greased 9x9 pan. Bake 20 minutes. Let cool and cut into bars. Spread about 1/2 cup of powdered sugar over bars and sprinkle with 1/2 cup of chopped almonds. Melt chocolate chips and almond extract and stir in hot milk until smooth and pour over the powdered sugar and chopped nuts. Spread with foil and refrigerate until set. Remove from refrigerator and cut into small pieces and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat, saute the mushrooms and celery in the butter. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Add the pork sausage and cook and stir for 1 minute. Stir in the rice and cook and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Mix in the bread cubes. Transfer the mixture to a 13x9 baking dish. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Grease a 9-inch ring cake pan with shortening. Arrange bread cubes in the bottom of the pan. Place in oven for 5 minutes to dry out the bread cubes. Place the turkey in the center of the pan. Sprinkle with poultry seasoning. Cut the eggs into 8 slices. Separate the yolks from the whites. Mix the yolks with the milk and poultry seasoning. Beat the whites until stiff peaks form. Fold the beaten egg yolks into the whites until combined. Carefully pour the egg mixture evenly over the turkey. Sprinkle cheese and diced onion evenly over the eggs. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and garnish with parsley.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until tender. Meanwhile, heat the broccoli in a large skillet with the olive oil. Add the garlic and stir-fry until it's fragrant. Add the rice vinegar and the peanut butter. Cook over high heat until the broccoli is tender-crisp. Drain the pasta and add it to the broccoli. Stir in the peanut sauce and the soy sauce. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat. Cook over low heat until the mixture thickens. Stir in the red pepper flakes and add salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Cook the macaroni according to package directions. In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, milk substitute and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the cooked macaroni. Add the breadcrumbs. Transfer the mixture to a greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with additional nutritional yeast, if desired.

Pre heat oven to 350 f. Brown sausage in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bacon. Cook over medium heat stirring frequently until vegetables are soft. Stir in soup mix. Remove from heat and pour mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes. Stir in frozen vegetables. Return to oven for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Yield 6 servings.

Cut bread into pieces about one inch wide and one inch tall. Spread one slice of white bread with crunchy peanut butter. Add one slice of whole wheat bread and spread with grape jelly. Top with another slice of white bread. Add one slice of whole wheat bread with the crunchy side down. Sprinkle one half of the goldfish crackers on each of the wheat slices. Layer remaining slices of white bread with peanut butter and jelly. Sprinkle with remaining goldfish crackers. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut chicken breast halves into thin strips. Place in shallow baking dish. Whisk flour and soy sauce together in shallow bowl. Dip chicken strips in mixture to coat. Place in large skillet over medium heat. Saute chicken until just done. Remove from pan. Heat pineapple juice in small saucepan over medium heat until hot. Add sugar. Cook and stir until dissolved. Pour over chicken in skillet. Top with parsley. Cover. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Spoon over cooked rice. Garnish with parsley sprig. Serve immediately.

Cream together unsalted butter and brown sugars until light and creamy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Add dry ingredients and mix until dough comes together. Add water and mix well. Roll dough into balls and place onto greased cookie sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes.

In a shaker filled 2/3 full with ice, add maraschino cherries and muddle them to release their flavor. Add lime and grapefruit juices and white sugar and shake until very cold. Strain into a cocktail glass and top with vodka. Garnish with a lime wheel and cherries if desired.

Place all the ingredients except the orange juice in a large pot. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until the flavorings are dissolved. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes or until the mixture becomes very thick. Pour into serving cups or small bowls and top each serving with 2 tablespoons of orange juice.
Whisk 1 egg until fluffy. Add milk. Add 1/4 cup grated cheese. Whisk again. Cook over medium heat. Add 4 green onions, jalapeno peppers. Cook until eggs are cooked through. Serve immediately.
In a blender, combine all the ingredients except the sour cream. Blend well. Pour into a large bowl. Refrigerate until cold. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Combine orange juice and hoisin in a small saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 2 minutes. Dip each fillet in marinadeplace in an ungreased baking pan. Sprinkle each fillet with 1/4 cup of honey. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until done.

Soak wooden skewers in water for at least 20 minutes. Meanwhile, make the sauce by mixing together all the sauce ingredients in a small bowl until well combined. Prepare grill for direct cooking over medium heat. Thread a few pieces of peppers onto each skewer. Grill the skewers over medium heat, turning occasionally until the vegetables are tender and charred in spots and the meat is no longer pink inside. Remove the skewers from the grill and brush the vegetables with the sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat broiler. In a bowl, combine the butter with the lemon juice and a little salt and pepper. Whisk in the garlic until it is well mixed with the butter. In a small bowl, toss the basil with the olive oil until it is coated with the oil. Place the blue cheese in a small bowl and crumble it with the back of a spoon so the pieces are crumbly but not completely crushed. Set aside. Prepare a medium sized grill pan with a nonstick coating over medium heat. Place a large piece of parchment paper over the pan. Arrange the vegetable slices in a single layer over the paper, pressing them down with the back of a spoon or your hands until they are coated with the butter mixture. Sprinkle each piece of the blue cheese over the vegetable slices. Broil the vegetables until the cheese is bubbling, about 1 minute longer for the broccoli and about 2 minutes for the zucchini. Transfer the vegetable slices to a serving platter. Pour the basil mixture over the vegetable slices just

Prepare an outdoor cooking area by pre-heating charcoal briquettes or lighting wood. Meanwhile, place the pork loin on the rack of an outdoor cooker. Rub pork with 1 tsp. of salt and 1 tsp. of pepper. Drizzle with 2 tbs. of butter and 2 tbs. of olive oil. Place onion and garlic slices on top of pork. Place cooker over hot coals. Cook, turning pork every 20 minutes for 1 hour and 20 minutes. Cooking time will vary depending on weather conditions. Turn pork over and cook for another 1 hour. Place cooker over hot coals. Brush pork with remaining butter and remaining 2 tbs. of olive oil. Cook, turning every 10 minutes for 10 minutes. Remove loin from cooker. Let rest 5 minutes. Slice pork into thin slices and serve.

Prepare the crust. Fill with the prepared filling. Bake according to the recipe directions. Note: If using a fresh crust you can prepare it a day or two ahead of time and keep it covered at room temperature. Store-bought crusts can be used if you do not have time for a homemade crust.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In 13 x 9 inch pan, melt butter in oven. Remove from oven. Sprinkle crumbs evenly over butter. Pour brown sugar over crumbs. Add flour, stirring well with fork. Press down firmly in pan. Microwave mini marshmallow until puffed up. Place on crumb mixture. Drizzle with vanilla. Bake 25-30 minutes or until light brown. Cool completely, cut into bars and serve with semi-sweet chocolate chips on top.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray an 8 x 8 glass baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl mix oats, almonds, cinnamon and nutmeg. Set aside. In a sauce pan over low heat stir together honey and 1/4 cup water until blended. Stir in vanilla and craisins, and then add mixture to bowl with the other dry ingredients. Mix well with a wooden spoon or your hands until all the dry ingredients are moistened and blended together. Turn into prepared baking dish and spread evenly into baking dish. Bake for about 35 minutes or until browned and bubbly. Cool completely and serve or store in an air tight container in the fridge for up to one week or in the freezer for up to two months.

Cut each orange into 8 segments. Put into bowl. Sprinkle sugar over segments. Let stand for 20 minutes. Stir together liqueur and brandy and pour over orange segments. Cover and leave for 30 minutes. Squeeze liqueur from fruit and discard. Remove vanilla bean from liqueur and add to bowl. Stir together. Refrigerate for 48 hours. Serve chilled.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl until blended and well combined. Pour into an ungreased 9x13 inch pan and bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool for at least 10 minutes before cutting into bars.

In a large bowl beat butter and splenda sugar until smooth. Add egg substitute, pineapple, flours, baking soda and saltmix well. Pour into a greased 9x5x3 loaf pan. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack 15 minutes before removing to cool completely on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter and line an 8x8x2 inch baking pan with parchment paper. Melt the chocolate and butter over low heat. Set aside. Whisk together the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Whisk in the melted chocolate and butter. Add the dry ingredients to the egg and chocolate mixture and whisk until incorporated. Fold in the nuts. Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownie comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.

In a large bowl, combine miracle whip, vinegar and sugar until well blended. Add cheddar cheese to mixture. Stir until cheese is completely melted. Add broccoli, bacon and onions. Toss to coat. Let stand overnight. Serve chilled.
Add ice to glass. Pour Bacardi Limon over the ice. Add Lemonade and Lemon Concentrate. Stir. Add Lime. Garnish with Lemon.
In a small bowl, combine the jelly, port wine, orange rind, cherries, currents, blueberries, strawberries, and raspberries. Garnish with mint sprigs. Refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Put the mangoes, orange juice, sugar and water in a large bowl. Mix well until the sugar dissolves. Add the lime juice and the club soda. Let stand for 45 minutes or more, stirring occasionally. Put the mixture through a strainer. Serve over ice cubes.

In a large bowl combine the oatmeal, sunflower seeds, almonds, coconut, apple, raisin and dried cranberries. Add the condensed milk and stir until well combined. Transfer to a large gallon resealable plastic bag. Add 3 tablespoons honey and 3 tablespoons water and mix well to coat the trail mix. Place the trail mix into a large serving bowl and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 225 degrees. Grease muffin tins or use mini-muffin tins. Mix dry ingredients. Add eggs, beer and water. Add beaten jalapeno pepper. Stir just until blended. Spoon into prepared tins. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown. Remove and cool on rack for 5 minutes. Serve immediatley.

Spread mayonnaise on 2 pieces of challah bread. Spread mustard on remaining 2 pieces. Top one mustard-side slice with 2 slices of brie cheese, 2 slices tomatoes, 3 leaves basil, 1 tablespoon butter, 1 tablespoon mayonnaise. Close the sandwiches together and press to seal the filling into the bread. Wrap the sandwiches in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or up to 1 day before cooking. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook sandwiches until golden brown on both sides and the brie is melted, about 5 minutes per side. Cut into quarters and serve.

In a medium-sized bowl, combine the balsamic vinegar and lemon juice with the oil and the rosemary. Add the chops and toss gently. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least two hours, turning several times during this period. Preheat a broiler and grill the chops until cooked through (15-20 minutes). Serve the chops hot with a green salad.

Preheat the broiler and place the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and heat for 5 to 10 minutes. While the broiler is heating, heat the broth and garlic cloves together until the garlic begins to sizzle. Remove garlic from broth and discard the garlic cloves. Add the broth to the zucchini and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender and beginning to break down, about 5 minutes. Add the lime juice and the black pepper. Heat for about 1 minute longer and remove from the heat. Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth, adding more broth if necessary to get the consistency you want. Season with oregano and parsley and serve hot.

In large bowl combine mayonnaise, oil, mustards and garlic powder. Add dill weed to taste. Add sugar to taste. Stir well to combine. Add pretzels. Toss gently to coat evenly. Serve at room temperature or cold. Store covered for up to 24 hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Trim off the ends of the pears. Place them cut-side down in a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle the pears with salt and pepper and drizzle with honey. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a pan until it is crisp. Remove from the pan and cut into small pieces. Arrange the greens on a platter. Cut the pear halves in half again. Arrange the halves and the bacon on top of the greens. Sprinkle with pecans. Drizzle with the dressing. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a 2 quart or larger glass pie dish with butter or spray with cooking oil spray. Layer half of the white bread cubes in the bottom of the pie dish. Top with half of the salsa, half of the bacon pieces, half of the jalapeno jack and cheddar cheeses and half of the beaten eggs. Repeat layering with remaining ingredients in the same order. Sprinkle the top of the strata with the remaining beaten eggs and the grated parmesan cheese. Bake for 45 minutes or until the strata is set and golden brown and the top is lightly browned and crunchy. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Place the fish and scallops into a non-stick ovenproof dish. Add the butter to the fish and scallops and gently rub it over them. Sprinkle the rind and seasoning evenly over the fish. Pour the lemon juice over the fish and scallops and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the fish is cooked. Serve the fish and scallops hot with the green peppercorn sauce.

Cream together the butter and sugars. Add the egg yolks and beat until light and creamy. Stir in the dry ingredients until the dough is formed. Roll the dough into small balls and place on a cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated 350 degree Fahrenheit oven for 10 minutes. Remove from the cookie sheet and place on a wire rack. Let the cookies cool.
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar. Beat in topping. Pour into crust. Cover and chill 4 hours or until firm. Top with cherry pie filling.

Bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Add the bouillon and stir. Add the 2 ounces of butter and stir in the orzo. Stir in the onion and garlic powders. Stir in the lemon juice. Add the remaining 2 cups of warm water. Cook until the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is tender.
Prepare slaw as directed. Stir in mustard. Taste. Adjust seasoning to your liking. Serve.

Boil 5 cups water in large saucepan. Add soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, garlic cloves, salt, and 1/2 cup water. Stir until dissolved. Add sweet potatoes and boil for 10 minutes. Drain. Add sesame oil to saucepan and bring to boil over high heat. Add toasted sesame seed to oil and boil for 1 minute. Add soy sauce mixture to saucepan and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to large bowl and add toasted sesame seeds. Add more water to saucepan as needed to prevent it from drying out and sticking to saucepan. Add sweet potatoes to saucepan. Cover saucepan and cook until sweet potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Toss with nori and toasted sesame seed.

Pre heat oven to 200 degrees celsius. In a small saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add shallot. Cook 2 minutes. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add flour. Cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir frequently. In a 12-inch to 14-inch saute pan heat oil until smoking. Add garlic and almonds. Saut for 2 minutes. Add cherry tomatoes and cook until al dente. Add white wine, lemon juice, pepper medley. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Add clams. Cover and cook until clams open, about 7 minutes. Add parsley. Serve with french bread.

In a shallow dish combine the first 6 ingredients. Combine the egg and milk and set aside. Dip the chicken pieces into the egg mixture and then coat them with the spice mixture. In a large cast iron skillet (or other heavy skillet) heat the oil over medium heat until it reaches 375 degrees. Fry the chicken pieces until browned on both sides and cooked through (15 to 20 minutes). Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

Peel and core pears, leaving them whole. Place them in a buttered baking dish with raisins. Put maple syrup and butter into a saucepan with vanilla extract. Heat until bubbling. Spoon over pears. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees until tender. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Peel, quarter lengthwise and cut into 3-inch lengths. Place in medium saucepan. Add water to cover. Bring to boil, reduce heat. Simmer until tender. Drain. Mash with food processor. Add thyme and mash. Add 2 cups of water. Add vegetable stock. Blend. Add salt and pepper.

Make a hole in the center of each biscuit. Cut the hole in half. Fill the hole with about a tablespoon of cream cheese. In a small bowl combine the sugar and egg. Mix. Add the mixture to the hole in the biscuit. Add cinnamon to taste. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from the oven and serve with fresh strawberries.

Bake potato in foil and microwave onion in olive oil until tender. Remove skin from potato and cut into 4-inch pieces. Mix potato and onion with taco seasonings and bake 30 minutes at 400 degrees. Serve with mexican blend cheese.
Pour milk into a bowl and add the oatmeal. Add the banana and cereal to the bowl and mix together with a fork. Pour into a mug or bowl and enjoy!

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking, add turkey and cook until brown and no longer pink inside, about 8 minutes. Add onion and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add all remaining ingredients and bring to a boil stirring to dissolve sazon and saltreduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes. Makes 6 servings. : : : :

Boil the potatoes in water with the skins still intact until tender. Drain. Dice into small pieces. Add the sour cream. Add the milk, salt, pepper and the chives. Mix well. Cover with the cheese. Mix well. Add the cornflake crumbs. Mix well. Cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Refrigerate for at least one hour to blend the flavors. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about one hour. Serve hot.

Soak the lentils overnight. Cook lentils the next day with bay leaves and water to cover by 2 inches. After cooking lentils for 15 to 20 minutes drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine the drained lentils with the orange juice and orange slices and toss well. Then add the olive oil and season with fresh ground black pepper and salt. Just before serving garnish with sliced red onions and serve warm.

In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar. Stir in the eggs. Add the vanilla. Stir in the dry ingredients. Fold in the nuts, chocolate chips and peanut butter. Spread evenly in a 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool before cutting into bars.

In a small bowl mix 2 cups shredded extra sharp cheddar cheese with 2 tablespoons flour until combined. Spread 1/4 cup of the flour-cheese mixture on each of the four sides of each of the 12 tortillas. Place the 12 tortillas in the microwave oven (on the high setting) for about 30 seconds or until the tortillas are heated through (but not too hot). In a medium frying pan, heat 1 to 2 teaspoons of the vegetable oil over medium-high heat until hot. Place one of the tortillas in the hot oil to begin frying it on one side for about 30 seconds (the tortillas will puff up like pancakes). Turn the tortillas over on the other side to fry for about 10 seconds more (the puffiness will begin to subside). Remove from the oil (use kitchen towel or paper towels to dab the oil from the tortillas). Place the flour-cheese mixture on one side of each of the fried tortillas (with the flour-cheese mixture side facing

Cut the hamburger into small pieces. Brown the hamburger with some olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Drain the hamburger and set aside. In a large pot add the soup mix, water, and onions. Simmer the mixture for about 10 minutes. Add the potatoes and carrots. Cook for another 15 minutes. Mix in the drained hamburger. Cook for another five minutes. Serve in a bowl. Serve with bread.

In large skillet, cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. Add green onionscook 1 minute or until crisp tender. In 10-inch nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook eggs over moderately low heat for 3 to 4 minutes or until almost set. Sprinkle with 1/4 tsp seasoning salt. Spread evenly over bottom of skillet. Layer with 1/3 of the bacon mixture. Top with 1/3 of the cheese. Cook 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with remaining seasoning salt. Top with remaining bacon mixturedrizzle with cream. Cook 1 to 2 minutes longer or until golden brown.

In a large mixing bowl beat together the sugars and the margarine until light and creamy. Add the egg and beat until fluffy. Add the cocoa and the flour and mix well. Add the chocolate chips and mix until blended. Pour into a greased pan and bake at 350 for about 40 minutes or until firm.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain. Meanwhile, cook potatoes and green beans in separate pots of boiling water until just tender. Drain. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add potatoes and green beans and saute until heated through. Add pesto and stir until blended. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Top with cooked pasta. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook macaroni as directed on package. Drain. In a large bowl beat egg with flour, salt and pepper. Gradually beat in milk. Stir in cooked macaroni and shredded cheese. Pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Bake 30-35 minutes or until set. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add oil. Cook the onions for 3 minutes. Add the ground beef and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the carrots, potato, corn, tomato paste, water and bouillon. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover the pan and cook for 30 minutes. Uncover the pan and stir in the garlic. Cook for 5 more minutes. Season to taste with salt.

In a large pot with a tight fitting lid or crock pot, place the onion and garlic cloves in the bottom of the pot or crock pot. Add a little boiling water if needed so that they are covered by about an inch of liquid. Bring to a boil over medium heat. After 10 minutes add the kidney beans and cook for 30 more minutes. Add brown rice and TVP. Cook for 30 minutes more or until rice is tender. Stir in chili powder and cumin. Season with salt. Serve with toppings of choice.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt lightly. Cook pasta until tender. Drain well. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Cook onion in the bacon grease until tender. Add garlic and cook 1 more minute. Add peas and cook another minute. Add bacon and remove from heat. Combine bacon mixture with pasta. Add ricotta and cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with Parmigiano. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve.

In a large saucepan or pot bring water to a boil over high heatadd chicken thighs. Cook for 10 minutes or until cooked throughremove from pot with tongscut into small chunks (about 1/2 inch). In a large pot or dutch over heat butter and saute onions until softened. Add thyme and cook for 3 minutes more or until fragrantadd chicken thighs and saute for another minute or twoadd vegetable brothbring pot to a boilreduce heat to medium lowadd parsnipscook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Add mustard, honey, salt and peppercook for another minute or twoserve with rice or noodles.

Cream together the sugars, butter, milk and peanut butter. Add the vanilla, then stir in the cocoa. Combine the flour with the rolled oats and stir into the creamed mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.
Shake together all the ingredients in a shaker with ice cubes for about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled glass with a long thin straw. Serve with ice if desired.

Drain and cool carrot. Remove the outer layer. Cut into 1/2-inch slices. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add carrot and stir until coated. Add cider and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until carrot is tender and coating is thickened. Add vegetable stock and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in the Dijon mustard and stir until dissolved. Transfer to bowl. Stir in fresh parsley and serve.

Cook pasta according to the package directions. Drain the pasta. Put the olive oil in the pan. Add the onion and mushrooms. Saute for 2 minutes. Add the roasted red bell peppers. Stir to combine all the ingredients. Add the parmesan cheese. Add salt, pepper, and onion powder to taste. Stir to combine all the ingredients. Serve the pasta topped with the sauce.

Brown 1-1/2 pounds of bulk sausage and 1 pound of lean ground beef in skillet with vegetable cooking spray. Add 1 can of chili, 1/2 cup of tomato juice and 1/2 cup of water. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Add 2 cups of grated cheddar cheese and 1 cup of sliced jalapenos. Cook until cheese is melted. Spread meat mixture over each slice of rye bread. Add 1 cup of shredded Mexican cheese and 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese over each. Fold into plastic wrap and freeze until ready to use. Remove from freezer. Wrap each sandwich in foil and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serves 16.

Slice eggplants 1/2 inch thick and brush with oil. Bake in a 400 degree preheated oven for 15 minutes or until tender. Dice onion and garlic and sauté in oil. Add tomatoes and roasted peppers with their juices. Mash eggplants with a potato masher or fork until slightly chunky in consistency. Mix with roasted vegetables. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spread on rolls or serve with crackers.

Add prepared mustard to the cream cheese and then blend well with the chopped chicken. Then add lemon juice. Mix together and then shape into balls and roll in chopped nuts. Then refrigerate for several hours until firm. Serve with crackers or toast.

Heat water in a small saucepan until hot to the touch. Stir in taco seasoning mix and stir until dissolved. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Dip tortillas in oil to coatplace in a baking dish. Pour sauce over tortillas and top with beans and meat. Sprinkle with cheese and top with sour cream and onion. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 12-15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a large pot of boiling water, blanch carrots until tender. Drain. In a skillet, saut? onions in butter. Add blanched carrots, horseradish, pepper, and water. Mix well. Let cool. Add breadcrumbs. In a separate bowl, mix together mayonnaise and cheese. Fold into carrot mixture. Pour into a greased baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in a 350 degree oven.

Cut out circles of dough with a 3-inch round cutterplace on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Melt cheese and add Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco saucepour into small bowldip cookies in sauce, allow to cool on waxed paper.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In a small bowl, stir together the olive oil and garlic. Saute for 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and basil. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the drained pasta to the mixture and toss well. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place fillets in baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over fish. Bake until fish flakes easily with fork.

Bring 2 cups of cold water to a boil with the orange juice. Cook the orange juice mixture over high heat until the mixture begins to thicken. Remove from heat and let stand for five minutes. Add the corn starch and whisk until dissolved. Add the hot water and stir. Add the cornstarch mixture and the remaining cup of cold water to the cornstarch mixture and stir until blended. Return the mixture to the boil and add the lemon juice and zest. Cook the mixture over high heat until thickened. Add the frozen carrot slices. Cook the mixture over moderate heat until the mixture thickens slightly and the carrots are tender. Add the dark corn syrup. Cook over moderate heat until the mixture thickens slightly. Remove from the heat. Add the hot water and stir. Let the mixture cool before serving.

Wash and pat dry small red potatoes. Add potatoes to a large pot filled with enough cold water to cover potatoes by 1 inch. Add bay leaves. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain potatoes. Return potatoes to pot. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add marjoram, thyme. Return to heat. Cook over low heat until fragrant. Remove pot from heat. Add butter. Stir until butter is melted. Add peas. Stir to combine. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve.

Place a large skillet over medium heat. Melt the butter in the skillet. When the butter is hot, add the flour, stirring constantly to prevent burning. Cook until the mixture is smooth and bubbly (about 3 minutes). Pour the milk into the skillet, stirring constantly, until the mixture is thickened (about 3 minutes more). Remove from the heat and stir in the sausage, sour cream and pepper to taste. Serve over scrambled eggs.

Cream the butter and sugar. Add the beaten eggs, vanilla and flour. Chill for 15 minutes or till firm enough to work with. Sift the salt with the baking powder into the creamed mixture. Beat the confectionary coating until smooth. Roll the dough into one inch balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten the balls to about half an inch thick. Dip the tops of the cookies into the coating and place on a wax paper covered cookie sheet to dry. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Bake in a 425 oven for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen.

Prepare 6 cups of boiling water. Discard the family-size tea bags. Place whole cloves and cinnamon sticks in a small saucepan. Bring the water to a boil and then turn off the stove and let the teas steep for 15 minutes. Strain the teas through a cheesecloth into a large pitcher. Add the juices and stir until well combined. Serve warm or at room temperature with a touch of ice if desired. Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In large mixing bowl combine butter and cajun seasoning. Add potato pieces and toss. Pour out onto a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until crisp and golden brown. Serve with cajun remoulade sauce for dipping.

Cut off the bottom ends of the asparagus spears, trimming until you find the natural breaking point of the stem. Then cut the spears into thirds. Add the bacon lardons in a large sauté pan over medium heat until browned on all sides. Add the asparagus and the garlic cloves and sauté until the asparagus is just tender, about 5 minutes. Drain the bacon lardons on a paper towel and reserve. Whisk together the brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and the butter in a small bowl until smooth. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Add the reserved bacon lardons back into the sauté pan and mix the sauce with the asparagus until coated.

In a saucepan combine all the ingredients except the vanilla and beat until smooth. In another bowl combine the corn syrup and sugar and beat until smooth. Add the corn syrup and sugar mixture to the chocolate mixture and beat until smooth and cool to room temperature. Add the vanilla to the mixture and beat until smooth. Use on cakes or for frosting cookies or other baked goods.

Plump raisins by soaking in boiling water about 10 minutes, then drain. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook stirring for 1 minute. Add spinach and cook stirring for about 2 minutes or until just wilted. Cook penne as directed on package. Toss penne and spinach with pine nuts, raisins, garlic and oil. Add salt and pepper to taste.
In a blender combine coffee and milk. Blend well. Add ice cream and blend well. Add chocolate syrup and blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and serve.

Place potatoes in a saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook potatoes until tender. Drain. Cut potatoes into cubes. Place potato cubes in a greased 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with soup. Place 4 pieces of cooked ham on each potato. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover with foil. Bake at 325 degrees f oven 30 minutes or until hot. Remove foil. Bake uncovered 10 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease and flour muffin tins. In a large mixing bowl combine the flour, blue cornmeal, sugar and salt. In another bowl combine the buttermilk and egg. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture and add the buttermilk/egg mixture. Mix just until blended. Spoon into greased and floured muffin tins. Place in pre-heated oven and bake for 18-20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. In medium bowl, combine crumbs and cheese. In large bowl, beat eggs and milk. Dip eggplant slices in eggs mixture and then in crumb mixture. Place crumb-coated slices on non-stick sprayed cookie sheet. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft and light golden brown, about 8-10 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes and juice and bring to a boil, stirring often. Lower the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and kalamata olives and bring to a boil. Season with sugar and the basil. Stir in the feta and parmesan cheese. Cook 1 minute more. Serve over cooked pasta.

Place first 4 ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. Pour into a large zip-top plastic bag. Add salmon and seal. Refrigerate 1 hour. Preheat grill to medium. Place salmon on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 3 to 4 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with orange wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine flour and the remaining ingredientsmix well. Dip sweetbreads into the batterdrain. Dip battered sweetbreads into the egg batterdrain. Place sweetbreads on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with bacon and gravy.

Mix together all the ingredients except the rice. Arrange the apple slices in a pan. Place the rice in the center of the pan. Place the pork on the rice. Pour the liquid from the pan on top of the rice and pork. Bake for one hour at 350 degrees F. Serve with rice. Serves two.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter. Add the country ham, red bell pepper and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the flour. Stir to coat. Gradually add the cream, whisking until blended. Cook for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in the salt, chili powder and garlic powder. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Cook for 5 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with the cheese. Transfer to a serving dish.

Mix all of the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Cut in the butter until you have crumbly mixture. Place mixture in a saucepan with 50ml of water. Stir over low heat for about 5 minutes until mixture is fully incorporated into a paste. Transfer mixture onto a lightly floured surface, and roll into a long rectangle about 3 inches in thickness. Cut into small squares with a sharp knife or cookie cutters. Place onto lined baking sheets. Bake for about 8-10 minutes until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Store in an air tight container for up to three days.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 13x9-inch pan with foilgrease the foil. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cookie mix and the oilmix well with a wire whisk. In a small bowl, combine the egg whites with the watermix well with a wire whisk. Pour the cookie mix mixture into the prepared pan. Place the pan on a cookie sheet. Bake for 15 to 17 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Remove the pan from the ovenremove the foil from the pan. Spread the frosting over the cookie mixturelet stand for about 5 minutes. Spread the raspberry jam over the frostinglet stand for about 5 minutes. Spread the white chocolate chips over the raspberry jamlet stand for about 5 minutes. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan or 2 loaf pans. In a medium bowl combine 3/4 cup of the flour with 1/2 teaspoon each of the baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add to this 1/2 cup of the granulated sugar, the orange peel, orange juice, egg and 1/2 cup of butter. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute. Gradually add 1 cup of the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of butter, beating well after each addition. Pour in orange juice mixture (from above). Combine 1/2 cup of water with 1 tablespoon of cornstarch in a small bowl. Add this to batter along with 1/2 cup of orange juice, mixing well with a spoon. Spoon batter into greased pans. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 9 inch round cake pan. Beat the egg and egg substitute together. Combine the yellow cake mix, kahlua, half and half and egg mixture in a large bowl. Stir in the pecans and the chocolate chips. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for about 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about an hour. Sprinkle with the sweetened flaked coconut before serving.

Heat oil and garlic cloves in a large saute pan over medium heat. Cook until garlic is golden brown. Add the almonds to the garlic. Cook until almonds are lightly browned. Add the asparagus to the garlic mixture. Cook until almonds are toasted and the asparagus is tender. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

Combine rice, egg yolks, 2/3 cup of the sugar and 1/4 cup of the milk in a heavy sauce pancook, stirring constantly for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heatadd remaining 1/4 cup of the sugar and 1/2 cup of the flourcook, stirring constantly for 3 minutes. Remove from the panadd margarinestir with a whisk to melt the margarine. Return mixture to the pancook, stirring constantly for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup of the remaining flourcook for 3 minutesstir frequently. Add the rest of the flourcook for 3 minutesstir frequently. Add the milkcook for 5 minutesstir frequently. Remove from the heatstir in the vanillacoolpour into individual glassesserve at room temperature.

In a bowl combine breadcrumbs, flour, poultry seasoning and salt. In another bowl combine margarine and pepper. Dip each chicken piece in margarine mixture and roll in poultry mixture. Place in pan. Bake at 400 degrees f for 40 minutes. Turn and baste with remaining margarine and repeat baking time.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat and saute onion until translucent. Season with rosemary and a pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside. Salt and pepper pork loin on all sides and place in a shallow dish. Pour the onions and the wine into a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Let simmer for 2 minutes until syrupy and reduced by half. Remove from heat and stir in the liquid honey. Pour over the pork tenderloin and bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 35-55 minutes until the meat is fork-tender and the sauce is thickened.

Cook the chicken according to package directions. Drain the juices from the chicken into a sauce pan. Add the vegetables, butter, seasoning packet, and water. Heat through and serve over the rice mixture.

Toss greens with enough dressing to coat. Divide greens among 6 plates. Place half an apple wedge on each plate. Sprinkle half of the pecans and dried cherries over apples. Divide cheese equally. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Top with remaining apples, pecans and dried cherries. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Drizzle with remaining dressing. Serve.

Beat in other ingredients. Pack butter into molds or crocks or form balls with a melon baller. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Can be stored for upto 1 month in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer.

Boil butter and heavy cream and cook until heated through - stirring occasionally. Stir in garlic salt and garlic powder and parmesan and pecorino romano cheeses until melted. Once melted remove from heat and add shredded cheddar and mix until incorporated. Stir until smooth and creamy. Add cooked cavatappi and mix until pasta and sauce are fully incorporated. Serve immediately!

Place all ingredients except water into crock pot. Cover and cook 8-10 hours or until meat is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent vegetables from sticking to bottom of crock pot. Remove vegetables to serving dish before serving. Pour juices into small saucepan and add water if needed. Bring to boiling point while stirring constantly then pour over meat. Serve over rice or egg noodles.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine goat cheese with white pepper and garlic powder. Spread about 2/3 cup spaghetti sauce over each chicken breast. Roll up and place seam side down in pan. Spread remaining sauce over top. Top with mozzarella. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Drain the tomatoes and set aside. Remove the tomatoes skins, reserving the tomatoes for another use. Dice the tomatoes. Add to the white beans, olives, celery, green onions and herbs. Mix well. Drizzle with dressing. Place lettuce leaf on plate. Place tomato mixture on lettuce leaf. Garnish with hard-boiled egg.

Saute onion, celery, bell pepper in large saucepan until tender. Add ground turkeycook until no longer pink. Drain fat from pan and add barley, tomato paste, broth, water and seasoningsbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for about 45 minutes or until barley is tender. Serve with a crisp green salad or a fresh fruit salad.
To a food processor or blender add all ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately. To store cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate up to one week. Makes about 2 cups.

Whisk together all of the ingredients. Place the thighs in a baking dish or ziptop bag and pour the marinade over the thighs. Refrigerate for at least 6 hours. Remove from the marinade and discard the marinade. Grill the thighs for 30 minutes turning them occasionally. Serve hot.

Puree 1 1/2 cups watermelon and 1 1/2 cups strawberries (from 1 pint) in food processor or blender until smooth. Pour into 2-quart pitcher and stir in 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water. Add 1 cup frozen lemonade concentrate and stir well. Chill for 2 hours. Stir in 1/4 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons lemon juice and stir well. Chill for 2 hours before serving over ice with lemon slice and mint sprigs for garnish if desired. Serves 12.

Mix crisp rice cereal with 2 tablespoons flour, 2 tablespoons poultry seasoning, 2 teaspoons salt, 2 teaspoons dried thyme. Shake to blend well. Put butter into a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Pour the cereal-flour mixture into the skillet and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture begins to brown on the bottom of the pan, about 5 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large plate or platter with sides to catch drippings. Dip each chicken breast into the butter to coat all sides completely. Dip the buttered breast into the cereal mixture to coat all sides completely. Place the coated breast into the skillet and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side until golden brown on the bottom of the pan. Remove the pan from the heat and flip each breast to brown on the other side for about 2 minutes more. Transfer the coated chicken to the prepared plate or platter and repeat with remaining chicken. Serve the chicken with gravy (see recipe) if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook until softened. Stir in sour cream. Season with picante sauce. Add 2 eggs. Cook until eggs are cooked but not hard. Transfer to 9 x 13 baking dish. Top with remaining eggs. Sprinkle with flour tortillas. Bake until eggs are cooked through and flour tortilla are golden brown. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Return to oven until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180 C. Beat butter and sugar with electric beater until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Sift flour and baking powder together. Fold through butter mixture with almonds. Divide mixture evenly between 2 tins (12cm x 12cm). Press mixture evenly into tins. Bake for about 35 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool in tins for 10 minutes. Turn out onto wire racks to cool completely. Spread with butter icing. Roll cherries in icing and place on top of the cakes.

In a large skillet brown the ground turkey with the onions. Stir in the cut green beans. Cook until the turkey is cooked through. Transfer the mixture to an ungreased 9x13-inch baking dish. Top with the tater tots. Pour the condensed cream of mushroom soup over the top. Stir in the milk. Cover with a layer of cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.

Combine all ingredients except the rolls in a medium bowl. Season with salt to taste. Form into four patties. Cook in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until done to desired doneness. Place patties in a single layer in the prepared pan. Cook 5 to 7 minutes per side or until browned. Serve on rolls.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Cream together the butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and the almond extract. Add the dry ingredients and mix well until smooth. Add the water and the egg white and beat until the mixture is smooth and the consistency of thick batter. Drop the batter by teaspoons on a greased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for about 12 minutes or until the bottoms are slightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut bread in half lengthwise. Spread butter over each slice. Combine milk, eggs, basil, garlic salt, pepper, green onions and mozzarella cheese. Spoon into bread. Roll up bread. Place in a greased 1 1/2-qt. baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Serve with salad.
Combine all the ingredients. Serve at room temperature.
Mix all the spices together in a small bowl. Sprinkle over your choice of meat before cooking.

In a small bowl, combine water, cinnamon and salt. In another bowl combine the egg white and the sugar. Stir well and mix the dry ingredients into the wet ones. Then add the pecans. Coat the pecans with the mixture using your hands or spoon. Place on a cookie sheet to bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until the mixture is hardened and the pecans are coated with the candy mixture. Let cool. Store in an air tight container.

Crush pineapple and orange juices, zest and gelatin. Add orange juice to mixture. Beat in eggs. Mix in vanilla and the gelatin mixture. Pour into pie shell. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into pieces and serve with whipped topping or ice cream.

Beat cream cheese and crab until smooth. Stir in garlic powder and black pepper. Place wonton wrappers on a flat surface. Place a teaspoon of the filling in the middle. Moisten the edges of each wonton wrapper with water. Fold up one edge over the filling and press the edges together to seal. Continue with the other wonton wrappers and fillings. Heat a large saucepan to medium heat and add vegetable oil to the pan. Add wontons to the pan in batches. Cook wontons for about one minute. Drain and serve with sweet and sour sauce.

Cream together the butter and splenda granular. Add the cream cheeses. In a separate bowl beat the eggs and add the lime juice and salt. Add the dry mixture slowly to the wet mixture. Pour mixture into a greased pie pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Let cool completely before serving.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat butter with oil and add onions, garlic and celery and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add wild rice and cook for another minute. Add broth and cook until wild rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 10 minutes more. Add heavy cream and cook until heated through and corn kernels are just tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in eggs until just combined and cooked through, about 2 minutes more. Season to taste with salt and pepper and add more cayenne if desired. Serve with your favorite hot sauce.

Place 3 or 4 of whole peppers cut side down in a large frying pan with 3 or 4 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat until they blister, then turn them over and brown them for 1 to 2 minutes more or until they are well seared. Remove from heat and set aside until cool enough to handle. Remove seeds from each pepper (it is easiest to do this with a paring knife at this stage), and slice each one into 6 to 8 pieces (thin or thick rings), depending upon how big you like them. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a small bowl and pour over the slices. Toss well to coat them with the sauce, cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 to 24 hours to marinate. Remove from refrigerator 20 minutes before serving to allow them to come to room temperature. Transfer to plates or to warmed serving plates, and garnish with parsley or cilantro if desired.

Chop the red cabbage into small pieces. Peel the orange bell peppers and cut into strips. Rinse the cumin seeds and place them into a small bowl. Grind them into small pieces using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise with the vinegar and add the chopped peppers. Put the cumin seeds into the mayonnaise. Add the orange juice. Stir the mixture and season it with the chili powder and the celery seeds. Add the chopped cabbage and the sugar and mix everything well. Cover the salad with the canola oil. Add the ground cumin seeds. Stir and serve.
In a jar with a tight-fitting lid combine all ingredients. Cover and shake well. Refrigerate unused portion. This is great to use as a dressing for fruit salad.

Prepare crust according to package directionslet cool completely. Combine the sugar and cornstarch in a medium saucepan. Stir in the spices. Gradually stir in water. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil and is slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Add peaches. Spoon into crust. Bake at 375 degrees F. for about 15 minutes or until slightly set. Cool completely on wire rack before serving. Top with whipped cream.

In saucepan, brown the chicken. Drain grease. In bowl of blender, combine all remaining ingredients. Blend well. Add chicken. If necessary, blend again until smooth. Pour into serving bowl. Top with cheese. Microwave on high for 1 minute. Serve with tortilla chips.

Prepare the filling by combining the spinach, Ricotta and Parmesan Cheeses in a large bowl. Mix together using a spoon or spatula until well combined. Using a pastry brush dipped in cooking oil, coat the inside of each wrapper with cooking oil. Spoon a rounded teaspoon of the filling into the center of each wrapper. Fold the wrapper over to enclose the filling. Press the edges of the wrapper together to seal. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Gently drop the filled wrappers into the water. Cook the filled wrappers for 2 minutes. Drain the filled wrappers from the boiling water. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Place the filled wrappers in the ice water. Let the wrappers stand for 1 minute. Lift the filled wrappers from the ice water. Drain. Place the filled wrappers on a baking sheet. Place the filled wrappers in the oven. Bake the filled wrappers for 8 minutes. Serve the filled wrappers with the cooked pasta of your choice.

Preheat grill on low to medium high heat. Rub the dressing mixture over the top and bottom of the skin side of the salmon. Place skin side down on the grill and cook for about 10 minutes or until the skin is crisp and the flesh is slightly pink in the center. Turn and cook the second side for another 10 minutes or until the flesh is flaky and cooked through.

Pre-heat the grill and line a large baking tray with grease-proof paper. Slice the potatoes into discs and brush with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place on the baking tray and grill for 15-20 minutes until golden. Slice the onions into thin wedges and place on the baking tray with the potato slices. Slice the tomatoes in half and place them on top of the potato slices and grill for another 15-20 minutes until the tomatoes have softened. Place the lemon halves on the tomatoes and grill for a few minutes until the lemon is grilled and the skin is soft. Slice the chicken breast and rub with the lemon zest and season with salt and pepper. Place the chicken breast on top of the grilled lemon halves and tomatoes. Place the olives around the grill tray and grill for a few minutes until the olives are warmed. Remove from the grill and place the chicken on a serving plate. Add the grilled potatoes and onions and serve with the grilled ol

In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with a slotted spoon. Drain well and crumble bacon. Set aside. Add extra virgin olive oil to pan and saute bacon drippings with onion until tender, about 8 to 10 minutes. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add black beans to pan with 2 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook until desired consistency, about 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in ground cumin and hot sauce to taste. Stir in crumbled bacon and serve with sour cream as desired.
Mix together ground beef and red beans. In a large saucepan, brown ground beef and red beans over medium heat. Drain. Add salsa and heat through. Serve on polenta squares with cheddar cheese.

Bring 1/2 cup of the half-and-half to a boil in a saucepan over medium heatadd the garlic. Cook 1 minute longer, or until the garlic is tenderremove from the heat. In a large saucepan, combine the remaining half-and-half with the goat cheese and the cooked garlicplace over medium heat until the cheese is completely melted. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the potatoes until tenderdrain the potatoes. Mash the potatoes with the remaining half-and-half mixture (do not drain)stir in the goat cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

Trim off any fat from the steaks and season with salt and pepper. In a large saute pan heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the oysters to the hot pan and saute until the oysters begin to curl. Remove the oysters from the pan and set aside. Saute the oyster juice for about 1 minute. Place the steaks into the saute pan and saute for about 4 minutes on each side. Remove from the pan and set aside. Place 1 tablespoon of the teriyaki sauce into the saute pan and cook until reduced by half. Add the oyster juice to the pan. Simmer the teriyaki sauce and oyster juice mixture together for 5 minutes. Place the oysters and the steaks back into the pan and cook for another 1 minute. Serve immediately.

In a medium sauce pan bring the 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1/4 cup of water to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to low. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1/4 cup of water. Add the maple syrup, butter, half-and-half cream and 2 teaspoons of the vanilla extract. Stir to combine. Remove the pan from the heat. Cover the pan and allow the mixture to steep for 10 minutes. Remove the cover and refrigerate the mixture until it is very cold. Add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of the vanilla extract. Pour the mixture into a blender or food processor. Process the mixture until it is smooth. Transfer the mixture to a 1-quart canning jar. Store the sauce in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

In a medium saucepan mix frozen lemonade concentrate, honey, poppy seed and red seedless grapes. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Cover and refrigerate until cool. In a large bowl combine watermelon, nectarines, pears. Drizzle with dressing. Toss to coat. Serve.

Melt butter and add to a large bowl with the dark and milk chocolate chips. Set aside. In a small bowl beat the eggs with a pinch of salt and the brown sugar and then stir in the plain and self raising flours along with the cocoa powder. Stir the butter mixture into the dry ingredients until just combined and then stir in the milk chocolate chips and the white chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoons onto the lined baking trays and bake for about 12 minutes until the edges are just firm and the centres soft and chewy. Remove the trays from the oven and allow the cookies to cool on the trays for about five minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to finish cooling.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees and line a large cookie sheet with parchment paper. Cut the potatoes into long fry shapes and toss with the oil and cajun seasoning in a large bowl. Arrange the potato strips onto the cookie sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until the potato strips are tender and crispy (about 25 minutes).

Cut the chicken breasts in half if desired. In a small bowl combine the herbs and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Dip each breast half into the oil mixture and then place on a plate. Remove the stems from each artichoke heart with a spoon then scoop out the meat into a bowl. Scoop the meat from the bowl into the center of each chicken breast half and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the Parmesan on top. Place the breasts into a glass dish or shallow pan with sides that has a lid that you can use in the oven if desired. Bake at 400 degrees for about 30 minutes or until the internal temperature is 165 degrees. This is a great meal with a side salad or couscous for a quick dinner.
Arrange sliced mushrooms and asparagus in a large salad bowl. Sprinkle with lemon juice and dressing and toss well. Garnish with sliced almonds.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. In a large bowl stir together the butter and honey until melted and smooth. Add the oats, nuts and seeds and stir until well mixed. Transfer to a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Spread into an even layer and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir in the raisins and dried fruits. Return to the oven for 5-10 minutes to toast the fruits. Remove from the oven and cool completely. Transfer to a storage container and store in the refrigerator.

Sprinkle the cajun seasoning and cayenne pepper evenly over the edamame. Toss well and let stand for a few minutes to allow the seasoning to penetrate. Arrange the edamame in a baking dish. Add the lemon juice and zest. Season again with cajun seasoning and cayenne pepper to taste. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the beans are tender. Sprinkle the chopped cilantro over the beans. Serve at once.

Melt cream cheese and garlic in saucepan. Add onions and worcestershire sauce. Dice braunschweiger into small cubes and add to mixture. Stir in parsley and chives. Spread into serving dish. Chill before serving.

Remove fish from plastic wrap and pat dry. Heat skillet and melt 1 tsp of cooking spray. Add mustard and thyme. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place fish and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Remove from pan. Pour remaining cooking spray into pan and place over medium heat. Add onion and mushroom and cook for 3 minutes. Add broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add whipping cream. Place fish and vegetables on plate and pour sauce on top. Serve immediately.

Beat butter and barbecue sauce in a large mixing bowl. Add the sugar and beat until creamy. Add eggs and beat well. Add the flour and beat well. Add the ginger, clove, and cinnamon. Drop by teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Put cornstarch in a saucepan. Mix in apple cider. Add in the champagne. Bring the mixture to a boil. Let it cook for 2 minutes. Remove the mixture from the heat. Add in the brie and almond extract. Mix well. Arrange apple slices in the bottom of a shallow bowl. Dip the bread cubes in the sauce. Place the cubes on a platter. Dunk the breadsticks in the sauce. Serve with apple slices.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large skillet, cook tuna in olive oil for 10 minutes until just cooked through, stirring occasionally. Add beans and oregano. Cook for 1 minute more. Meanwhile, whisk eggs with salt and pepper in a large bowl until blended well. Add spinach and stir with a fork until the spinach wilts. Remove from heat. Fold spinach mixture into eggs. Pour into 2-cup ovenproof dish or 10-inch pie plate. Top with pecorino cheese. Bake for 35 minutes until set. Cut into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature with toasted slices of crusty bread for dipping into the sauce from the bottom of the dish.

Preheat grill to medium. Brush both sides of the slices of peasant bread with olive oil. Place on grill until lightly browned. Remove to a plate. Brush both sides of the eggplant slices with oil. Place slices on grill and grill for about 3 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove to a plate. Place a slice of bread on each plate. Top each with 3 or 4 slices of eggplant, and 2 or 3 slices of tomato. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add sugar and beat until well blended. Add frozen orange juice and blend. Add eggs and blend. Add mandarin oranges and blend. Pour batter into shortbread pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool completely on wire rack. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Serve with whipped topping.

Combine all ingredients in large kettle or pot. Bring to a full boil over high heat for 1 minute. Remove from heatstir for 5 minutes. Skim off foam if necessary. Pour hot jam into sterilized jarsseal as usual. May be processed for 10 minutes in a boiling water bath if desired. Refrigerate for 24 hours before eating.

Combine all ingredients except sour cream in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in sour cream. Combine well. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 45-55 minutes. Bake uncovered for the last 15 minutes. Serve with corn bread.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line two cookie sheets with waxed paper. In a large bowl cream the butter. Add the sugar, eggs and flour. Stir in the cornstarch. Add the raspberry preserves. Stir in the baking powder. Form dough into small balls. Place balls on waxed paper. Press down lightly. Place on cookie sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Allow to cool. Melt chocolate chips with shortening over a double boiler. Dip cookies in chocolate. Dry on waxed paper. Sprinkle with colored sanding sugar. Place on rack to dry.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, ground black pepper and the minced garlic. Mix thoroughly and transfer the mixture to a large baking sheet that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Scatter the chopped rosemary leaves over the mixture and place in the center of the preheated oven. Bake until the potatoes are tender (about 25 minutes) and the garlic is golden brown (about 35 minutes). Serve immediately with your favorite protein or side dish.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Remove stems from brussel sprouts. Slice in half. Toss in a large mixing bowl with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 25 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a large skillet over medium heat. Cook until brussel sprouts are tender. Drizzle with Sriracha sauce. Drizzle with Honey. Squeeze lime juice over the top. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve.

Preheat oven to 160 degrees celcius. Cream icing sugar with the eggs until white and creamy. Add kirsch, aniseed and salt, beating well to blend thoroughly. Sift the flour into the mixture, beating it into a stiff batter. Spoon the mixture onto a greased flat baking tray leaving room for the mixture to spread out during cooking. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely before storing in an airtight tin.
In a medium saucepan combine water and cream of tartar. Stir in sugar and salt. Cook over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves completely. Let cool slightly then serve or refrigerate until needed.

Preheat oven to 350f and grease a 9x12 pan or line with parchment paper and grease paper. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar and baking soda and salt and whisk together. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs and oil and whisk together until well blended. Add the bananas and whisk until just combined. Add the wet mixture to the dry and fold in chocolate chips with a rubber spatula until just combined. Pour batter into the prepared pan and smooth out the top with an offset spatula. Bake in preheated oven for about 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for a few minutes in the pan and then flip out onto a wire rack to finish cooling.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In a 10-inch oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat, cook the beef for 2 minutes per side to sear it. Remove to a plate. Add the onion soup and cream of mushroom soups to the skillet and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add the water and stir in the beef. Cover the skillet and transfer to the oven. Cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until the beef is tender.

Heat half of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the veal scallopini and cook until the meat is browned and cooked through. Add the butter and cook until the butter is melted. Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the rest of the oil and the rest of the butter to the skillet and heat over medium heat. Add the chopped tomatoes to the skillet and cook until the tomatoes are mashed and the sauce has thickened slightly. Add the veal to the skillet along with the oregano and the remaining seasonings. Cook for about 2-3 minutes. Pour the white wine into the skillet and bring to a boil. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the wine has almost evaporated. Add the parsley. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Saute onion and mushrooms in margarine. Mix in flour. Add soymilk. Stir in garlic powder. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add beans. Sprinkle with French Fried Onions. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare your teriyaki sauce. (see recipe below) Cut off top of broccoli and cut into chunks. Toss with teriyaki sauce. Spray pan with cooking spray. Place broccoli and garlic in pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper. Serve.

In large bowl combine rice, crushed pineapple, marshmallows, almonds & cream. Stir in sugar & vanilla. Place in greased 1 quart baking dish. Cool & refrigerate several hours or overnight before serving.

Saute yellow & orange bell peppers and onion in oil until tender. Add the spinach to the pan & saute until wilted. Add the chicken stock to the pan along with the diced tomatoes. Add the drained chicken & cook for another 5 minutes. Add the cheese and stir until cheese is completely melted. Serve in a baking dish and top with the sliced mushrooms. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Trim ends from potatoes. Cut into wedges. Place potatoes in a large baking dish. Place brussels sprouts in another baking dish. Add 1/2 tsp. salt to each dish. Add 1/3 cup chicken broth to each dish. Place bay leaf in each dish. Add parsley to potatoes. Add red bell pepper to sprouts. Top each dish with a pat of softened butter. Bake for 55 minutes. Add more chicken broth if necessary. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a 2 1/2 quart baking dish with cooking spray. Place the vegetables and beets in a large bowl and toss with the oil and the vinegar. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and sprinkle with the brown sugar. Place the shiitake mushrooms on top of the vegetables and pour the remaining cider over the mixture. Bake for 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the shiitake mushrooms are golden and slightly browned. Sprinkle the vegetables with chopped parsley just before serving.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Brush chicken with honey. Combine remaining marinade ingredients in a large bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in refrigerator 8 hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Place chicken on a rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 20 minutes or until done turning and basting frequently. Garnish with green onions.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Fill 6 greased muffin cups with 1/4 cup sausage mixture. Top each with an english muffin halfcover with remaining sausage mixture and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serve immediately with ketchup and mustard if desired.

Cook rice according to package directions. Dice beef into 1-inch pieces. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add meat to the pan. Cook until browned. Add onions. Cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook for 25 minutes. Serve over rice. Top with chopped parsley.

In a large saucepan boil the potatoes until tender. Peel and dice. In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, radishes, flour, vinegar, water, salt, and ground pepper. Stir until well blended. Add the cooked potatoes. Stir until well mixed. Taste for seasoning. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

Combine all ingredients except chicken in a large bowl. Stir to blend. Add chicken. Cover. Cook on low 3-4 hours. Remove chicken from crockpot. Place on plates. Spoon juices over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 10 by 15 by 1-inch loaf pan. Sift the flour, salt, baking powder and the 1/3 cup of the sugar together into a bowl. Whisk the eggs, the vanilla extract and the remaining 2/3 cup of the sugar together in a bowl until well blended. Whisk the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until the batter is smooth. Fold the walnuts into the batter until they are coated. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Cover the pan tightly with foil or plastic wrap, making sure that the fruit is covered completely. Bake the fruitcake for about 1 hour 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the fruitcake comes out clean. Let the fruitcake stand for 15 minutes before removing it from the pan. Drizzle the fruitcake with the glaze before serving.

Butter both sides of bread. Add cooked bacon and monterey jack pepper cheese on one slice of bread. Put fresh cut tomato on other slice and place together. Place on a non stick skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In medium bowl measure 1st amount of sugar and 1/4 amount of ground nutmeg, stir. Add remaining ingredients except 1st amount of flour to rhubarb mixturestir. Pour filling into unbaked pie shell(s) (3-4). Moisten edges of pastry with cold water and cover with top crust(s). Cut slits in top crust to let steam escape. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 amount of sugar. Bake at 375 degrees for 50-60 minutes or until set.

In large saucepan combine soup and corn. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add eggs. Stir in corn mix. Drop by rounded teaspoons into 24 greased muffin cups. Bake at 375 degrees 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 1 tablespoon of salt to the boiling water. Cook the pasta for 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the broccoli florets in the oil until tender. Add the garlic and lemon juice. Cook for a few minutes. Add the cooked chicken. Stir in the chopped basil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss the chicken mixture with the pasta and serve topped with the tomatoes and a few grindings of black pepper. Serve with Parmesan.

Trim the ends of the lemongrass stalks and discard. Peel and cut the lemongrass in half lengthwise. Cut the lemongrass stalks crosswise into 1 inch pieces. Heat the oil in a wok or large saucepan over medium heat. Add the lemongrass and stir-fry for 1 minute. Remove the lemongrass from the oil with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add the remaining oil and the lime rind to the pan. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the remaining ingredients. Cook for 3 minutes and then add the chicken. Cook for 6 minutes or until the chicken is done and no longer pink. Serve hot with jasmine rice.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the ziti for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat brown the sausage until no longer pink. Add the oil. Saute the onions until tender. Drain the oil. Add the stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, oregano, salt and black pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the ziti to the stew. Cover the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Sprinkle the ziti mixture with the breadcrumbs. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle the top of the casserole with the cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more or until the cheese is melted.

Boil 2 quarts water in saucepan. Remove from heat and add tea bags. Steep for about 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and set aside to cool. Peel and section 6 navels and 2 lemons. Place fruit sections and juice from lemons and navels into large pitcher and add steeped tea and cooling water to the mixture. Stir and refrigerate until very cold, at least 3 hours. To serve, add honey and ginger ale. Makes 6 servings.

Put all ingredients into bread pan (according to manufacturer's instructions), except the skim milk powder and oil. Select the dough cycle and start the cycle. When the cycle is complete and the dough is ready to go into the oven, add the oil and skim milk powder into the dough. Then shape the dough into a loaf and let it rise for about 45 minutes until it is doubled in size (in the dough cycle the dough was already doubled). Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the top is nicely browned.

Place pork in slow cooker. Add onions and ginger ale. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours or until meat shreds easily. Add barbecue sauce. Cook for an additional 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve on hamburger buns.

Melt the butter (or margarine) and place in a greased 8x8 pan (or mini-loaf pan). Sprinkle the crushed graham cracker crumbs on top of the butter. Place a few mini marshmallows in a line across the top of the cracker crumbs (it will look like a stained glass window). Sprinkle with chocolate chips and nuts (if using). Melt the white chocolate and drizzle over the top of the cookie (like a stained glass window). Let it harden and cut into bars.

Cut meat into bite-sized pieces. Place meat into slow cooker. Add bouillon cubes to broth. Add onions and cook until tender. Add noodles, stirring to coat noodles with broth mixture. Add meat pieces to noodles, stirring to coat noodles evenly with meat mixture. Stir cornstarch into remaining liquid and pour into noodles mixture. Stir until gravy thickens. Cook for 1 to 2 hours on low heat setting or until meat is tender.

Melt the butter and cream together. Stir in sugar and corn syrup. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly for about five minutes or until it reaches 290 degrees f on a candy thermometer or until it is hard enough to drop a little ball in cold water and it will hold its shape. Stir in the almonds and continue cooking until it reaches a light golden color or about 18 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Pour into a shallow pan to cool and harden. Cut into pieces and roll in the powdered sugar.

Add all the garlic cloves to a large food processor and blend until they are a thick paste. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. In a separate bowl add the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. With a whisk or fork mix in the garlic paste and blend until the sauce is smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. To assemble serve the salad in a large bowl or platter and top with the bacon bits.

Prepare the barbecue or preheat the grill. Rub the chicken breasts with olive oil. Sprinkle the thyme leaves over each piece and season with salt and pepper. Grill until the thyme has browned and the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Transfer the breasts to a cutting board and slice. Place the slices on a serving platter and garnish with the green onions. Drizzle with the honey. Serve with the grilled jalapeños on the side.

Cream together butter and sugar until smooth and creamy. Add the egg and beat well. Add milk and beat again until well mixed. Add the dry ingredients and beat until smooth and no lumps remain. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

Add 1 cup of warm water to a large bowl. Add tomato paste and dissolve with a whisk. Add the remaining water and tomato mixture to a 5 qt. or larger slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.

In a large bowl cream together the unsalted butter and both sugars. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and beat well. Add the vanilla and beat. Add the flour mixture and beat until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts. Drop the dough by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden. Remove from sheet immediately.

Beat eggs until foamy. Add sugar and beat well. Add mashed banana and continue beating until it is smooth and thick. Add potato flour and continue beating until well blended.
