Bake in greased and floured tube pan at 425 for about 45 minutes or until the cake is golden brown and tests done. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes and remove from the pan and cool completely on a wire rack. Decorate with chocolate icing if desired.

In a large bowl combine all ingredients and mix until blended well. Pour mixture into a slow cooker. Cover slow cooker with the lid and cook on low for 2 hours or until heated through. Serve with crackers or corn tortilla chips.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and onion. Saute until tender. Add the wine. Bring to a boil. Add the beet leaves. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes. Add the bacon bits. Simmer 1 minute more. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl combine pudding mix and milk and mix well until blended and smooth. Spread the mixture into a prepared 9 inch deep-dish pie pan. Cover the mixture and refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Meanwhile in a medium saucepan over low heat combine the ice cream topping and the water and cook until thickened and slightly bubblydo not allow to boil. Remove from the heat and stir in the chocolate toffee pieces. Spread the caramel topping over the cooled pudding mixture and then spread the remaining topping over the top of the filling. Top with the remaining toffee pieces and then top the filling with the cool whip and garnish if desired. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow the topping to set.

Combine all ingredients except pineapple pieces in a small bowl. Stir with a whisk until smooth. Add pineapple pieces. Refrigerate for one hour. Preheat the broiler. Dip strips in the marinade for one minute. Place strips in a broiler-safe dish. Broil for eight minutes until meat is done.

Bring water to boil in medium saucepan. Add salt, cook for 35 minutes or until tender but still chewy. Drain well in colander, rinse under cold water and set aside until cool. Meanwhile, combine vinegar with basil in small bowl, whisking gently to combineset aside. In medium bowl combine oil with tomatoes, celery, onion and garlicset aside. In large bowl combine tomatoes, celery, onion and garlicset aside. In large bowl combine water with oilwhisk until emulsified. Drizzle dressing over vegetables in medium bowltoss gently to coat. Drizzle dressing over vegetables in bowltoss gently to coat. Drizzle dressing over vegetables in bowltoss gently to coat.

Place brisket in slow cooker and pour sweet onions and salt-free lemon pepper over brisket. Pour hickory and brown sugar barbecue sauce over brisket and salt-free lemon pepper and garlic salt to taste. Pour bourbon over brisket and add light brown sugar to taste. Cover and cook 8 hours on low or 4 hours on high. After 8 hours, remove brisket and let stand 10 to 15 minutes before slicing. Slice across grain and serve with sauce.

Preheat the oven to 250f. Place olive oil and brown sugar in small saucepan and stir until mixture is well blended. Place raisin in small bowl and add enough warm syrup to cover raisin and stir until syrup is absorbed and raisin is plump. Set aside. Combine cinnamon and flax seed in small bowl and set aside. Combine all other ingredients in medium mixing bowl and toss to coat well. Pour mixture into baking pan and bake for 45 minutes or until granola is crisp and golden brown and no longer sticky. Stir every 10-15 minutes. Cool completely before storing in airtight container or ziplock bag. Granola can be stored in refrigerator or freezer if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 9 x 13 pan. Sift together flour and powdered sugar. Cream margarine with sugar. Add eggs one at a time beating until light and fluffy. Beat in baking powder. Add flour mixture alternately with lemon juice. Fold in coconut. Spread mixture evenly into pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until light brown. Cool 10 minutescut into 24 squares.
Mix all ingredients in bread machine in order given on label for dough cycle. Note: The bread machine may be substituted with an electric mixer in the same manner.

Wash and hull the berries and remove the leaves. Halve the berries and remove the seeds if desired (or leave them in for a different look). Arrange the halves in a single layer on a baking sheet. Spread the cheese on top of each berry and sprinkle with walnuts and splenda (or sugar). Drizzle the orange extract on top and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the berry halves are just tender. Serve hot or cold. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350f and lightly grease a casserole dish. Cover chinese cabbage with boiling water and cook for about ten minutes or until tender. Drain very well. Melt butter. Add onions and peppers and cook slowly for about five minutes. Add tomatoes and heat to the boiling point. Add cabbage, salt and pepper. Pour into a baking dish, cover and bake in oven for 30 to 40 minutes.

Soak 6 ancho chile peppers in a bowl of water for 15 minutes. Remove and drain. Place chile peppers and remaining marinade ingredients in a food processor or blender and blend to a smooth consistency. Place the chicken breasts in a zip top bag and pour the marinade over the breasts. Seal the bag and refrigerate at least 1 hour. To grill the breasts, preheat grill and grill the chicken breasts over medium-high heat. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until breasts are done.

Wash and dry the produce. Cut the palm hearts in half lengthwise. Thinly slice the red onion. Peel and mince the garlic. Halve the tomatoes. Quarter the cucumber. Drain the peas and pat dry. Peel the carrot. Slice the carrot into half moons. Halve the red cabbage. Core the apple. Cut the apple into eighths. Thinly slice the radish. Pick the parsley leaves off the stems. Cut the stems away from the leaves. Cut the stems into 1-inch pieces. Peel the shallot. Thinly slice. Combine the apple, radish, parsley, shallot and capers in a large bowl. Add the vinaigrette and toss to combine. Add the romaine hearts and spinach. Toss to combine. Divide the mixture among 4 plates. Top each with a palm heart half. Arrange the carrot half moons around the sides of each plate. Top each with a quarter of the cucumber. Divide the tomato halves among each plate. Arrange the red

In a pot over medium heat add extra virgin olive oil. When oil is hot add chopped onions. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add fresh minced ginger. Cook for another 2-3 minutes or until softened. Add baby carrots and cook for 4-5 minutes. Add chicken broth. Let it come to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Let it simmer until the carrots are soft. Add honey to taste. Adjust seasonings with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot or cold.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place acorn squash cut side up on a baking sheet. Brush with melted buttersprinkle with ground cinnamon and brown sugar. Bake until softened, about 45 minutes.

Brown the filet in a little butter. Put in a pot with a little more butter and the stock. Stir in mustard. Add the prepared tomatoes and the onions and mushrooms. Bring to a boil. Simmer 25 minutes. Serve over rice. Serve with sour cream.

Dice the bacon into small pieces. In a large frying pan on medium heat, fry the bacon until crispy. Drain the bacon on paper towel. In the same frying pan, melt the butter. Stir in the flour. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the bacon, along with the salt and white pepper. Cook for another 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the milk. Add the oregano. Continue to cook for another minute. Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the cream. Cook for 1 more minute. Pour the sauce over the chicken fillets. Place the cheese on top. Bake uncovered for about 15 minutes at 400. Serve. This is a great recipe for a company lunch. It goes really well with a green salad.

Melt butter in large skillet. Add celery, green onion and garlic. Cook over medium heat until tender. Add orange juice and bring to boiling. Cook for 2 minutes, then add salt and rice. Stir to combine. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand for 15 minutes. Stir in almonds. Serve.

Cook meat and onions in a skillet until meat is browned. Drain fat from skillet. Stir in water, soup and salt and pepper to taste. Add noodles and cook until liquid is absorbed. Stir in corn and olives. Sprinkle with cheese and bake in the oven at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 10-inch tube or Bundt pan. Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Add the lemon juice and beat until the dry ingredients are incorporated. In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the butter on medium high until light in color. Add 1 cup of the sifted mixture to the butter. Beat on medium high until smooth. Add 1 cup of the remaining sifted mixture to the butter mixture. Repeat until the entire mixture is used. Reduce the mixer to medium low. Add the eggs, one at a time. Beat until smooth. Transfer the batter to the prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until the cake tests done. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before turning onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Cut off stems from caps, and discard. Discard stems from shallots and cut into quarter-sized pieces. Place the mushroom caps in the bowl of an electric mixer with the paddle attachment or in a large bowl with the flat beater of an electric mixer. Puree the caps until smooth. Pour the oil into the bowl or mixer with the cap puree. Mix in the vinegar until blended. Season with the salt to taste. Remove the thyme sprigs from the vinegar bottle, and add them to the oil mixture along with the pureed caps. Toss the mixture with the shallots to coat them with the oil mixture, and season with salt to taste. Cover the bowl or mixer with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight to allow the flavors to blend. Stir the mixture well before using it to serve as a garnish or side dish with grilled foods or roast meat.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the tuna and bring back to a boil. Add the pasta. Stir to coat and heat through. Stir in the cayenne. Sprinkle with the chopped parsley. Serve.
Cut cucumbers into thin rounds. Halve cherry and yellow pear tomatoes and cut into thirds. Add all ingredients to a large bowl and toss to combine.
Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend until well mixed. Pour mixture into a glass and top with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder and salt and stir to blend. Add the sugar and stir again to blend. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the egg and milk. Stir until the batter is just blended. Fold in the strawberries and rhubarb. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin pan. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool for a few minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm.

Cut bread into squares and toast. Mix eggs, milk and mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in cheddar cheese. Place cheddar squares on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until firm. Cool and serve.

Prepare stuffing according to package instructions. Place 1 cup of stuffing in greased 2 quart baking dish. Place half of the parmesan cheese in the dish and spread it over the top. Add half of the garlic clove and spread over the cheese. Place the remaining parmesan cheese over the garlic clove and spread it over the top. Place half of the chicken breast over the top. Place remaining half over the top and repeat process until all the chicken is covered with cheese and stuffing. Cover dish and bake for 40 minutes at 350f. Serve with your favorite gravy or sauce.

Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Spoon a teaspoonful of the mixture over a fish fillet. Grill the fillet over medium heat for 15 minutes or broil for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with parsley.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine pears with pumpkin pie spice. Place pears on baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with chopped pistachios. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

In a large pot of boiling water, boil the sweet potatoes for 15 minutes until tender. Drain the sweet potatoes and cut them into chunks or cubes. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sausage, sweet potatoes, apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt. Pour the water in slowly until the mixture is a thick batter. Bake the batter in a greased casserole dish for 50 minutes at 350F until the top is nicely browned. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a glass bowl, combine the salmon with the Italian dressing. Add the mushrooms and the green onions. Season with salt and pepper. Place the bowl into a 9x13" glass baking dish. Pour the tomato juice into the bottom of the dish. Place into the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is flakey. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add green onions and cook for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and add the lemon juice, salt and pepper and stir well. Add the shrimp and stir to coat evenly with the sauce. Cook the shrimp for 4 minutes or until opaque and pink throughout. Sprinkle with the chopped parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Peel the potatoes and slice thinly. Wash the leeks thoroughly and slice thinly discarding about the last 2 inches of the green tops. Mix together the flour, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Grease a casserole dish. Put in alternate layers of potatoes and leeks sprinkling each layer with the seasoned flour and small chips of butter. The top layer should be potatoes. Dot the top with butter, pour hot milk on top of the casserole. Bake in the oven uncovered for about 1 hour.

Cut ginger into 1/8-inch rounds and place in sterile jars. Combine sugar, vinegar, water and salt in saucepan. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and pour over ginger. Let stand for 2 days before using. Keep refrigerated after opening.

Preheat oven 160c. Grease and line 20 x 20 cm square pan. Put 10 dried dates into a bowl of boiling water for 5 minutes. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. Melt 100g soft brown sugar in a pot, stir in 40g crystallized ginger and 75ml water over low heat until dissolved. Set aside to cool. Put the remaining 250g soft brown sugar into a large bowl with 150g butter at room temperature. Beat until light and fluffy, then beat in the cooled ginger mixture. Stir in 2 teaspoons of bicarbonate of soda and 3 eggs. Sift together 600g self-raising flour and 4 teaspoons of bicarbonate of soda into the mixture and beat until smooth. Spoon into the prepared tin and smooth the top. Bake for 45 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean when inserted into the centre of the cake. Leave to cool on a

Saute garlic powder and green bell peppers and sliced mushrooms together. Add tomatoes and saute for 5 minutes. Add long grain rice and seasonings. Add water and condensed chicken broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 45 minutes. Serve.

Saute the onion and garlic in the olive oil. Add the jalapenos and saute for about 3 minutes more or until the jalapenos are tender. Add the apple cider vinegar, brown sugar and salt to taste. Add the spinach, cover and simmer for 2 minutes or until the spinach is tender. Stir in the bacon. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Slice the brussel sprouts in half. Toss the sliced sprouts in a large bowl with the garlic, onion, olive oil and season lightly. Place the sprouts on a rimmed sheet pan and drizzle the vinegar over them. Bake the sprouts for about 30-35 minutes until softened. Remove from the oven, drizzle the butter on top of the sprouts and sprinkle them lightly with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

Place sunflower seeds and sunflower oil in a food processor and blend until smooth and thick. Add the sugar and salt and blend until incorporated and smooth. Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to one week or in the freezer for up to one month. Serve on crackers, toast or bread as a spread or dip.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the popcorn, nuts, brown sugar and butter. Cook for 5 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat. In a medium mixing bowl, beat together the corn syrup, brown sugar and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Pour over cooked mixture. Stir until evenly coated. Pour into a 9x9 baking pan. Bake at 250f for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the flour and stir for about 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the milk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the cheeses and stir until melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the salt and pepper. Mix in the ham and stir well. Pour the filling into the pastry shell and bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 5 to 10 minutes before cutting.
Combine all ingredients in a blender or mixer container. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. Makes about 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8x8x2-inch baking pan. In a large bowl combine the garbanzo beans, sugar, oil, vanilla extract and baking powder. Whisk until well blended. Add the cinnamon and saltwhisk until well combined. Stir in the oats until well combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan. Bake for approximately 20 minutes or until the edges are slightly browned. Let cool completely before cutting into bars. Makes about 24 bars.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with the water to make a slurry. In a large pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the pork cutlets and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Remove from the pan. In a small bowl, mix the breadcrumbs with the parsley. Season with the salt. Set aside. In a large bowl, mix the jam with the stock. Set aside. Take the cooked pork cutlets out of the pan. Place each cutlet between two sheets of plastic wrap. Using a meat mallet or rolling pin, flatten the cutlet to about 1/4 inch thick. Brush the cutlet with the egg. Dip the cutlet in the breadcrumb mixture. Dip the cutlet in the stock mixture. Place the cutlet in a large baking pan. Repeat with the remaining cutlets. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the crust is golden. Remove from the oven. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, combine the whipping cream and pumpkin puree over medium heat until the puree is hot and the cream is steaming and beginning to thicken. Gradually stir in the brown sugar until the mixture is smooth and the brown sugar has dissolved. Stir in the cumin, chili powder, coriander, and nutmeg and season with salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl, stir together the cheese and cilantro until the cheese is melted and the cilantro is distributed evenly. Ladle the hot soup into bowls and top each bowl with the cheese mixture.

Cover a 9x13 baking dish with aluminum foil. Spread 1/3 of the corn tortilla halves over the bottom of the dish. Divide chicken among the tortilla halves. Top each serving with 1/4 cup each of the cheeses and 1/4 cup each of the vegetables. Pour the milk and sour cream into a small bowl. Whisk to blend. Pour the milk mixture over the chicken. Cover dish with the remaining foil. Bake at 350 degrees f for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes longer. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with corn chips.

In shallow bowl, combine egg substitute, milk, cinnamon and nutmeg. In nonstick skillet, over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon margarine. Dip bread slices in egg mixture to coat. Transfer to skillet. Brown about 3 minutes on each side. Top with Special K cereal if desired. Serve immediately.

Spread cream cheese in a small bowl. Add the rest of the stuffing in a separate bowl. Dip the back of a fork in water and gently poke holes into the cheese. Then dip the fork in the stuffing and roll it around in the cheese. Place the cheese on a plate. Keep refrigerated.

Pre heat oven to 350f. In medium bowl combine cracker crumbs and flourmix well. In small bowl, combine eagle brand and margarine. Beat with a fork until smooth. Stir in dry mixture. Stir in raisins and coconut. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute. Transfer to wire racks. Cool completely. Store covered at room temperature.

Pound the meat to a thin spread. Mix seasonings and oil. Sear meat in oil. Let cool. Place on roll. Mayonnaise on top of meat. Roll up. Place in pan with water to cover. Bake for 30-45 minutes at 350.

Preheat oven to 350. Clean peppers, remove stems, seeds. Place in large pot of water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Drain. Stuff peppers with the beef mixture. Combine butter with breadcrumbs. Roll each stuffed pepper in crumb mixture to coat. Place peppers in a greased baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes in 350 degree oven. Serve hot.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the green beans to the boiling water. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Rinse under cold water to cool. Set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the curry paste and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add the pork and stir-fry for another 2 minutes. Add the chicken stock and fish sauce and bring to a boil. Add the shrimp. Return the green beans to the pan. Add the palm sugar and stir-fry until the green beans are tender. Remove from the heat. Add the lime leaves and stir for a few seconds. Serve immediately.

Stuffing ingredients in order: Place one slice of the bread on the counter with the cut side facing upward. Put about two teaspoons of cream cheese on the bread and spread it out so that it is about half an inch thick. Sprinkle about one teaspoon of garlic salt over the cream cheese. Put about two ounces of bacon on the cream cheese spread. Put one teaspoon of the Parmesan cheese on the bacon. Place another slice of bread on the counter with the cut side facing downward. Place the slice of bread on the one slice of bread that has all the toppings on it. Press the two slices of bread together firmly so that the toppings stick to the bread. Cut off about a one-inch piece from the edge of the bread to give you a square of bread to place your finger underneath the bread so that it will lift easily out of the pan. Place the bread on the bottom of the pan (if you are using a glass pan, it will probably help to use aluminum foil). Put the chicken breast on top of the bread. Fold the two sides of
In a large container, combine the frozen lemonade, orange extract and water. In a large punch bowl, stir in the punch mixture. Add the 7-up. Serve over ice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Cut crusts into 8 pieces and place 1 piece into each of 8 ramekins or custard cups and press into the bottom and sides of each cup to form a shell about 2 inches high. Place 1 piece of salmon into each of the custard cups and top with 1/4 cup of chopped onion and 1/4 cup of chopped fresh broccoli and 1/4 cup of chopped fresh chives. Break 1 egg into each custard cup and pour 1 1/2 tablespoons of whipping cream into each of the custard cups. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of red cayenne pepper and 1/8 teaspoon of dried dill weed and 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh chives and bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown and puffy. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

In a small bowl beat together eggs and milk. Beat in sugar and vanilla extract. Stir in the cream cheese until smooth and blended. Spread the cream cheese mixture on half the bread and top with half the fruit of your choice. Place the remaining half of the cream cheese mixture on the second half of the bread and top with the remaining half of the fruit of your choice. Heat a griddle over medium-low heat and grease lightly with cooking spray. Place the sandwiches on the griddle and cook until lightly browned on both sides and the fruit is lightly browned. Cut sandwiches in half and serve immediately.

In a small saucepan, melt 4 tablespoons of unsalted butter. Stir in the lemon juice and the crushed red pepper flakes. Add 2 teaspoons of the prepared butter mixture to the shrimpstir to coat. Heat the broiler with rack set 3 inches from the heat source. Spray a small nonstick baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange the shrimp in the baking dish in a single layer. Broil 3 to 4 minutes or until the shrimp are pink and opaque. Sprinkle the broiled shrimp with the remaining prepared butter mixture. Serve immediately.

Combine all filling ingredients in a large bowlstir with a wire whisk until mixture is thickened. Pour into the prepared pastry shellset aside for 20 minutes. Cover edges of crust with strips of foil to prevent overbrowning. Bake at 400 deg. F for 45 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out cleancool on a wire rack for one hour before serving with whipped cream, if desired.

Preheat oven to 180c. Line a lamington tin with baking paper. Combine the butter and golden syrup in a saucepan over low heat. Cook for 5 minutes or until combined. Add the biscuit crumbs and slivered almonds to the butter mixture. Cook for a further minute. Remove from the heat and stir through the copha. Place the mixture in the prepared tin. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Crumble the chocolate over the top and place the lamington tin in the fridge for 15 minutes or until the chocolate is set. Lift the slice out of the tin and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Slice into squares and serve.

Mix egg, mayonnaise, Italian seasonings and Old Bay Seasoning. Stir in zucchini and onion. Mix in bread crumbs and season to taste with salt and pepper. Shape into cakes. Dip into egg and coat with bread crumbs. Deep-fry at 375 degrees f until golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, combine the butter, sugar and eggs. In a separate medium bowl, combine the flour with the orange zest and the orange juice. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry, then fold in the orange juice, water and vanilla extract. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake the pound cake for 45 to 50 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Set aside to cool completely. Once the cake is completely cool, top it with the frosting by spooning some of the frosting on the top of the cooled cake layer then spreading it out. Top with another layer of frosting. Place the frosted cake in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving. To serve, drizzle with the warm caramel sauce (see recipe).

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease cookie sheet. In a large bowl beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add milk and beat until incorporated. Add dry ingredients in 3 additions and beat on low speed until incorporated (do not overbeat). Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake about 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Remove cookies to wire rack to cool completely.

Melt butter with brown sugar and treacle in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and boil for a couple of minutes. Remove from heat and add eggs one at a time, beating well after each one. Sift together plain flour and self raising flour, add the spices and mix together. Gradually add this mixture to the boiling mixture, beating constantly until it comes together as a smooth batter. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about ten minutes until the dough is soft and supple. Roll out into a large rectangle about one centimetre thick. Using a sharp knife cut out shapes about eight centimetres long by four centimetres wide. Place on a lightly greased baking tray about two centimetres apart from each other. Bake in a preheated oven at 180c for about twenty minutes until lightly brown. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack before transferring the lebkuchen to tins or decorating as desired.

Prepare a 10-by-15-inch baking dish by coating it with cooking spray. Combine the corn, black pepper, and nutmeg in a bowl. Place the bowl in the freezer for 10 minutes. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the onionscook until they begin to soften. Stir in the corn mixturecook for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Pour the mixture into the baking dish. Crack the eggs into a large bowladd the milk. Whisk the eggs until blended. Pour the eggs into the baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheddar. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until the eggs are cooked and the mixture is golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Mix all vegetables and herbs in a large bowl. Heat margarine in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add vegetable mixture and cook 10 minutes. Cover and cook until all vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Drizzle with lemon juice. Garnish with chopped fresh basil and marjoram, if desired. Serve hot or warm.

Whip together the brown sugar and whole milk until thickened (about 2 minutes). Stir in the heavy cream until combined. Set aside until room temperature. In a separate bowl beat together the egg yolks until thick and pale yellow. Gradually beat the sugar mixture into the yolk mixture. Mix together the whole milk mixture with the brown sugar mixture until combined. Pour the milk mixture into the yolk mixture and beat until smooth. Stir in the gingerroot (grated) until combined. Pour into an ice-cream maker and churn according to manufacturer's instructions until set. Transfer the honey ginger ice-cream into a plastic freezer container, seal it tightly and freeze overnight before serving.

Mix honey and 1 cup of the milk in a small saucepan and place over medium-low heat. Cook until the honey is dissolved. Whisk in the remaining 1-1/2 cups of milk and the ginger and cloves. Cook for 5 minutes. Whisk in the cocoa and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 3 minutes more. Stir in the pepper. Pour the chocolate into 4 mugs. Stir in 1 tablespoon of the vanilla. Top each mug with a dollop of the remaining 3 tablespoons of the vanilla. Garnish each mug with a dollop of the whipped cream.

Brown spaghetti in boiling water. Cook for about 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain and return to pot. Mix together soup and sour cream. Stir in mushrooms and parsley. Toss with pasta. Add turkey and heat through. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Mix cereal, garlic powder and spaghetti sauce mix in a large bowl. Stir in oil. Place in a resealable plastic bag. Add pretzel nuggets. Close the bag. Shake to coat. Transfer to a cookie sheet. Bake at 275° for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes about 2 cups.

In large non-stick frying pan brown pork chops. Drain off excess fat. Add dry onion soup mix to pan. Sprinkle evenly over browned meat. Drain mixed vegetables. Stir into pan. Add uncooked rice. Stir to coat with liquid. Add beef broth. Cover. Cook on medium heat until liquid is absorbed. Remove cover. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until done. Serve hot.
In a large fry pan, combine the oil, butter, mushrooms, garlic, chives and salt & pepper. Cook on low heat for 10 minutes stirring frequently until mushrooms are tender.

Pour milk over tea bags in large saucepanbring milk just to the boiling point (but do not allow to boil). Add sugar and cinnamonstir until dissolved. Pour mixture into bowlrefrigerate until cold. Serve as a dessert or drink.

Soak whole green cardamom seeds with water for 10 minutes. Heat 2 tbsp vegetable oil in a large pan. Add whole seeds to hot oil. Fry for 30 seconds. Add onions and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add passata, turmeric and cardamom. Stir to combine. Add 1 cup of water. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add 3 tbsp of curry massalla powder. Simmer for 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt. Transfer to a large saucepan. Cook on medium heat for 30 minutes.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shallot and saute until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in Hungarian Paprika and tomatoes. Add chicken stock, bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Add potatoes to skillet along with sauteed shallot mixture. Mash with a potato masher or an electric mixer until desired consistency is achieved. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in sour cream and garnish with fresh parsley if desired.

Line a baking sheet with foil (for easy cleanup). Lay out the tortillas on the pan. Place a little enchilada sauce in each tortilla. Place the onion slices on top of the sauce on each tortilla. Fold in the edges of the tortilla so the sauce stays in the middle. Roll up the tortilla tightly. Place the rolls seam side down on the foiled pan. Cover the pan with foil and bake in the pre-heated oven at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Clean and cut the broccoli into small florets. Put 1 Tbsp vegetable oil into a wok. Add the broccoli and stir fry for 5 minutes. Add red chili pepper and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add 1 Tbsp dark soy sauce. Stir fry for 30 seconds. Turn off the heat. Add 1 Tbsp chopped garlic. Stir fry for 30 seconds. Transfer the stir fried broccoli to serving bowl. Enjoy.

Brown chicken halves in butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes or until the sauce is thickened and the cheese melts. Serve with rice.
Blend cream, lemon juice and sugar. Add low-fat cream cheese and blend until soft peaks form. Spoon into dessert dishes. Garnish with fresh mint, if desired. Refrigerate until serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a 12 inch ovenproof skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and scallions and cook for 30 seconds. Add the scallops to the pan and cook for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until lightly browned. Add the wine, bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Add the cream, salt and pepper. Heat until hot and the cream begins to boil. Serve the scallops and the cream in the ovenproof skillet.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment or grease with cooking spray or butter. In large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed beat cheese and butter until mixture is creamy and smooth. Add egg and vanillabeat until blended. Add chocolate cake mixbeat until smooth and creamy. Divide dough into 2 piecesplace each on lightly greased cutting board. Roll each piece into a log, about 12 inches long and 3 inches in diameter. Place 1 log on prepared cookie sheet and form into 12 to 15-inch long rope, about 1/2-inch thick. Place rope on cookie sheet and shape into a braid, using the tines of a fork to keep strands from unraveling. Place 1 tsp. jam on top of each braid and then wrap the other side of braid around jam to secure. Repeat with remaining dough and jam, shaping 24 braids in all. Bake for 25 minutes or until light brown and set. Let cool on cookie sheets for 5

Remove stem from tomato. Core tomato with small spoon. Mix breadcrumbs, cheese, herbs, salt and pepper in small bowl. Coat tomato with butter, then coat with the cheese mixture. Bake at 400 degrees f for 30 minutes or until tender.

Spread lettuce leaves on plates. Arrange fruit on leaf. Put sour cream on top of fruit. Put a dollop of sour cream on each leaf. Put a dollop of sour cream on top of each leaf. Top with banana and maraschino cherries. Garnish with flaked coconut. Serve.
Fry the meat in the oil. Add soy sauce and pepper to the meat. Add the broth to the meat. Add the Chinese cabbage. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with the Chow mein noodles.
Mix all ingredients in saucepan. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the crumb mixture to each breast half. Flip and repeat on the other side. Place the breast halves in the prepared pan. Brush the remaining crumb mixture over the breasts. Bake for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley and drizzle with the remaining tablespoon of butter.

In large sauce pan cook cheddar cheese with ham over low heat. When cheese is melted add black olives and red onion. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Transfer ham mixture into a large bowl. In the same pan cook pasta according to package directions and add broccoli. Pour ham mixture into large bowl and add cooked broccoli and pasta. Pour dressing over mixture and mix. Cover and refrigerate.

Slice the bread into strips 1/2-inch thick. Put the strips into the margarine or butter. Spread with onion or garlic salt. Sprinkle with corn flakes and Parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees until the cheese is bubbly brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 180c. Place eggs into a medium sized bowl with salt and whisk to combine. Gradually add whole milk while whisking constantly until the mixture is thickened. In a saucepan, stir together the maple syrup and water over medium heat until the maple syrup has dissolved and the liquid has heated through. Whisk the warm maple syrup into the eggs while the eggs are still whisking, whisking constantly until the mixture has thickened again. Remove the mixture from heat and add the ground nutmeg. Pour the mixture into a medium sized bowl to cool. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until cold to the touch before using. Use the mixture to fill a 5cm ring mould or other mould that is 5cm tall. Place the mould into a larger bowl. Fill the bowl to within 1cm of the rim with hot water until the water reaches 1/4 way up the sides of the mould. Place the mould into the hot water bath and bake at 180c for 1 hour until set. Turn the mould out onto a

Mix meat, onion, green pepper and mushroom in a large bowl. Form into 24 patties and place on a broiler pan. Broil 4-5 minutes each side or grill 8-10 minutes each side or fry 2-3 minutes each side or microwave 45 seconds each side. Cover patties with prepared mustard. Top with relish and cheese. Place one slice of cheese between each patty and grill or broil 20-30 seconds or microwave 10 seconds or place in a large frying pan and fry 2 minutes each side. Place between hot dog buns and serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine ground pork, green onions and hoisin sauce. Stir in soy sauce. Add water chestnuts and mix well. Mix in egg. Divide filling into thirds. Place each portion of filling between two wontons and pinch to seal. Drop 6-8 at a time into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with soy sauce.

Chop chilies finely. Place in a bowl and pour over the soy sauce. Stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove from refrigerator. Drain the chilies well. Set aside. Heat oil in a skillet. Brown the chicken on both sides. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the vinegar and sugar. Set aside. Preheat grill to medium-high. Place a slice of cheese on each bread roll half. Place the cheese side down on the grill. Top each cheese slice with a slice of cooked chicken. Place a slice of cheese on each bottom bread roll half. Place the cheese side down on the grill. Place the roll tops over the cheese and close the grill. Cook until the cheese is melted and the bread rolls are toasted. Serve the roll tops topped with the green chili mixture.

In a pan, heat 2 tbsp. of the butter over moderately high heat. Stir in the flour until smooth. Slowly add the milk to make a smooth roux. Whisk in the garlic. Season to taste. Add the chicken stock. Cook over moderately low heat until the thickness is desired. Add the chopped chicken. Cook until the chicken is heated through. Add the rest of the butter. Stir in the chopped parsley. Add the cooked penne. Stir to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle Parmesan on top.

In small saucepan, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until tender. Stir in cayenne pepper and cook for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in bacon. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. In same pan, add butter and melt. Place oysters on pan and cook until lightly browned. Remove from heat and drain. Transfer to ungreased casserole dish. Top with seasoned bread crumbs. Place bacon pieces on top of crumbs. Sprinkle with Parmesan Cheese. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 20 minutes. Serve.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onions and mace in the butter for 15 minutes stirring constantly, or until the onions are soft and clear. Whisk in the flour until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Whisk in the milk, cooking over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 10 to 15 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly. Whisk in the broth and bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Whisk in the yolks and continue boiling until the mixture is slightly thickened. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste and stir in the parsley. Serve the hot soup with a dollop of sour cream or crème fraiche for garnish.

In a small saucepan over low heat melt butter, stirring constantly until melted. Add orange liqueur to butter mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until butter mixture is slightly thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in orange zest until flavors are blended. Remove from heat. Stir in salt. Stir in pecan halves. Transfer to a large sheet pan lined with wax paper. Spread out mixture evenly to form one layer. Refrigerate for 10 minutes or until mixture is firm. Store pecans in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 4 months.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. In a small bowl combine the first 4 ingredients. Place the pork loin chops in a shallow baking dish and pour the seasoning mixture over them. Let marinate for 15-20 minutes. Place the seasoned chops on the grill and cook for 8-10 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Serve immediately.

Spread 1/4 cup margarine on one slice of whole wheat bread and spread tomato slices and half of yellow bell pepper slices over margarine. Layer with swiss cheese and sliced olives and another slice of whole wheat bread, margarine side down. Place sandwich on heated griddle and cook until golden brown and cheese is melted.

In large pot, bring water and salt to a boil. Add carrots and boil for 8 minutes. Drain and cool. Meanwhile, saute onion and flour in butter in a large skillet. Stir in mustard and pepper. Cook until thickened. Add cooked carrots. Drain milk and add to pot. Cook and stir until thickened. Transfer to a greased 11 x 7 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with swiss cheese and bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes.

Mix all spices together in a small bowl. Rub spice mixture over each piece of chicken and place in a shallow baking dish. Bake in preheated 425 degree F. oven for about 15 minutes for medium-sized pieces of chicken. Brush with the sweet chili sauce and serve with a side of the grilled scallions and the grilled ginger.

Add all the ingredients except for the cheese to a large bowl and mix well. Shape into small balls and place in an ungreased casserole dish. Top each ball with a shredded slice of parmesan cheese and pour the tomato sauce over them. Bake for about an hour or until the sauce is bubbling and the cheese is melted and browned. Serve over spaghetti or with your favorite pasta sauce.

Rinse pheasants. Pat dry with paper towels. Combine lemon juice, thyme, tarragon, garlic powder and black pepper. Rub inside of birds with this mixture then rub with honey to coat. Place pheasants on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Bake at 325 for 3 hours. For extra flavor and juiciness, place a small pan of water on the bottom of the roasting pan and add a few shallow cups of water to the pan 15 minutes before the pheasants are done cooking.

Prepare corn and edamame for steamingsteam together in a sauce pan for 20 minutes or until tender. Once steamed allow to cool. Heat olive oil and butter together in a sauce pan over medium heat. Saute red onion for about 3 minutes or until tenderadd corn mixtureseason with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes or until mixture is heated throughremove from heat. To serve place mixture on plattertop with chopped fresh basil. Serves 6.

Put all of the plums in a medium saucepan with just enough water to cover them. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for about 10 minutes until tender, turning halfway through cooking time. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Use a potato masher to smash some of the plums (I like to reserve some whole plums to add back to the finished jam for texture). Strain the plums through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl. Discard the seeds. Measure 4 cups of plum juice (you may need to add more to get to 4 cups). Add the plum juice to a large saucepan with the remaining 1 cup of water and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Once boiling, add ginger, lemon rind, and salt to taste (I like to taste as I go along and add more salt as needed). Reduce heat to low and simmer gently for about 15 minutes until mixture thickens slightly and ginger is softened, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking to bottom of saucepan. Add
Mix all the ingredients together. Press into a greased 9x13 baking dish and refrigerate overnight. Cut into bars.

Beat the egg whites until stiff but not dry. Mix in the brown sugar until well combined. Fold in the seasoning salt, curry powder, cumin seed and ground red pepper. Add the nuts and fold together until all the nuts are covered in the mixture. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 2000F for about 1 hour or until the mixture is hardened and no longer sticky. Turn out on a large platter or tray and cool completely. Store in airtight containers in a cool dry place for up to 1 month.

Prepare a large saucepan by adding the oil and sautéing the onion and carrot until softened. Add the water and bring it to a boil. Add the chicken, cover and cook for about 20 minutes or until tender and juices run clear. Remove the meat and set aside and keep warm. Add the milk and sour cream and bring it to a boil and then cook for about 10 minutes. Add the seasoning and cook for a few more minutes then add the chicken back into the saucepan and cook for another five minutes or until the sauce thickens. Serve the chicken over rice or noodles and garnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine crackers, brown sugar, baking powder and salt. Mix in egg and milk. Stir in flour, blending until a soft dough is formed. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto greased or nonstick cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly brown. Cool on racks. Remove from pan and cut into 12 squares or diamonds.

Spoon enchilada sauce into a 3 quart baking dish. Place 12 stuffed poblanos in sauce. Top each with 1/4 cup of potato mixture. Sprinkle each with 2 Tbsp of chorizo sausage. Cover dish with foil. Bake in preheated oven 350 for 20 minutes. Uncover dish. Bake 10 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Clean and slice mushrooms. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and sauté for 5 minutes. Add wine and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add cream and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place salmon on top of the cream and mushrooms and cook for 5-6 minutes. Place a piece of lemon over the fish and season fish lightly with salt and pepper. Spoon mushroom sauce over salmon. Garnish with fresh tarragon and a squeeze of fresh lemon.

Grease bottom of crock pot with olive oil or nonstick cooking spray. Layer a third of the potatoes (leave the last third for last) onto bottom of crock pot. Sprinkle with a little black pepper and a little chopped pimiento over potato layer. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used upset aside remaining pimiento. Pour soup into crock pot. Add milk to taste. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hoursstir occasionally. Before serving, sprinkle with reserved chopped pimiento.

Mix the egg, sugar, vanilla and butter until creamy. Sift together flour and baking powder then add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix until smooth. Pour in a greased baking dish about 8x11x1 inch or a bundt pan. Bake at 180 c for about an hour or until golden brown. Let cool then fill with jam. Make cream by mixing heavy cream and powdered sugar together. Frost with cream when cold.

Peel potatoes. Chop into small pieces. Cut green pepper into 1/2 inch pieces and slice onion into 1/2 inch pieces. Place in a large saucepan with margarine. Season with Onion soup mix, stirring to coat potatoes with seasoning. Stir in chopped vegetables and cook over low heat until tender, 15 to 20 minutes.

Clean and de-stem fresh peas and place in boiling water. Cook 10 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain and cool. In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise with pimiento and salt and pepper. Add peas and stir gently until coated and chilled. Refrigerate. Yield: 8 servings.

Saute the onions in the butter until they are tender. Add the condensed soups to the onions. Stir in the milk and half-and-half and bring to a boil. Stir in the sherry and crab meat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Wash the strawberry well with water and cut them in half or quarters depending on the size of the fruit. Rinse the oranges with cold water, remove the skin with a knife and cut in half. Peel the oranges with a knife to remove the skin. Cut the oranges in half again. Remove the seeds from the pomegranates with a knife. Rinse the oranges with water to remove the seeds. Place the oranges, the pomegranates and the strawberry in a bowl with the lemon juice and the orange juice with the sugar added to it. Put the mint leaves in a bowl and pour over the fruit mixture. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Pour the whisky into a highball glass. Squeeze the lime and rub the rind around the inside rim of the glass. Add the lime juice and sugar. Fill with crushed ice. Stir. Garnish with lime.

Rinse the mint leaves and pat dry with paper towels. Set aside. Mince the rosemary, put it in a bowl with the vinegar and sugar, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Whisk in the mint leaves, tasting the dressing as you go. Serve immediately over salads or steaks or chopsit goes well with chicken too! (You can use any other combination of fresh herbs in the mint and rosemary version.) Mint works great with any fresh pork or pork tenderloinit's also great over chicken or steak. I use mint in my baked chicken dish when I've run out of rosemary or thyme or oregano or whatever I've used for the last chicken dinner I made! (Note: You can use dried mint, if you don't have fresh.)

Grease 9 x 13 inch casserole dish. Add cheese and crackers. Pour milk over crackers. Place hamburgers in casserole. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Whisk together egg and green pepper. Pour over burgers. Bake at 350 degrees for 55 minutes. Serves 6.

Cream the butter and granulated sugar together in a large bowl. Beat in the egg and orange extract until well combined. Add the orange zest and orange juice. Gradually beat in the flour mixture. Mix until smooth. Stir in the cream cheese until smooth and creamy. Pour the batter into a greased 11x7x2-inch (3-quart) casserole dish or a greased 11x7-inch (3-quart) glass dish. Spread the batter evenly in the pan. Bake for about 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool completely before cutting into squares. Cool completely on a wire rack before serving.

Preheat the grill or frying pan to medium-high heat. Cut the tomatoes into quarters and remove the seeds. Blend the tomatoes with the garlic and a good pinch of salt & pepper. Add the flour and blend until smooth. Add the egg yolk and mix until a soft dough is formed. Cut the dough into small pieces of equal size and roll each piece into a ball between your palms. Roll each ball in flour then dip it into the beaten egg. Place the balls onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Fry the balls over medium-high heat for about 3-4 minutes until golden brown. Transfer the balls to a plate with kitchen paper to drain the excess fat. Sprinkle with a little salt & pepper then drizzle with the olive oil. Sprinkle with mint leaves and serve hot or cold.

Boil water for pasta. Cook the pasta for about 10 minutes until tender. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a medium size saucepan on medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until the garlic is fragrant. Add the thyme and rosemary and cook for about 2 minutes until fragrant. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for about 2 minutes until the shrimp are pink on both sides. Remove the pan from heat and add the juice from the limes to the pan. Drain the pasta and add it to the pan along with the pasta water and the black pepper, cayenne pepper, salt, and the juice from the lime. Stir to combine all the flavors. Cook for about 3 minutes more until the pasta is tender. Serve immediately.

Peel or cut off ends of baby carrots. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Drain carrots, reserving 1 cup of cooking liquid. Return to hot water, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Drain again. Return to hot water, cover and simmer for another 10 minutes. Drain again. Combine remaining 1 cup of cooking liquid with 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 cup butter (melted). Stir in bourbon (if using). Toss well to coat. Pour over carrots, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.

Cut a slit in one side of the prosciutto to make a pocket. Place a small dollop of mozzarella in the center of the prosciutto. Roll up the prosciutto around the cheese. Dip a toothpick in the olive oil and press into the top of the prosciutto. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake in a 350 degree oven for about 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and dip the tops in the balsamic vinegar. Serve with mixed salad greens and cranberry sauce.

Preheat oven to 400. Wash the cauliflower and cut into small florets. Drizzle the margarine over the florets and coat with the italian seasoning. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until the florets are tender.

Cut radishes into thin wedges. Cut yellow bell pepper into strips. Cut carrots into matchsticks. In a large bowl, toss together the peppers, radishes, and carrots. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the mustard oil, white wine vinegar, sugar, black pepper, and dill. Season with salt to taste. Pour over vegetables and toss to coat. Let stand for 20 minutes before serving.

In a saucepan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sausage to the pan and cook for about 3 minutes or until the sausage is browned and cooked through. Add garlic and onions to the pan and cook for another minute or two. Add carrots, broth, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 10 minutes or until carrots are tender and broth is reduced by half. Add kale, pasta and seasonings to the pan. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until kale is tender. Ladle into serving bowls and sprinkle additional parmesan cheese if desired.

Boil a medium saucepan of water. Add cumin seeds and pine nuts. Cook for 3 minutes. Add 2 cups of cold water. Add pine nuts. Stir in cooked chicken and add dried apricots and sultanas. Boil for 3 minutes. Add cooked couscous. Add fresh mint. Add french dressing to taste.

Prepare the salad by chopping the mushrooms and red onions and mixing with the Italian Dressing. In the meantime, place the salmon in a plastic bag and pour in the water and lemon juice. Close and refrigerate for an hour or two before cooking. Preheat the broiler and place the salmon on the rack. Brush the top with the remaining Italian Dressing. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
In small bowl, mix together honeydew balls, yogurt, honey, vanilla extract, and lime juice. Place in serving bowl. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, mix the noodles with the marinade. Set aside. In a wok or large frypan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the fish fillets and saute until they begin to colour. Add the red capsicum and saute for 2 minutes. Add the broccoli florets and saute for 2 minutes. Add the teriyaki marinated noodles. Stir-fry for 5 minutes or until all of the noodles are soft. Add the red spanish onion. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until soft. Add the prawns. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until the prawns are cooked through. Serve.
Saute margarine and shallots in saucepan. Add green beans. Stir in chicken stock. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in parmesan.

Dip fish fillets into egg, then coat with flour, cornmeal and salt and pepper. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry fish for about 4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine berries and 1/4 cup of the sugar in a blender and process until smooth. In a separate bowl, beat remaining 1/4 cup of the sugar and sour cream together until soft peaks form. Add berry puree and stir. Stir in whipped topping. Spoon into dessert dishes and refrigerate until serving.
Soak rice in water for 20 minutes. Drain. Combine all other ingredients. Mix well. Stir in rice. Pour into a 2 qt casserole dish. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes. Serve hot.
Add all ingredients except the water into the blender. Blend on high speed for 30 seconds. Stir in the water. Serve over ice. Top with whipped cream if desired.

Cook the bacon in a small frying pan. Strain the bacon. Stir the zucchini and cherry tomatoes in the pan until they are soft. Add the spaghetti. Heat a little oil in a large frying pan. Add the pesto sauce. Cook for a few minutes until the sauce is hot. Stir the sauce into the spaghetti. Season to taste. Sprinkle the cheese over the top.

Fry the bacon in the pan and drain off the fat. Crumble the bacon and set aside. Fry the chopped red and green peppers in the bacon grease for about 3 minutesset aside. In another pan, fry the chopped onions in the pan for about 5 minutesset aside. In the last pan, crack the eggs into the pan and add the red and green peppers and the chopped bacon to the eggs and stir until the eggs are just cooked and the mixture is well blended. Sprinkle with the colby and chedder cheeses and serve hot!

Prepare the chickpeas according to the package instructions. Drain the chickpeas. In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, garlic, feta, hot sauce and seasonings. Puree until smooth. Serve with pita bread.

Put water in a pot and add crushed red pepper flakes, whole cloves and cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat slightly to keep it just below a simmer. Add ground coffee beans to the pot. Cover and let steep for 6 minutes. Remove lid and stir in honey and coconut milk. Serve hot.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the potatoes. Reduce heat to simmercook about 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a small bowl stir together the olive oil, whole grain Dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper. Place the potatoes in a large bowl. Pour the dressing over the potatoes. Add the cooked bacon, green onions, and parsley. Toss to coat. Serve warm. Refrigerate leftovers. Reheat in a 350 degree F. oven or in a microwave.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl cream the butter and sugars together until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla until smooth and creamy. Sift together the dry ingredients and add them to the creamed mixturebeat well. Press into a greased and floured 9x9 inch pan (a glass baking dish works well). Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Cook couscous according to package instructions. Drain. In a large skillet melt 1 tablespoon of the butter with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the onions and garlic and cook over moderate heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, add the curry powder, the cumin, the cinnamon, the salt and the black pepper. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the chicken to the pan with the vegetables. Stir in the peas. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Cook the mixture for 10 minutes more. Fluff the couscous. Serve the mixture in deep soup bowls. Top each serving with raisins. Serve the couscous hot. Makes 4 servings.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook until golden brown and bubbly. Remove and drain on paper towels. Add a slice to each of two sandwiches and spread each side evenly with olive salad. Add mortadella and ham on each sandwich and spread remaining olive salad evenly over each sandwich. Place one sandwich on top of the other and cut in half diagonally to form two sandwiches. Heat oil in an electric panini grill or cast-iron grill over medium-high heat until hot. Place sandwiches in grill and cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Remove from grill and serve on individual plates.

Mix the sugar and salt in a bowl and set aside. Bring the honey, water and oil to boil in a saucepan. Add the peanuts to the honey mixture. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes stirring frequently. When the liquid is practically gone, add the sugar and salt and continue stirring on low heat until sugar has turned reddish-brown approximately 5 more minutes. You will recognize the honey roasted peanut look. Take off heat and spread in one layer on a cookie sheet or foil until it cools. Break into pieces and store in an airtight container.

In a small bowl beat together 2/3 cup white chocolate with 2 tablespoons hot water. Add 1/3 cup white chocolate to the egg yolks and whisk to combine. Stir in the hot white chocolate mixture until combined well. Stir together 1 cup white chocolate with 2 tablespoons hot water until smooth and then strain into a small bowl. Put the remaining 1/3 cup white chocolate into a small saucepan. Heat on medium-low heat until melted and smooth. Add 2 tablespoons hot water to the white chocolate to thin the mixture. Whisk the egg yolks into the white chocolate mixture until combined well. In a large saucepan heat 2 cups whole milk until hot. Bring to the boil. Gradually whisk the egg mixture into the hot milk. Whisk the egg mixture until thickened and smooth then whisk in the amaretti cookies. Whisk the remaining 1/3 cup white chocolate into the hot milk then add 1/3 cup whole milk to the white chocolate mixture to thin it slightly. St

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook the noodles and set aside. In a Dutch oven, brown the beef and onion over medium heat. Stir in the sauce and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and simmer 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the sliced mushrooms and heat through. Sprinkle with the cheese and bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese melts and the noodles are tender. Top with fresh parsley and serve.

In large skillet over medium high heat, brown steaks. Remove from pan and add onions and carrots. Cook for 10 minutes until onions are tender. Add potatoes and green pepper. Cook for 5 minutes. In large crockpot, combine broth and gravy mix. Pour mixture over vegetables and simmer until tender. Add steaks and simmer for 5 more minutes.

Cook bacon until crisp in large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove from pan with slotted spoon and reserve bacon grease. Remove bacon and set aside. Remove all but 2 teaspoons of bacon grease from pan. Add onions and celerysaute 4 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently. Add reserved baconsaute 2 minutes more. Add ricesaute 5 minutes more or until lightly browned. Add brothbring to boil. Reduce heatsimmer 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in chervil, bacon, parsley, black pepper, and corncook 15 minutes more or until corn is tender. Serve with additional chervil sprinkled on top of each serving if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8 x 8 x 2 inch baking pan. In a small saucepan heat the butter with the brown sugar and cinnamon until melted and combined. In another saucepan add egg white and vanilla extractwhisk until foamy. Pour brown butter mixture into egg white mixture whisking constantly until combined. Pour into prepared baking pan. Bake 20 minutes in preheated oven until brown on top and set around edges. Cool completely on wire rack before serving. Store covered in refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Steam spinach over boiling water until wilted. Drain. Cool. Add the spinach to a large bowl. Add 2/3 cup olive oil, 2 minced garlic cloves, hot pepper flakes and red sweet peppers. Mix well to combine. Serve warm or cold.

Boil the ziti until tender and drain well. Place the ziti back into the pot and add the garlic powder and black pepper. Stir for a minute or two until the garlic and pepper are well blended. Pour the evaporated milk and half of the grated cheese into the pot. Heat until the cheese melts and the sauce is thickened. Stir in the heavy whipping cream and cook until it is heated through and the consistency of a heavy gravy. Stir in the remaining grated cheese and stir until it is completely melted. Add the ziti and stir to coat evenly with the sauce. Add the fresh chopped parsley to the ziti and stir again until it is incorporated well with the ziti. Serve immediately.

Cut the kernels off the ears of the corn. Place the kernels and all of the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Stir to combine. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature for 2 hours. Discard the chipotle chiles. Serve the soup with chopped fresh cilantro.

Brown meat in large skillet and drain. Stir in onion. Add beans and chill. Layer tortilla chips, then top with meat and cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for 15 minutes or until melted. Sprinkle with additional cheeses. Top with chopped tomatoes and scallions. Serve warm.

Trim fat from meat and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet and saute onion and mushroom until soft. Add meat and brown well over medium heat. Pour in wine. Stir to coat. Remove from heat. Add salt and pepper. Return meat to heat and cook slowly until tender. Serve with parsley.

Wash the okras well. Remove the stem portion leaving the fibrous portion intact. Boil in a large pot of water until the okras are tender but not soft (about 20 minutes). Drain. Heat the oil in a pan. Saute the onions with the garlic for a minute or so. Add the ginger and chilies. Fry for a few minutes. Add the cumin, coriander, water and the okras. Simmer for a few minutes. Add the lemon juice. Simmer for another minute. Serve hot.

In a bowl, combine milk and lime juice. Mix well. Mixture should thicken. Add egg yolks and mix well. Pour mixture into graham cracker pie crust. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees f for about 5 minutes or until firm. Allow to cool for about 20 minutes. Top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a dollop of fresh whipped cream. Garnish with a slice of key lime if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Sift together the dry ingredients. In a large mixing bowl combine the oil, white and brown sugars. Add the eggs and beat until light and fluffy. Add the dry ingredients and the rhubarb. Mix well and then stir in the quick cooking oats. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a cookie sheet or line with parchment paper. Combine white sugar and butter in a large mixing bowlmix with a mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy. Beat in eggnog, vanilla, nutmeg, egg yolks and 2/3 cup of the flour mixture in two additions until smooth. Mix in remaining flour mixture with a wooden spoon. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Flatten each dough ball slightly with your fingers to make it easier to spread into a circle. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until cookies are slightly brown. Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In large saucepan melt butter. Stir in flour. Cook over low heat for 1 minute. Gradually stir in evaporated milk. Bring just to a boil. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Add in pasta and all cheeses except for monterey jack. Cook over medium heat until mixture is bubbly. Stir in monterey jack. Place in 2 qt baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 20 minutes. Top with additional monterey jack if desired.

Combine all ingredients in a large plastic zip lock bag and shake well to mix. Place the chickens into the bag and seal tightly. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. Remove from refrigerator and drain off any extra moisture. Grill over medium heat for about 45 minutes or until done. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add pork sausagecook for 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add ground beefcook and stir for 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in cayenne pepper, black pepper, salt, and next 8 ingredients. Cook for 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add ricecook and stir for 20 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Sift together flour and cardamom. Cut in butter with pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in sugar and baking powder. In a large bowl, beat eggs and vanilla. Gradually stir in flour mixture until blended. Stir in preserves. Stir in oatmeal. Pour batter into prepared pan. Sprinkle with streusel topping. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center of cake comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack.

Cut off the bottom of each cucumber about 1/2 inch from the stem end. Remove the skin of each cucumber by either scrubbing with an apple corer or with your fingers or a vegetable parer. Cut each cucumber in half lengthwise and scoop out the insides with a teaspoon or melon baller. Place each cucumber half on a cutting board and cut each half lengthwise into 1/8 inch slices. Place the cucumber slices in a glass bowl. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of the sugar and 1/4 teaspoon of the tabasco sauce. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or foil and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Drain the slices of cucumber. Discard the remaining tabasco sauce. Mix the remaining 3 tablespoons of sugar with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of tabasco sauce. Dissolve the mixture in 1/2 cup warm waterstir in the remaining 1/4 cup of vinegar. Pour the mixture over the cuc

Peel potatoes and cut into large chunks. Boil potatoes until tender. Put potatoes into blender with heavy cream (if needed) until creamy consistency is reached. Add butter (if needed) to achieve desired creaminess. Add salt to taste. Add flour slowly to achieve desired dough consistency. Let mixture rest for 5 minutes before forming into dough balls. Form dough balls into flat oval shape (approximately 10 x 5 inches). Place dough on lightly oiled surface for about 1 minute to warm up. Fold dough over onto itself. (This is called a fold.) Repeat folding process until dough is about 1/8 of an inch thick. Roll out dough by hand to desired thickness (approximately 1/8 to 1/4 inches thick). Fold dough once or twice to get rid of air pockets. Place dough on lightly oiled surface. Flip dough over onto itself so that each side is exposed to the oil. Roll dough out to desired thickness (approximately 1/8 to 1/4 inches thick). Flip dough
Add all ingredients to 2 quart microwaveable dish. Cover securely and cook for 7 minutes on high. Let stand covered on warm for 1 minute before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large skillet cook onion in butter until tender. Add flour and stir to coat. Gradually stir in the milk. Add chicken breasts, seasonings and white wine. Cover and cook on low for 45 minutes or until tender. Stir in the gravy browner. Pour into greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake uncovered for 20 to 25 minutes or until sauce is bubbly. Serve with noodles or rice. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat a medium skillet over medium-high heatadd the olive oil, zucchini, onion and garliccook until tender, about 5 minutesseason with salt and pepperremove from heatset aside. In a small bowl stir together the diced tomatoes, roasted red pepper, oregano and chili flakesset aside. Place the fillets in the skillet and cook for 6 minutesturn the fillets over once. Add the tomato mixturecook for 2 minutessprinkle the fillets with the fresh parsleyserve immediately.

In a large bowl, beat eggs until light yellow in color. Add sugar, and beat until the mixture is thick and pale yellow in color. Add unsweetened cocoa powder and beat until combined. Pour in cream and milkmix until combined. Add vanilla extract. Mix in heavy cream until combined. Add honey and beat until combined. Pour into ice cream machine according to manufacturer's directions. When ice cream has hardened, transfer to an air-tight container. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve. To serve, place 4-6 graham cracker squares in each bowl and top with 3 scoops of ice cream. Top ice cream with Hershey's bar or 2 miniature marshmallows per scoop of ice cream.

Heat water to a boil and add butter. When the butter has melted and the water is just beginning to boil, add Worcestershire sauce. Add canned oysters and stir for a minute. Add the potato and low-fat milk. Season with salt and pepper. Add a small amount of nutmeg. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve at once.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add squash, cover and cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until tender. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until softened and fragrant. Remove from heat and stir in basil. Top each serving with half of the cheese.

Remove ends of string beans and cut into 2-inch pieces. Place in saucepan. Add water to cover beans and add sugar and seasoning. Bring to boiling and cook for 2 minutes. Drain. Add butter and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms. Cook for 10 minutes. Add string beans and cook 5 minutes. Add whipping cream and bring to boiling. Cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Serve hot.

Boil water in a large saucepan over high heat. Remove from heat. Add the tea bag and brew until the desired strength is reached (about 20 minutes). Remove the tea bag from the water. Stir in the sugar. Stir until the sugar is dissolved completely. Then stir in the sodait will fizz when the soda meets the sugar. Pour into pitchers and serve over ice or add more cold water or ice cubes as desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart casserole dish with canola oil cooking spray. Saute apples and cabbage in 1 tablespoon of oil until tender. In a separate bowl combine 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1 tablespoon cinnamon stirring to combine. Set aside. In another bowl combine 1/2 cup bread crumbs and 2 tablespoons oil stirring to combine. Spread cabbage and apples into prepared dish. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture and brown sugar cinnamon mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Crack 3 eggs into mixing bowl. Whip in 1/3 cup cream to form lightly fluffy mixture. Whip in 1/3 teaspoon worcestershire sauce. Cook on low heat in 10-inch skillet for 2 minutes or until just setstir to keep from sticking. Serve immediatelyor stir in 1/2 cup chopped onion just before serving.

Combine wine, salt and halibut in a 10-inch skillet and bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add mayonnaise and sour cream and cook 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with paprika. Place fillet in 4 shallow soup bowls. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and serve.

Cut parmesan cheese into small cubes. Melt butter and saute onion until lightly golden. Add chopped garlic and cook until fragrant. Add pine nuts and cook until they just start to color. Add parmesan cheese and pine nuts. Cook until cheese is melted and mixture is combined. Add chopped green chilies. Cook until chilies are softened. Add chopped pesto. Stir in chopped parsley and cilantro. Season to taste. In a large saucepan of boiling water cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and toss with the pesto sauce. In a nonstick skillet heat the remaining 2 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add the shrimp and saute until they are pink. Add the penne and toss to coat. Garnish with the chopped parsley and serve.

Combine soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, salt, and red pepper flakes in a large bowl. Whisk to blend. Add snow peas and toss to coat. Arrange the snow peas in a single layer on a baking sheet or broiler pan. Broil 5-10 minutes or until tender-crisp. Remove from oven and top each snow pea with a scallion slice, radish half, and 1/2 teaspoon of the sauce. Sprinkle each snow pea with 3 cashews and serve hot.

Mix panko and thyme together in a bowl and set aside. Mix butter and green onion together in another bowl and set aside. Preheat oven to 425f. Pat salmon dry with paper towel and place skin side down in a greased baking dish. Brush with butter mixture and sprinkle with panko mixture. Bake until fish flakes easily with fork, about 15-20 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

To make the dressing, whisk together all of the ingredients in a small bowlset aside. Slice the apple in half, removing the core and seeds. Cut each half into bite-sized pieces and add to a large bowl. Cut the red onion into small piecesadd to the bowl with the apple slices. Add the radish slices as well, tossing to combine with the fruit mixture. Add the celery and nutsstir to coat everything lightly with the dressing. Serve at room temperature or chilled on a bed of greens.

Mix marzipan and butter together well. Add egg and salt. Mix well until smooth. Add sugar gradually until mixture is stiff enough to shape into balls. Roll into balls the size of large marbles or walnuts. Roll in coarsely chopped pecans or poppy seeds or red currant jam. Place on buttered cookie sheet. Bake at 375F until lightly browned, about 30-40 minutes.

Heat the oil in a deep frying pan to 180°C/ 350°F. In a large bowl combine the flour with the corn, ginger and thyme, stirring to combine. In another bowl beat together the eggs with the milk until well combined. Make a well in the middle of the dry mixture and add the eggs slowly until the mixture just holds together. Stir in the sweet potato and the remaining oil. Gently fold in the butter with a knife until it has been incorporated. Heat a little oil on a griddle or frying pan over a medium heat, large enough to hold 2 tablespoons of mixture at one time. Drop a spoonful of mixture onto the heated griddle or frying pan, leaving space between each fritter. Cook for about 2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Drain on kitchen paper. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Clean and trim fennel. Cut bulb into quarters and remove core. Cut off fronds. Cut quarters lengthwise into 2-inch pieces. Cook bucatini as directed. Heat 1/2 cup olive oil and 2 tablespoons butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add fennel and cook until fennel is golden and tender. Remove from heat and transfer to a bowl. Add 1/4 cup olive oil to pan and heat over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add red pepper flakes and fennel and cook 2 minutes more. Transfer mixture to bowl with fennel.
