Drain bucatini and return to pot. Toss with 1/4 cup olive oil and 1/4 cup butter. Drizzle with reserved fennel mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Toss. Garnish with fennel fronds. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl combine the cheddar cheese, cream cheese, garlic, onion powder, mayonnaise, freshly ground black pepper, salt, and tabasco sauce until blended smooth. Add the butter flavored crackers and fold into the mixture until all crackers are covered. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve with the olives on the side for dipping.

For the mayonaise, combine all the ingredients in a food processor. Pulse until smooth. For the wraps, put the tortillas flat in a large pan and pour a thin layer of oil over them. Cook over medium-high heat for a few minutes. Flip the wraps when the oil is hot. Cook until golden brown. Place one wrap on each plate. Layer the lettuce leaves over the wraps. Put the smoked turkey over the lettuce. Top with a slice of cheese and drizzle the chipotle mayonaise over the lettuce. Serve with sliced limes.

Cook farfalle according to package directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, chop cucumber and red pepper. Finely dice onion. Combine mayonnaise, red wine vinegar and chopped parsley. Set aside. Toss all other ingredients together until well combined. Top with mayonnaise mixture and garnish with chopped fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Wash and trim the ends off the green beans. Cut the beans into 1 1/2 inch pieces. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are translucent. Add the green beans and saut until they are tender, about 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the parsley wilted.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients except pecans. Cover and refrigerate at least four hours or overnight. Serve cold. Sprinkle pecans over top just before serving.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, saute onion in 1 tablespoon of oil until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and celery ribs to pan. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add pork hocks. Cook for 20 minutes. Add 2 quarts cold water to pan. Bring to a boil. Add lentils. Reduce heat to low. Cook for about 30 minutes, or until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Peel the onions and cut into large pieces. Peel the tomatoes (if using whole ones) or cut them in half. Bring to the boil a pan of salted water in which to cook the onions. Peel the potatoes. Cut them into large chunks. Cook the onions until they are softened (approximately 15 minutes). Drain the onions. Remove the skin from the tomatoes. Cut a slit in the top of each tomato. Place in a pan of boiling water with the onions. When the tomatoes are soft, remove them from the pan. Peel the potatoes. Cut them into chunks. Peel the garlic (if using whole cloves) or cut it into slices. Cut the rosemary, parsley and thyme into small pieces. Add the garlic to the onions. Mix the onions with the potatoes. Season the mixture with the herbs, a little salt (and plenty of freshly ground black pepper). Stir in the margarine. Pour the milk over the mixture. Mix the plain flour with a little cold water to make a paste. Stir the paste

Bring hot water to a boil. Add the light corn syrup and the sugar and cook until the temperature reaches 240f. Remove from heat and add the egg whites to the hot syrup while beating with an electric mixer at high speed. Continue beating until stiff peaks are formed (2 to 3 minutes). Transfer to a bowl, add the vanilla extract, salt and mayonnaise, beat well and pour on to a plate to cool. To serve, sprinkle the fruit over the marshmallow sauce. Dust with grated orange rind.
In large bowl combine all ingredients. Mix well to combinerefrigerate until serving time.

Mix marmalade into melted butter. Add into soft dough and mix well. Knead dough on floured surface for about five minutes. Add cold water as needed to make soft dough. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for ten minutes or until golden brown.

Mix together all the ingredients in a bowl, then add enough milk to make a thick batter. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the center of the batter.
Mix all ingredients except chicken in a bowl. Add the chicken. Coat well. Put all ingredients in the slow cooker. Cook for 4-6 hours or until chicken is tender. Serve with rice.

Melt the butter in a saut pan. Add the sliced apples and cook for 5 minutes over low heat. Add the sugar and the wine and cook for another minute or so. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Cut the bread into squares or triangles. Brush with the remaining melted butter. In a large bowl, combine the cooled apples, bread cubes, cream, eggs and orange zest. Mix well with a fork until the cream has absorbed the liquid from the apples. Spoon into a greased 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for about 35 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Mix 2 cups of biscuit mix and 2 cups of milk in a large bowl. Beat in 2 tablespoons of cooking oil. Pour into a lightly greased 9 x 9 x 2 in baking pan. Cook 20 minutes at 375. Combine 2 cups of biscuit mix and 1 cup of milk and pour into a lightly greased 9 x 9 x 2 in baking pan. Cook 20 minutes at 375. Prepare meat mixture in a large skillet by cooking the ground beef and browning the onions. Mix in the brown gravy mix and water. Add the cooked meat mixture to the milk mixture. Combine the 2 mixtures. Pour over biscuits and cook 30 minutes at 375.

In a large saucepan, combine all of the ingredients. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to a simmercook for 5 minutes. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and cook for 2 more minutes. Remove from the heat. Pour into a bowl. Cover the surface with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Stir before using. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

In a large bowl combine first six ingredients. In a small bowl combine the next five ingredients. Mix the wet into the dry. Pour into a well greased loaf pan and bake for about an hour. Let it cool on a rack before removing it.

Prepare pie shell as directed on package. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix fruit together with orange juice. Mix brown sugar, brown, orange juice and cinnamon together. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Add fruit mixture to pie shell. Sprinkle crumble topping evenly over fruit. Bake for 40-50 minutes. Cool for at least two hours. Serve with whipped cream.

Combine the Ricotta cheese with the egg yolks. Whip in the sugar substitute until smooth. Add the heavy cream slowly to the mixture while whipping it to prevent it from curdling. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. In a separate bowl, combine the egg whites with the sugar substitute until stiff peaks form. Fold the egg white mixture into the egg yolk mixture and then fold in the shaved chocolate. Pour the mixture into a large round bowl or glass pie plate that has a lip and chill overnight in the refrigerator. Serve with fresh strawberries on top or add some blueberries or raspberries or both! You can also add a dollop of whipped cream if you like!

In a large bowl, combine the oats, flour and sugars. Stir in the cocoa and baking powder. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and syrups. Add the vanilla and rice krispies and mix until thoroughly blended into the cookie dough. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 8 minutes or until the edges are set. Cool on wire racks for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula.

Combine all of the ingredients for the marinade in a bowl. Place the chicken in a plastic bag with the marinade and refrigerate for 1 to 24 hours. Preheat grill to medium heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade. Grill the chicken on the preheated grill for 6 to 7 minutes per side. Serve with rice.

Soak 1/2 cup of the lentils overnight in cold water to cover. Drain and transfer to a medium pot. Add 10 cups cold water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender, 40-45 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. Rinse 1/2 cup of the rice under cold running water and set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add 2 garlic cloves and 1/2 teaspoon of the cumin and cook, stirring often, until softened and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the drained lentils and 1/2 cup of the drained rice. Season with 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper and 1/2 teaspoon of the cumin and bring to a simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has been absorbed and the mixture is thickened and creamy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a large serving dish. Sprinkle with

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute onion in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425f. Spray a 9 inch pie plate with non stick cooking spray. Cut sausage into thin strips. Place in pie plate. In small bowl beat egg and milk together. Stir in sausage and salt and pepper. Pour into pie plate. Top with crescent rolls. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until center of sausage is firm. Cool. Serve with fruit and coffee.

Add the coconut flakes to the hot coconut milk (don't use canned coconut milk). Stir to combine. Add the coconut extract to the coconut milk mixture. Add the cooked rice to the mixture and stir until combined. In a large glass bowl or dish, pour the mixture into the bowl or dish. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

In a large mixing bowl combine the graham cracker crumbs, vegan margarine, soy cream cheese and pumpkin puree. Mix well until blended. In a small bowl whisk together the brown sugar, rum extract, ground cinnamon and allspice. Stir the brown sugar mixture into the pumpkin mixture. Pour the mixture into a 9 inch springform pan that has been coated with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees F. Cool completely and then refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Remove the sides of the pan and serve.

In a large bowl combine the eggs and water. Add dry biscuit mix and stir with a fork until blended. Stir in the onion and cheddar cheese and mix well until combined. Form dough into a ball and place on a floured surface. Knead and roll out dough to the desired thickness and cut into desired shapes and sizes. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Remove from oven and drizzle with the remaining egg mixture. Return to oven for additional 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly season both sides of the pork chops with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, whisk together the molasses, vinegar and cumin. In another smaller bowl, whisk together the dijon mustard and maple syrup. Brush each side of the pork with one half of the cumin mixture and then the other half of the cumin mixture. Place the pork in the prepared pan. Brush each side of the pork with one half of the dijon/maple mixture and then the other half. Sprinkle the remaining half of the dijon mixture over the top of the chops. Bake for 45 minutes or until the pork is tender. Serve.

Wash potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Dice 1/3 cup shredded coconut into 1-inch cubes. Melt 1/2 cup almonds in a small pan over medium heatset aside to cool. Beat 2 eggs in a medium bowl with 1 cup brown sugarstir in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/2 cup shredded coconut until well blended. Beat in 2 cups flour. Dip potato cubes in egg mixture, then coat with flour mixture. Put potato cubes in a single layer on an ungreased 15-inch x 10-inch x 1-inch jelly-roll pan. Bake for 45 minutes in preheated 350 degree F oven, stirring every 15 minutes. Let stand in pan for 5 minutesremove to a rack. Cool completely (about 2 hours). Place 1 cup potato cubes in a food processor or blender with 1/3 cup shredded coconutblend until almost smooth, stopping often to

Boil chicken until done. Remove and let cool. Combine cream of chicken soup, whole milk and shredded cheddar in a bowl. Mix in cooled chicken. Roll crescents around chicken mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes.

In a large pan melt the butter. Add the onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add the courgette and cook for 4-5 minutes. Add the cooked pasta to the pan. Add the cream, the walnuts and the parsley. Season to taste with the parmesan.

Put coffee in blender. Add brown sugar. Then add the vanilla bean. Blend until combined. Add the almonds. Blend again until almonds are fine. Add bananas and blend until bananas are fine. Put ice in blender. Blend until ice is fine. Put in glasses. Top with whipped cream.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Place mixture into a greased 13x9x2 baking pan. Bake at 350 for 40-50 minutes.

Cook rice according to package directionsdrain well. In a large skillet brown the turkey over medium heatdrain well. In a large bowl combine the rice, beans, turkey, 1/4 cup salsa, 3/4 cup sour cream and 2/3 cup shredded cheese. Coverrefrigerate for 24 hours to allow flavors to blend. Uncoverstir wellpour into 4 greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dishes. Top each with the remaining 1/2 cup shredded cheesebake at 350f for 30 minutes. Serve with guacamole.

Clean ham shank by removing skin and fat from all over the meat. Place ham shank in a 5-quart pressure cooker. Fill the bottom of the cooker 1/2-inch below the meat with water. Add potatoes, carrots, cabbage and onion. Close the cover of the cooker. Bring the water to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover the cooker tightly, place a lid weight over the vent tube, if necessary and bring the water to a gentle simmer. Cook the ham for 50 minutes or until the meat falls easily from the bone. Transfer the ham to a platter. Serve the vegetables with the ham.

Boil water. Add potatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Drain water. Cut potatoes in half and mash. Add egg yolks and mix. Add spinach. Stir until all is mixed. Add salt and pepper. Add 3 cups of flour. Add boiling water and mix. Add more flour until consistency is right. Add more boiling water until dough is right. Roll dough into logs. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Cook in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain. Add one stick of butter to pan. Cook gnocchis in pan for 1 minute. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Add the peanut butter to the sugar and mix well. Add the corn syrup and rice flour. Work in as much peanut butter as you can. Knead together. Roll into long ropes about 3/4 inch in diameter. Make the ropes about 10 to 12 inches long. Make a loop in the end of the rope and wrap it around the opposite end. Press the ends together to form a ring. Pull the ring apart and twist it. The twists should be about 1/2 inch long. Roll the twists in white sugar and then in chopped peanuts. You can also roll the twists in food colorings to get different colored dragon hairs.

Mix together all ingredients except butter. Add egg yolks and whisk until smooth. Add butter and mix until combined. Spoon batter into cups and bake at 450 degrees for 20 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm with honey or butter on the side.

In a large pot over medium-low heat, brown the ground beef with the paprika and salt and pepper to taste. Add the onion and bell pepper and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and kidney beansbring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in the butter and cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, cook the meat in the oil until no longer pink. Drain. Return the pan to medium-high heat and add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium. Simmer until thickened and hot throughout. Serve with cornbread, cooked pasta, cooked rice, or on top of a baked potato. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, in a large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add pine nuts and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until garlic is lightly browned. Add chard stems and saute for 3 minutes. Add chard leaves and saute for 1 minute. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Simmer until chard is wilted. Add tomato to pan. Cook for 1 minute. Add parmesan. Stir to combine. Drain cooked pasta. Add to sauce. Stir to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine scallions, gingerroot and soy sauce. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a platter and keep warm. In a small bowl, whisk together the sesame oil and the brown sugar. Add the mixture to the juices in the baking dish and stir to combine. Add the chicken to the pan. Toss to coat. Serve with steamed white rice.

Clean the brussels sprout and cut them in half lengthwise. Place on a baking tray with enough water so they do not stick together and bake for about half an hour until they are cooked through. Remove from the oven and heat some unsalted butter in a pan on medium heat until melted and foamy. Add a tablespoon of water and stir until it bubbles and becomes slightly thick. Add some pepper and stir well and add some more water and stir again. Add some sugar and stir well. When the sugar dissolves, add some freshly squeezed lemon juice and stir until it thickens again and it is nice and glossy and it has a nice golden color. Remove from heat and put it into a small container. When serving, add a little on each side of the sprout and enjoy!

In a medium sized pot combine buttermilk and 2 tablespoons of the salt and mix well. Add the cucumber slices and stir gently to combine. Add the green onions and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally to combine the flavors. Add the shrimp and simmer for about 5 minutes longer until the shrimp are pink and cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of sugar. Pour into serving bowls and garnish each serving with a sprig of cilantro and a slice of cucumber. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a saucepan combine the dried apple with the water and bring to a boil. Add the orange juice and zest and continue boiling until the dried apple is soft. Stir in the salt and sugar and continue boiling for another two minutes. Pour the mixture into the two crusts and bake for 35 minutes.
Combine all the ingredients in a medium bowl. Whisk until well blended. Toss the spinach in the vinaigrette until it is completely coated. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Mix all ingredients together except cream. Pour into pie pan and refrigerate 4-6 hours before serving. Garnish with lime slices.

Melt butter in saucepan. Remove from heat. Beat eggs until light. Beat in sugar. Stir in melted butter slowly. Add flour and cocoa mixed together. Stir in vanilla and walnuts. Pour into 8x8 pan or brownie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes.

In medium saucepan heat 1 cup water to boil. Add lavender and lemon slices to water. Cover pan and simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Strain through mesh sieve into 2 quart pitcher. Add sugar, lemon juice, stir well and cool completely before serving over ice with lemon slices.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix crumbs with margarine until thoroughly blended. Press into ungreased 10 x 15 x 1-inch baking sheet. Bake 8 minutes or until edges begin to brown. Stir mixture well. Remove from ovenstir again. Return to oven and bake another 7 minutes. Spread evenly over crumbs. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Bake another 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into squares.

Wash and dry fresh carrots and place them on a cutting board. Use a paring knife to remove the tough ends of the carrots. Cut off a thin top to remove the tough skin that is often found there. Cut each carrot into 4 even slices, then cross-cut each slice to make 16 smaller pieces. In a large bowl combine the carrot pieces with the finely chopped onion, salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat the oil to 360 degrees F (180 degrees C). Dip one of the carrot slices in the cornstarch to coat it thoroughly then drop it into the hot oil. Fry the carrot slices for about 30 seconds or until they are golden brown. Turn the slices over and continue to fry for another 30 seconds or until they are browned all over. Drain the carrot slices on paper towels and sprinkle with salt. Serve immediately with steamed rice or other grain.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Pound the chicken breasts to flatten them slightly, then dip them in the egg whites and coat with the cornstarch (both sides). Shake off the excess and place on a sheet pan or baking dish. Drizzle the lemon juice over the chicken. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and the parsley (or other herb of your choice). Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 15 minutes. Flip the chicken and continue baking for an additional 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and browned on top. Serve with your favorite sauce or salad on the side.

In medium bowl, dissolve gelatin in cold wateradd boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add frozen concentrate and stir until dissolved. Stir in cream cheese. Blend in frozen whipped topping. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold in food coloring. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve in individual dessert dishes. Garnish with fresh berries if desired.

Peel and quarter small red potatoes. Heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add oil. When the pan is hot add the potatoes. Cook without stirring for about 5-7 minutes, until they are almost tender. Add salt and pepper and cook for about 2 minutes longer. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Beat together the butter and sugars. Beat in egg and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and beat to combine. Form dough into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 12 minutes. Cool. Store in an airtight container.

Cook orzo according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook chopped spinach in a saucepan for 1 minute over medium heat until wilted. Drain. In a medium saucepan melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Stir in onion powder. Add garlic. Cook until fragrant. Stir in spinach. Increase heat to medium high. Add lemon juice. Cook until spinach is tender. Add cream and cook until thickened. Stir in parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Drain orzo. Add to pan. Toss to combine. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with remaining butter.

Place sour cream in bowl. Add onion and oregano. Stir to blend. Place one slice of bread in bottom of sandwich press. Add onion mixture to bread. Press down to make a flat layer. Add 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese to bread. Place second slice of bread on top and press down to make a flat layer. Spread each sandwich with butter. Add another slice of bread. Place sandwich on a baking sheet. Bake on 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Add 1/2 cup shredded cheese to sandwich. Remove sandwich from baking sheet and top with 4 slices of bacon. Place sandwiches back in oven. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with sliced tomatoes. Serve with salad.
In a blender combine all the ingredients and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses. Garnish with fruit and serve.

Heat canola oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add eggs & stir constantly until the egg mixture is thick and starts to set around the edges. Stir in yellow onions & bok choysauté until softened. Stir in the soy sauce & garlic powder. Remove from heat & fold in shrimpcover & keep warm. Serve over rice.

Prepare a breading station by placing the flour on a plate or baking sheet. Then dip the tenders in the egg whites and place in the flour. Then place the tenders in the breading mixture and coat. Place the breaded tenders on a rack over a sheet pan and bake until golden and cooked through. While the tenders are cooking prepare the sauce by mixing the hoisin sauce with the mustard and preserves. Once the tenders are cooked place them in the sauce and serve.

Put all ingredients in blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Cover and refrigerate until well chilled. To serve, divide mixture into individual bowls or cups. Garnish with a squeeze of lemon.

Beat cream cheese and sugar in medium bowl with electric mixer until soft peaks form. Beat in butter. Fold in Cool Whip. Spread half of Cool Whip mixture in bottom of 13 x 9 inch pan. Sprinkle 1/3 of pretzels in pan. Top with 1/3 of raspberry jell-o mixture. Repeat layers. Refrigerate until firm.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine hash browns, beef and salsa. Spoon into a 2 quart casserole dish. Top with cheese soup. Sprinkle with nacho cheese and bake 45 minutes.

Melt butter in large skillet or baking dish. Cook celery in butter until tender but still crisp. Stir in cooked chicken, breadcrumbs and parsley. Combine eggs and brothadd to skillet mixture. Pour mixture into baking dish or casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for about one hour. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 425f. Combine butter, garlic cloves, black pepper, shallots, thyme, tarragon, parsley and chives in a bowl. Stuff each muscle with 1/4 teaspoon of filling mixture. Place in an ovenproof casserole dish. Pour ale around muscles. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and steam 5 minutes. Serve with crusty bread for dipping in juices. Makes 4 servings as an appetizer. Serves 2 as a main course.

Mix italian dressing mix and water. Add chicken to skillet. Pour dressing over chicken. Cover. Cook over medium heat until done. Remove from skillet. Pour wine over skillet. Add cream of mushroom soup and cream cheese. Cook until cream cheese is melted. Stir in cream of mushroom soup. Place chicken over cream mixture. Top with butter. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve over cooked noodles.

Put the sour cream, sugar, salt and red food coloring into a large mixing bowl. In another mixing bowl, beat together the eggs and the lemon juice until light and fluffy. Add the sour cream mixture. In another large mixing bowl, toss together the pineapple and the banana. Mix the dry cake mix with the water according to the package directions and add the mixture to the banana mixture. Pour half of the mixture into the bottom of the paper cups. Add the sour cream mixture on top of the banana mixture. Divide the remaining cake mix and place on top of the sour cream mixture. Pour the rest of the sour cream mixture on top of the cake mix. Chill for 4 hours or overnight. Cut around the top of the cups with a sharp knife. Put 1/2 teaspoon of the whipping cream into the bottom of each cup and top with 2 or 3 cherries. Freeze for 2 hours. When ready to serve, put 2 tablespoons of the sour cream mixture in each cup and top with 1/2 teaspo

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and both sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Add flour and mix together until smooth. Stir in mashed bananas. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan. Bake for about 40-45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on wire rack before removing. Yield 1 loaf.

Mix the oil, buttermilk, wesson oil and vanilla together in a bowlset aside. In a separate bowl mix together the flour, sugar, salt and baking sodaset aside. In a third bowl mix together the eggs and the boiling waterset aside. In a fourth bowl mix together the cocoa and the buttermilk mixtureset aside. In a fifth bowl mix together the dry ingredientsset aside. Now mix the dry and wet ingredients together in the correct order listed aboveset aside and let stand for 15 minutes. Grease a 9" x 2" pan and pour the batter into the panset aside. Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 35-45 minutesor until a tester inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let cool and then frost with your favorite icing.
Brown onions and cooked white rice. Add broccoli and cook for 15 minutes. Add 1 cup water and salt and pepper. Stir. Top with cheese whiz and sour cream. Bake for 30 minutes.
Spread chive & onion cream cheese evenly over bread halves. Place turkey breast on top of each sandwich. Top with provolone cheese, roasted sweet peppers and spinach leaves. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Roll out pastry dough into a large circle on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with salt and spices and roll up tightly, beginning at the wide end of dough. Slice into 1/8 inch-thick slices and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for approximately 10 minutes or until dough is lightly browned and puffed up. Remove from cookie sheet and set aside on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Peel and core the apples and slice in half. Place cut side down in the baked dough slices and arrange in a pie plate. Sprinkle with sugar and salt and dot with butter. Bake at 425 degrees for approximately 25-30 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the apples are tender. Place the remaining dough slices on the cookie sheet and bake for approximately 15 minutes or until the dough is lightly browned and puffed up. Arrange the streusel dough over the top of the filled apples and bake for approximately 10 more minutes

Bring water to boil. Add vegetables. Reduce heat to medium-high. Cook uncovered 5-6 minutes or until vegetables are tender crisp. Drain vegetables. Place vegetables in a large bowl. Stir in celery. Add mushrooms. Pour in soy sauce. Toss to coat. Add slivered almonds. Serve warm.

Saute the onions, garlic and mushrooms in the butter until tender. Add the pearl barley, chicken broth, pepper and salt. Cover the baking dish. Bake in the oven at 350 for 45 minutes or until pearl barley is tender.

Spray an 8 by 8 by 2-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Cut each crescent roll into fourths. Place one fourth in each square of the pan. Place a slice of tart apple in each. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of brown sugar and 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon. Spray a paper cup with cooking spray. Pour 2 ounces of Mountain Dew into the paper cup. Pour 1/4 cup of Mountain Dew over the crescents and apples. Bake for 20-25 minutes in the preheated oven until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm with ice cream.

Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat whisking until sugar dissolves. Bring mixture to a boilboil for 5 min whisking constantly. Remove from heat. Pour into a 9 inch pie crust. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes. Cool completely before serving with whipped cream.

Season flounder with salt and pepper. Dredge flounder fillets in flour and saute in oil. Cover and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove flounder from the sauce pan. Place sauce over spaghetti. Arrange flounder over sauce. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over all. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add leek and cook until soft. Stir in the cauliflower, salt and pepper. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until the cauliflower is tender. Puree in a blender. Return the puree to the pot. Stir in the butter and nutmeg. Serve hot.
Season the chicken and place in the crockpot. Combine the rest of the ingredients and pour over the chicken. Cook on low for 4 hours. Serve over rice.

Spread bagels with butter and place on cookie sheet or pizza stone. Top each bagel with cheddar cheese, then with a slice of cooked ham and then an egg half. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Peel and core your apples. Cut your apples into small cubes. Mix your oats and raisins together. Combine the soymilk and maple syrup in a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat until boiling, then remove from heat. Stir in your oats and raisins. Add your vanilla and your raisins. Add your apples and stir together. Transfer your mixture to a greased 8 by 8 inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 160c. Combine relish with the chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook for 4-5 minutes. Turn the chicken. Cook for 4-5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 teaspoon oil. Sprinkle with the lemon. Cook for 2 minutes more. Transfer the skillet to the preheated 160c oven. Cook for about 45 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a pan. Add the chopped onions and cook until they are soft. Add the chopped garlic and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the tomatoes. Add the chili pepper flakes. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar. Add sugar. Simmer for 10 minutes more. Add the fresh basil. Serve over pasta.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add rice, return to a boil then reduce to a simmer for about 20 minutes. Drain and add to a large skillet with the oil. Sautee the vegetables for about five minutes. Add the rice back to the pan with the spices, salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. Brown meat in large skillet. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce to meat. Mix well. Stir in sour cream, 3/4 cup whipping cream, and 1 cup shredded Parmesan. Pour into an 8x8-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan cheesesbake 25 minutes or until heated through. Serve with remaining whipping cream for dipping.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Stir in tuna fish. Mix in cheese sauce until tuna is covered. Add bread crumbs and potato chips. Pour into greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Makes 4 servings.

Drain tofu well then crumble it up in a large bowl with a fork or your hands. Add vegan mayonnaise (or regular mayo if no vegan) and mix it in thoroughly. Add celery and onions and mix well until they are all covered in the dressing. Add a little more if needed to make sure everything is coated. Add dijon and salt & pepper to taste. Let it sit in the fridge for an hour or so to make the flavors meld together. Serve cold or at room temperature.

In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and the red-pepper flakes. Saute for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and saute 2 minutes. Add the sherry and the parsley. Saute for 2 minutes. Season with the old-bay seasoning and serve. Serve with a baguette.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place a rack in middle of oven. Cut bread in half horizontally and remove the crusts. Cut each half in half again horizontally to make 8 pieces of bread. Place each piece on a piece of plastic wrap and form it into a ball (don't break the bread). Place 4 pieces of bread in a 4-cup glass bowl or 2 9-inch pie plates (I used a 9-inch glass bowl) and set aside. Place remaining 4 pieces in a second 4-cup glass bowl or 2 9-inch pie plates (I used a 9-inch glass bowl) and set aside. Spray a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray (I used a 9-inch square glass baking dish). Place the bowls of bread in the dish with the bread on the bottom of the dish (don't stack the bowls). Place 2 of the 4-cup glass bowls or 2 9-inch pie plates (I used a 9-inch glass bowl

Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into 1/2-inch cubes. Place the cubes in a large saucepan with enough water to cover them. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat. Cook the sweet potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain the potatoes well when they are finished cooking. Drain off the liquid from the pan with the cooked sweet potatoes. Return the cooked sweet potatoes back into the pan with the liquid. Mash the cooked sweet potatoes until they are very smooth. Add the butter, milk, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and almonds, stirring with a wooden spoon until all the ingredients are well mixed. Place the mashed mixture into a greased 1-quart baking dish. Bake the mixture for about 45 minutes until it is brown on top and cooked through. Serve warm.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the carrots and cook for 4 minutes. Add the leeks and the garlic and cook for 5 minutes. Drain. Place the carrots and leeks in a 2-quart casserole. Add the olive oil and season to taste. Bake in a 375F (190C) preheated oven for 10 minutes.

Cook bacon in a large frying pan. When crisp drain over paper towels. Cut into small pieces. Mix together all of the ingredients except the cheese. In a small bowl, mix together the cheese and the dressing. Add the cheese to the mixture. Cover. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours.

Crumble the wafers into a bowl and set aside. In a small saucepan combine the white sugar with the instant coffee and boil until the coffee dissolves. Add the light corn syrup and boil 1 more minute. Remove from the heat. Add the coffee liqueur and stir until well blended. Pour the syrup mixture over the crumbled wafers and mix until coated. In a separate bowl combine the powdered sugar and cinnamon. Roll the coated wafers in the mixture to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with coffee. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt 2 Tablespoons of butter in a skillet over medium heat. Dip each biscuit in the melted butter. In a greased 9x13 inch pan, layer biscuits with melted butter. Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Then sprinkle with nuts. Continue layering in the same manner. Bake for 30-40 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan.

Peel and chop the kohlrabi into 1 inch cubes. Boil in water until soft. Strain well. Melt butter in a pan. Add chopped onion and cook until clear. Add chopped garlic. Add the chopped kohlrabi to the melted butter. Cook until lightly browned. Add chopped parsley. Mix in sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves. Add the chopped carrot. Add chicken broth to the pan. Cook for about ten minutes. Add the sifted flour. Mix well. Add the cooked vegetables. Mix well. Serve with bread.

Mix salted butter and icing sugar in large bowl until combined and softened slightly. Add corn starch and mix well until stiff and no lumps. Add the flour and vanilla and beat well until combined and stiff. Turn onto lightly greased surface and knead into a dough about the thickness of a quarter. Roll dough into a log and cut into 1 inch thick slices and place on greased cookie sheets about 1 inch apart. Bake for 15-18 minutes in a preheated 375 degree Fahrenheit oven until just firm to the touch and lightly browned. Allow cookies to cool on cookie sheets for about 5 minutes then transfer to wire racks and cool completely before storing in airtight containers.

Melt butter and sautee the carrot slices in the cider. Stir frequently. When the carrot slices begin to soften, add the brown sugar, tarragon and salt. Cook about 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve.
Saut butter in a pan and add cashew nuts and almonds. When nuts begin to brown add beans and saute for 10 minutes. Add blanched broccoli. Stir for 5 minutes. Season with sea salt and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9x13 pan with aluminum foil. Place a cooling rack on top and spray with cooking spray. Make sure the rack is completely flat. Place cookies in a ziploc bag. Smash them with a rolling pin or your hand until they are very thin. Remove from bag and place in pan. Pour egg yolks in a medium bowl and beat until light. Add condensed milk, vanilla and beat until combined. Pour heavy cream in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and pour over egg yolk mixture. Stir until combined. Pour over cookie layer in 9x13 pan. Chill for 3 hours. Pour heavy whipping cream into a heavy bowl. Add powdered sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread over cookie layer. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove from refrigerator and let stand for 15 minutes before cutting.

Melt butter over low heat. Cool slightly and beat in sugar. Cool to lukewarm. Gradually stir in cocoa until blended. Beat in one large egg until blended. Stir in another egg yolk. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold beaten egg whites into cocoa mixture. Stir in salt. Pour into graham cracker crust. Chill thoroughly. Serve with whipped cream and nuts. Sprinkle with chocolate curls.

In a small bowl combine orange juice, coconut milk, fish sauce and chili sauce. In a large skillet over medium-high heat add 2 tablespoons of oil. Add the shallots and saute for about 1 minute. Add 1 tablespoon of oil and saute for another 2 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for about 2 minutes more. Add the ginger and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the fish sauce mixture and cook for another minute. Add the salmon and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the cilantro and cook for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

Melt the butter. Add the light brown sugar and salt. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the maple syrup and bring the mixture to a boil. Boil for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool for 3 minutes. Stir the mixture every so often. Transfer the mixture into a bowl or container. Cover and refrigerate. Use within 1 week. Note: The sauce is not cooked as long as it might be in other recipes because it is added directly into the hot soft serve machine. If you would like it to be cooked longer, it may be reheated in a double boiler. Serve over ice cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Break bread into pieces and place in bottom of dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Crumble cooked sausage over bread pieces. Sprinkle with cheese. In a small bowl, beat together eggs and milk. Pour over bread and sausage mixture. Bake for 40 minutes or until golden brown and set. Serve warm.

Slice the jalapenos in half, remove the seeds and place on a baking sheet lined with foil or parchment paper. Place a tablespoon of softened cream cheese into the halves and wrap with a strip of bacon. Secure the bacon with a toothpick. Place on the baking sheet with the cream-cheese side down. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until the bacon is crisp. Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Grease a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. In a large mixing bowl combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, salt and orange zest. In another large mixing bowl beat the eggs. Add in the orange juice. Stir in the water. In a third large mixing bowl combine the vegetable oil with the water. Add the orange zest to this mixture. In the first mixing bowl with the dry ingredients add the wet ingredients in third mixing bowl. Stir until you have a smooth batter. Add the cooking spray to the greased pan. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until the cakes are golden brown.

Heat 2 tsp. of the oil in a large skillet. Add the mushrooms and saut until brown. Stir the garlic granules into the remaining oil. Add the brown mushroom mixture to the skillet with the remaining oil. Cook over moderate heat for 30 seconds. Stir in the wine. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer. Cook until the sauce thickens. The mushrooms may be served with steak or as an appetizer.

In large mixing bowl, crack the eggs & add the milk. Beat well with a whisk or electric beater. Sprinkle the eggs with the salt & freshly ground black pepper. In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the egg mixture. Cook & stir until the eggs are completely set. Sprinkle the top with the cheese. Cook until the cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Mix egg with breadcrumbs and add to bread crumbs. Fold in the cooked eggs. Layer into the bread rolls and then with the cheese. Place the rolls in the oven for 5 minutes until the rolls are heated through. Serve.

Prepare pastry according to package directions. Roll out pastry on a lightly floured board to 1/8-inch thickness. Cut into 12-inch circles using a 3-inch round cutter. Line tart pans with pastry circles. Fill with 1 tablespoon of rhubarb slices and 1/4 cup of raspberries each. Combine orange zest, 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour in small bowlsprinkle mixture over fruit. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from tart pans. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving with red currant jelly drizzled over top. Makes 6 servings.

Put 1/2 cup dried apple rings in a small bowladd 1 tsp freshly chopped sage leaves & 2 tsp ground cinnamonpour scotch over & let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Into 1-cup mugs, add 1 tbsp honey & 1/2 cup boiling waterstir in apple mixture & serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add corn and garlic. Cook and stir until corn is tender. Add pimiento. Cook 1 minute more. Stir in zucchini and seasonings. Cook 5 minutes longer or until zucchini is tender. Transfer to an ungreased 13x9 baking dish. Sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 1 teaspoon of creole seasoning. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm. Add the new potatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add the green beans and cook for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Drain. Add butter and stir until butter melts. Stir in remaining creole seasoning. Serve.

Toast spices in a small heavy skillet over medium heat 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Transfer spices to a food processor and pulse to grind into coarse powder. Store spice mixture in an airtight container until ready to use.
Boil water in a pot. Add the onion and tomato. Cook for a few minutes. Add the beans and mix in the soup mix. Boil until the beans are tender. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix quinoa and water. Heat on low for 10 minutes. Let cool. Mix quinoa mixture with remaining ingredients. Fill 12 greased and floured muffin tins 3/4 full. Bake for 30 minutes.

Beat eggs, oil, sugar and vanilla until blended. Mix flour with remaining ingredients. Beat egg mixture into flour mixture until dough forms. Place dough on floured surface and roll out to 1/8 inch thickness. Cut out 3-inch circles. Place 1 teaspoon of preserves in center of each circle of dough. Fold in half and press edges to seal. Place on lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Crush the wafers in the food processor or with a rolling pin until they're in small pieces. Melt the oleo in a saucepan, then add the wafers, nuts, and coconut. Stir over low heat until well blendedpour onto a cookie sheet lined with wax paper to cool completely (about 20 minutes). Dip a small cookie scoop into the frozen orange juice concentrateform the juice into balls the size of large marbles. Roll the balls in the powdered sugar to coat evenly.
Skin fish, wash well and cut into chunks. Remove all bones from pork. Melt butter in large kettle. Add pork and onions. Cook until meat is tender. Add remaining ingredients. Cook 10 minutes. Serve.

Cream together sugar and eggs until thick and light yellow color. Slowly add 1 cup cream into the eggs and sugar mixture and beat until light and fluffy. Slowly add 2 cups cream to the eggs and sugar mixture and beat until light and fluffy again. Add the remaining cup of cream and beat until light and fluffy once again. Remove 1/2 cup cream to the side and set aside to use later. Whisk the 1/2 cup of remaining cream with the Kahlua and Grand Marnier into the egg mixture and beat until light and fluffy once again. Fold the chocolate chips into the mixture until combined and add the vanilla extract and stir until combined. Pour 1/2 cup of the mixture into the bottom of each ramekin and then top with 1/2 cup of the reserved mixture from the beginning. Repeat until you have used all of the mixture and then place into the refrigerator for 60 minutes or until firm. Once the pots de crme is set remove from the refrigerator and garnish with whipped cream and drizzle with chocolate and car

Whisk egg and milk together. Dip sweet bread in egg mixture. Coat in coconut and corn flakes and place onto a greased griddle or skillet. Cook for a couple of minutes until golden. Flip and cook for another minute or two. Transfer to a serving platter and top with whipped cream and maple syrup. Serve immediately.

Cook the pasta as directed on package. When done drain pasta and keep warm. Meanwhile melt the butter and add the pot cheese and sour cream into a bowl and beat together with a whisk until smooth and blended and set aside. To serve top the pasta with the sour cream pot cheese mixture and serve immediately.

Dice onion. Melt 1 tablespoon of bacon grease in a skillet over medium heat. Cook onion until tender. Sprinkle flour over onion. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually add remaining 1 cup of bacon grease. Bring mixture to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Stir in salt and pepper. Add 1 can (28 oz) tomato sauce. Cook 15 minutes. Stir in sugar. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in celery leaves. Add 1 can (14.5 oz) tomato paste. Cook 15 minutes. Add 1 can (15 oz) whole tomatoes. Cook 15 minutes. Stir in bay leaf. Cook 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cans (28 oz) tomato sauce. Cook 15 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 can (14.5 oz) whole tomatoes. Cook 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place bread crumbs in shallow dish. Place parsley in small bowl. Combine mustard powder, salt and pepper in another small bowl. Dip each fish filet in buttermilk, then in the bread crumb mixture, then in the parsley mixture. Roll filets in remaining bread crumbs. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. While fish is baking melt butter in a skillet over medium heat and add almonds. Cook almonds until just lightly browned, about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve fish with almonds on top.
Add all ingredients to a mug. Stir to combine.

For the tarts - heat the oven to 425F. On a lightly floured board, roll the wontons skins into a 6" round disc and then cut into quarters. Place on a parchment lined cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes until slightly golden around the edges and cooked through (they will puff up). When the skins are cool enough to handle, fill with the broccoli mixture. For the broccoli mixture - in a large skillet over medium heat add the butter and cook until the butter is foamy, about 1 minute. Add the flour and cook until the mixture begins to smell nutty, about 1 minute. Add the cooked broccoli and red pepper and cook until the broccoli begins to soften slightly. Add the milk and cook until the mixture begins to thicken slightly, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and add the onion powder and thyme and cook for another minute or two until the mixture thickens more and is nicely combined. Stir in the cheddar and cook until it just melts, about another minute or two. Serve warm in the wont

Peel onions, cut into quarters and place in a large pot of boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain well. Add flour to milk, whisking until smooth. Place the milk mixture in a large saucepan. Add onions, stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Add 4 cups of the hash browns. Cook until the mixture is thick. Stir in the remaining 1 cup hash browns. Season with salt and pepper. Add the shredded cheese. Cook until melted. Spoon the mixture into an 8 x 12-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Wash and pat dry the russet potatoes, place in a large bowl and sprinkle with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Toss to coat thoroughly. Add the chopped onions and toss to coat. Pour the olive oil in the bottom of the roasting pan and add the potato mixture. Roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit or until the potatoes are tender and the onions are golden brown and crisp.

In a large pot bring water to a rolling boil. Add elbow macaroni, salt & pepper, cook until tender (12-14 minutes). Drain elbow macaroni, set aside. Dice 2-3 tomatoes add to pot. Melt butter in small pan. Add diced tomatoes to pan and simmer for 2 minutes to release some juices. Add juices to large pot with elbow macaroni and stir to mix in juices evenly with elbow macaroni. Cover with a lid and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok over medium heat. Add red pepper flakes and cook for 1 min. Add honey and stir for 1 min. Stir in remaining 2 tbsp oil, peanuts, mushrooms, onion, carrot. Cook for 3 minutes. Add 2 cups stir-fry sauce and continue to cook for 3 minutes. Add 3 cups waterbring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to mediumsimmer 3 minutes. Stir in broccoli floretscook 1 minute. Add remaining 1/2 cup stir-fry sauceserve immediately.

Wash fish filets. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Drizzle fish filets with olive oil. Sprinkle fish with sea salt. Sprinkle fish filets with pepper. Squeeze lemon over each fish filet. Squeeze orange over each fish filet. Place fish filets in a shallow baking pan. Arrange capers in a circle around each fish filet. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve fish filets.
Cook pasta and drain. Combine with velveeta and soup. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Bring the water to boiling in a medium saucepan over high heat. Cook the pasta until it is al dente. Strain the water from the pasta and set the pasta aside. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until softened. Add the spinach and saute for 2 minutes. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the beans and cook for 2 minutes. Add the broth. Bring to a boil and cook until the spinach is wilted and the beans have softened. Season to taste. Drain the pasta and add to the spinach mixture. Toss until well combined. Add the pasta water and toss to combine. Serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Blend together the first eight ingredients. Beat together the remaining ingredients. Pour the blended mixture into the pie shell. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat your oven to 325 degrees f. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, melt coconut oil. Stir in onion and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon of red wine vinegar. Add ketchup and worcestershire saucestir well. Brush this sauce on all over your turkey legs. Sprinkle sea salt and black pepper on all sides of your drumsticks and legs. Place in a large baking dish with 1/2 cup of molasses. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 15 more minutes or until your turkey is tender and juicy.

Prepare the salad by combining all the greens and other vegetables. Cut the strawberries in half and set aside. In a small bowl whisk the olive oil and mustard together. Drizzle the dressing over the vegetables and toss well to coat. Serve the vegetables with the cut strawberries.

Prepare white cake mix according to package directions. Spray 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Place 4 cups of cake mix in the pan. In a small bowl add gelatin and boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Mix in diet sprite. Add to pan. Spread raspberry jello over the top. Bake according to package directions. Remove from oven and cool. Stir in the cool whip. Sprinkle with the coconut and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Coat chicken with breadcrumb mixture and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for about an hour. While the chicken is baking, place the sour cream and all the ingredients for the dip into a blender and puree. Serve the dip with the chicken.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add egg whites and season with salt and pepper. Cook for approximately 3 minutes. Whisk together the egg yolks and add to the pan. Cook until the mixture is almost set. Transfer the mixture to an ovenproof dish and bake for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle the top with parsley and crumbled mozzarella. Bake for another 5 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot.

First boil the peeled carrots with the lemon peel in plenty of water for about an hour or until soft. When the water is reduced to a thick syrup, remove the carrots and lemon peel from the syrup and add them to a food processor. Add the egg yolks and process until thick. Add the honey, then the grated lemon peel and process again until thick. Add the grated breadcrumbs and the grated hazelnuts and process until they are incorporated into the mixture. Put the mixture in a bowl and mix in the grated carrot and the cream cheese with a whisk. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff. Gradually add the sugar and continue beating until the egg whites are stiff and glossy. Fold the egg whites into the cream cheese mixture and then fill the prepared cake tins with the mixture. Bake at gas mark 6 for about 55 minutes or until the cakes are golden brown and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Serve with whipped cream or yogurt if desired.

Slice the avocado in half and remove the pit. Scoop out the avocado meat into a bowl and mash with a fork. Add the nonfat sour cream and stir to combine. Add the rest of the ingredients and blend together well. Serve with tortilla chips.

To prepare the rice: Wash brown rice. Add water and soak for an hour. Cook the rice in a rice cooker. When the rice is tender and fluffy, set aside. To prepare the chicken: In a large skillet over medium heat, add the oil and the onion. Stir and cook for about 6 minutes until tender. Add the rice and the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Add the chicken and cook on medium heat for another 20 minutes or until the liquid is completely absorbed. Serve over the cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil. Season chops and sear on both sides until golden brown. Transfer to a 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Add wine to the skillet. Add the honey and the remaining ingredients. Cook until the liquid is reduced. Pour over the chops. Bake for 25-30 minutes until the internal temperature of the chops reaches 155 degrees.

In a small bowl, combine mustard and honey. Whisk in butter. Sprinkle both sides of tilapia with seasoned bread crumbs. Dip the fish into the mustard mixture and shake off excess. Place fillets in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with pecans and Parmesan. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork. Serve with additional sauce if desired.

Rinse fish in cold water. Dry fish with paper towel. Combine orange juice, orange peel, garlic, ginger, flour, salt and pepper. Dip fish in orange juice mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Coat the fish with flour mixture. Place fish in the hot oil. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Turn the fish over. Cook for an additional 3 to 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove the fish from the pan. Serve with green onions.

In a medium saucepan, combine the cream and espresso powder and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the espresso powder is completely dissolved. Pour the mixture into a bowl and refrigerate until cold but not frozen, about 1 hour. In a separate bowl, combine the yogurt and condensed milk and stir until blended. Pour the mixture into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into a container and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour. Pour the mixture into the frozen cream and stir until blended. Place the mixture in an ice cream maker and process until frozen. Transfer the ice cream to a container and stir in the cinnamon and figs. Freeze until firm, about 2 hours. Serve immediately.

Remove avocado pit from each half of avocadoscoop out the flesh into a medium mixing bowl. Discard seeds and peelings. Mash the avocado with a fork until it is light green in color and smooth in texture. Add the waterstir in the onions with a fork until the onions are completely incorporated with the avocado mixture. Add salt to tasteserve with tortilla chips or use in recipes calling for avocado.

Place gelatin in a bowl and pour in the boiling water. Stir until completely dissolved. Add the cold water. Stir well. Add raspberry puree. Stir well. Fold in cool whip. Place in a freezer-safe container. Freeze for 1-2 hours or until set. Store in freezer. Thaw and serve.

Cut frankfurter crosswise into six pieces. Cook in medium saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain. Mix frankfurters with onion in large skillet. Cook and stir until onion is tender. Add cream of celery soup and milk. Cook and stir for two minutes. Stir in tomato and tomato juice. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in wide egg noodles. Cook and stir until noodles are tender. Add parsley and basilcook and stir for 2 minutes. Serve immediately. Makes six servings.

Spread mayonnaise on bottom half of each tortilla. Top each with cream cheese, salsa, mustard. Add 1 slice of bacon to each. Top with a thin slice of tomato. Top with a piece of lettuce. Fold over each end of the tortilla. Roll tightly. Secure with toothpick. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add rigatoni and cook until al dente. Drain. Return to pan over medium heat. Add the remaining ingredients except the asiago and cook, stirring frequently, until heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in asiago and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Arrange asparagus spears on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and season. Bake for 10 minutes or until tender but not mushy. Meanwhile, heat butter and shallot in a small pan over medium heat. Cook until shallots are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in dijon and lemon juice. Drizzle over hot asparagus. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425f. Rub chicken breasts with olive oil and place in a large baking dish. Sprinkle the lemon juice and zest over the breasts and then season with the McCormick grill seasoning. Place the fresh rosemary and garlic clove around the dish. Pour the wine into the baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until the breasts are tender.

Trim the bottoms off the brussels sprout and green beans and cut in half vertically. Slice the garlic clove in half and then into quarters. Melt butter in a large pan or skillet until bubbly and sizzling. Add the brussel sprouts and green beans to the butter and cook until browned on all sides and tender when pierced with a knife. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper and top with the balsamic vinegar just before serving.

Mix first 8 ingredients in a medium-size resealable plastic bag. Add chicken and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Remove chicken from bag and coat with crumbs. Heat oven to 350. Place chicken on a non-stick baking pan. Bake 30-35 minutes until juices run clear.

Sauté the shallots in butter in a large skillet over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until translucent. Add the mushrooms to the pan with the butter and shallots and saut until the mushrooms are tender. Add the wine to the pan along with the artichokes. Cook over medium heat until the liquid evaporates. Stir in the chives. Add the pimiento and shrimp. Cook about 5 minutes until the shrimp is cooked through. Serve hot.

Prepare dough according to the instructions on your bread machine. Use 1-1/2 cups water2 teaspoons sugar1 egg1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon dry milk1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon dry milk1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk1/2 teaspoon salt1/3 cup dry milk

Place a large spoonful of the cooked chicken in a medium bowl. Add the boiled egg halves. Stir in the celery and green onions. Mix in the pickle relish. Add the mayonnaise and season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the parsley. Cover and refrigerate until serving. Serve with crackers or slices of fresh bread.

Combine water and coffee and bring to a boil. Add tomato sauce and continue to boil until thickened. Stir in other ingredients and reduce heat to medium. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat. Serve warm.

In a large bowl mix the flour and the sugar together. Add the milk, egg and the butter. Beat with mixer for 2 minutes. Add the baking powder and salt. Beat for one more minute. Stir in the plum and almond flavoring. Spoon batter into muffin cups and place in a preheated oven for 20 minutes or until done. Allow muffins to cool before removing from pan.

Peel and chop potatoes and place them in a large saucepan with chicken broth. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes or until fork tender. Drain the liquid and puree the potatoes with a hand held mixer or blender or food processor. Return to saucepan and add broth, cheese and garlic powder. Stir to combine and simmer for 2 minutes or so to melt the cheese. Taste for seasoning and serve hot with a sprinkle of black pepper.

In a large saucepan heat oil. Brown meat. Add onions and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add beef and cook until browned. Add potatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Add sausage, peppers, beans and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 15 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over rice.

Preheat grill or oven broiler. In a large bowl combine the chicken breast halves with the asparagus spears, cherry tomatoes and pine nuts. Toss well. Season with the oil, vinegar and mustard then add the basil. Place the vegetables under the grill or broiler or place under a hot grill lid in an oven proof dish. Cook until tender, about 8-10 minutes turning them over half way through the cooking time. Remove from the heat and leave to cool. Serve on the leaves of the salad leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. Cut 1 cup of the bread into 1 inch cubes. Cut the rest of the bread into 1 inch pieces. Arrange the bread cubes on the bottom of the greased dish. Pour the milk into a large bowlstir in the egg yolks with a wire whisk until blended. Stir in the ham cubes. Pour the milk mixture over the bread cubes. Sprinkle the bread pieces with the chives, sliced ortega chiles and the diced onion. Arrange the chunks of ham on top of the bread pieces. Sprinkle the bread mixture with the chives and sliced ortega chiles. Sprinkle the bread mixture with the shredded cheese. Arrange the egg whites on top of the bread mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until the bread cubes are golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Stir in the butter to the boiling water to make a cream mixture. Pour mixture over the grits. Stir in the cheese. Stir to melt the cheese. Stir in the tomatoes, onion, salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until the grits are tender.

Combine all ingredients except red pepper flakes in a saucepan over medium heat until heated through, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low, simmer 20 minutes and stir occasionally. Stir in red pepper flakes just before serving.

Make the pastry. Roll out the pastry and line a 20cm round flan tin. Mix all the dry ingredients and put in the flan tin. Roll out the remaining pastry and cut into strips. Arrange the pastry strips over the top of the filling. Roll out the remainder of the pastry and cut into circles. Arrange the circles over the strips. Whisk the eggs, sugar and lemon juice together and brush over the top. Bake at 200 degrees for 30 mins. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Serve with cream.

Slice the potato in half and scoop out the insides into a bowl. Squeeze the potato skin with your hand (be careful not to break the skin). Place the insides into a bowl and add the thyme and cumin powder and mix well. Spread the mixture into an even layer in a lightly greased dish and set aside for a while. Meanwhile, preheat your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a cookie sheet and set aside. When ready to cook the potatoes, dab the insides and the outsides with flour and place them onto the cookie sheet (the ones with the insides will have the outsides facing down). Cook for about 15 minutes and then turn them over. Cook for another 10 minutes and then remove from the oven and brush with the melted butter. Sprinkle with some sumac and serve.

Cook hamburger and onion until meat is brown. Drain. Stir in water, tomato paste and taco seasoning mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Spread meat mixture into a lightly greased 11 x 7 inch baking dish. Top with cheddar cheese. Cover with taco chips. Bake in 350f oven for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.

Bring water to a boil. Add flour and stir. Add tomatoes (canned or fresh) and stir. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add onion, bell pepper, minced garlic cloves. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt & pepper.

Wash and cut up 1 pound of fresh rhubarb into 1 inch pieces. Place in a kettle. Add 2 cups of hot water. Bring to a boil and cook until the rhubarb is tender. Remove from heat and drain. Add 1 cup of cold water to the kettle and stir in 2 cups of powdered sugar. Add 1 teaspoon of raspberry gelatin and the drained rhubarb. Place in a blender and blend for 15 to 20 seconds. Pour into a clear glass bowl. Refrigerate until completely cold. Top with whiped cool whip or vanilla pudding.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the macaroni until al dente (approximately 5 minutes), then drain well. Return the drained noodles to the pot and melt 6 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the eggs one at a time, stirring constantly until the egg is fully cooked. Stir in the remaining 6 tablespoons of the butter and then slowly add the drained macaroni along with the rest of the butter to the skillet. Add the evaporated milk, condensed cheddar cheese soup, and the milkstirring constantly until the mixture is heated through. Remove from the heat and stir in the cheddar cheese until it is completely melted into the sauce. Season with the paprika and serve with fresh parsley if desired.
In a small bowl stir together the yogurt, cumin, paprika, cayenne and sugar. In another bowl stir together the cucumber and mint. Mix the two together.

Preheat the oven to 350F. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the oil. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the pan and drain well. In the same pan, add the water, milk and dijon mustard. Whisk until combined. Add the leek soup mix and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Add the broccoli and cook until the broccoli is tender. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the rice. Transfer to a 9x13 baking dish. Top with the cheddar. Top with the roasted red peppers. Bake for 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Rinse the fish fillet under cold water and pat it dry with a clean kitchen towel or paper towel. Rub the fillet with olive oil, sprinkle it lightly with the fresh ground pepper and place it skin side down in a baking dish. Layer the shallot slices over the fillet, followed by the cherry tomatoes, black olives, capers and the oregano sprigs. Place the baking dish in the preheated oven for 20 minutes until the fillet is cooked through. Remove the fillet from the baking dish and drizzle it lightly with the balsamic vinegar. Serve the fillet immediately with the vegetables.
Combine all ingredients except chicken. Brush chicken with sauce. Place in a shallow pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until done.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Slice the onions thinly. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil and the onions. Cook until the onions are golden brown, stirring frequently. Add 1 tablespoon of butter. Transfer the mixture to a large shallow baking dish. Heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Add half of the sweet potatoes. Cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add half of the chopped thyme. Repeat with remaining butter, potatoes and thyme. Season with salt and black pepper. Spread half of the sour cream over the top of the onions. Sprinkle half of the cheese over the sour cream. Arrange the remaining half of the potatoes over the cheese. Sprinkle with remaining half of cheese. Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with remaining sour cream.

In a small mixing bowl, combine cream cheese and mayonnaise. Gradually beat in the milk. Add horseradish sauce, red pepper sauce and worcestershire sauce. Stir in tuna and paprika. Serve with crackers or toast squares. Refrigerate leftovers.

Prepare crust as directed on package for making one 9 x13-inch pan of yellow cake mix (about 2 cups). In a large bowl combine pineapple chunks, blackberries, peaches, pecans and remaining package yellow cake mix (do not add water) until combinedset aside. Spread crust mixture into a greased 9 x13-inch panpour fruit mixture over crust mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for 50 minutes or until golden browncool for 1 hour before serving. Serves about 12.

Toast the english muffins. Slice the canadian bacon in half and toast. Top the english muffins with slices of cheese. Crack the two eggs into two small bowls and beat until they are fluffy. Pour the beaten eggs into the toasted english muffins. Place the toasted half of the canadian bacon on the toasted english muffins. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the eggs over medium heat until they are almost cooked through. Carefully add a tablespoon of hollandaise sauce and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the oil. Add the chicken breast halves and saute until browned on both sides. Remove the chicken. Add the butter, garlic and sage leaves. Saute until the garlic is tender. Add the chicken broth. Add the chicken back into the pan. Cover and simmer on medium-low heat for approximately 15 minutes. Transfer the chicken into a serving dish. Add the potatoes into the skillet. Cover and cook until tender. Stir in the parsley. Serve the chicken on a bed of the potato saute.

Peel and slice the potatoes about 3-5mm thick. Add to a saucepan and cover with water, bring to the boil and reduce to a simmer for 7- 10minutes, they should be just cooked. Grease a 25x25 cm square baking dish with butter. Well drain the potatoes and pour into the dish, let cool for 20 minutes. In a bowl, mix the other ingredients in and pour over the almost cold potatoes. More butter can be dotted over the top if desired. Bake at 180oc for 25 minutes.

Melt butter, add flour and seasonings and mix well. Add onions and cook until tender. Stir in the sour cream and seasonings and add the string beans and cook until tender. Stir in the cheese and pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Top with cornflake crumbs. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl, beat together eggs and milk. In another small bowl, mix together hot sauce and hot pepper jelly. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter. Fry each side of each slice of bread for 1 minute. Remove from skillet and arrange slices of bread in single layer on cookie sheet. Spread each slice of bread with hot sauce mixture. Place slices of turkey and smoked ham on top of sauce. Break 1 whole egg into a small bowl and mix with milk. Using a pastry brush or small spatula, brush each slice of bread with beaten eggs. Place one slice of cheese on top of each slice of bread. Sprinkle each slice of bread with remaining 2 tablespoons unsalted butter. Bake until eggs are cooked through and bread is golden brown and tender. Serve with hot pepper jelly for dipping.

Add chicken, celery, dried dill weed, red bell peppers in food processor bowlpulse until chopped. In medium mixing bowl, add dry ranch dressing mix, mayonnaise and pulse mixture until blendedblend in remaining mixture until desired consistency is reached.

Clean and remove stems from mushroom caps. Sauté garlic and scallion in a skillet until soft and add to a bowl with sausages and soy sauce. Blend well and fill caps with mixture. In a separate bowl, combine egg and white bread crumbs and mix well. Roll mixture into balls and roll into flour and then into egg mixture until coated well. Fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with mashed potatoes and vegetables.

Combine sugar and water in a large saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil. Boil for 30 seconds. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in peanut butter until mixture is smooth. Stir in the ice cream and salted peanuts. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients together. Put into a greased 9 x 11 pan. Bake in a preheated 375 degree f. Oven for 40 minutes. Let cool for about 10 minutes before serving. Top with sweetened whipped cream and garnish with slivered almonds if desired.

Bring the milk and honey to a boil in a small saucepan. Add the couscous and stir well. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add the fruit and nuts. Pour into a shallow dish. Sprinkle with the vanilla and cinnamon. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Garnish with whipped cream.
Heat milk in a saucepan over low heat. Cook eggs in a small saucepan until almost hard. Remove eggs from saucepan. Stir in pastina. Sprinkle with parmesan. Serve immediately.

Season the steak with a little salt and pepper. Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a frying pan until hot. Add the steak and brown on all sides. Remove from the pan and keep warm. Meanwhile, slice the sweet potatoes into thin slices. Brush them with a little oil and sprinkle with a little black pepper. Place in a roasting pan and roast for about 20 minutes until tender. Place the steak back into the frying pan and cook until done. Serve with the steak on top of the slices of sweet potato.

Spread the chive & onion cream cheese onto one piece of the roll. Place the ham over it. Put the second piece of the roll over the top. Butter the outside and place on the baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the roll is golden brown. Combine the Worcestershire sauce and the Parmesan cheese and brush onto the baked rolls. Sprinkle with the dried onion flakes and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Unroll each biscuit and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Spread each biscuit with pasta sauce and sprinkle with pepperoni and mozzarella cheeses. Place green peppers and onions on top of each. Place sliced mushrooms on top of each. Cover each with parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Brown meat and onions in oil. Drain. Stir in all remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer until peppers are tender. Serve over cooked rice. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Spray the inside of a bundt pan generously with nonstick spray. In a large mixing bowl, combine the yellow cake mix and instant pudding mix.
