Beat the eggs and oil together and stir in the liquids. Combine the dry and wet mixtures. Pour into the prepared bundt pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes. The cake is done when a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a rack. Make the glaze while the cake is still warm. Mix the powdered sugar and the coffee liqueur in a bowl. Add a few drops of strong black coffee and stir until the glaze is smooth. Drizzle the glaze over the bundt cake. Sprinkle with the powdered sugar.

Rinse and soak pink beans in enough water to cover. In large pot, brown onions in oil. Add water to cover. Add ham hocks and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until tender. Add beans and simmer until tender. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Put avocados, tomatillos, red onion, roma tomatoes in a food processoradd remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate overnight to blend flavors before serving with tortilla chips or pita chips.

Preheat oven to 425f. Grease a 12 cup muffin pan with cooking spray and dust with flour. In a medium bowl, mix the flour, soda and salt together until well blended and set aside. In a large bowl, cream together the bananas and butter until well blended. Add the egg and vanilla extract and blend well. Stir in the flour mixture and stir just until combined. Stir in the chocolate chips and pour into the prepared muffin cups about half full and top with another tablespoon of batter. Bake for 18 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool in pan for about 1 minute and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Spread bottom halves of crescent rolls with miracle whip. Layer with crab meat and green onions. Sprinkle with cheddar and parsley. Roll up and seal. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine 1 cup panko and 4 Tbsp. melted butter. Sprinkle fish with 1/2 Tbsp. parmesan cheese and 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper. Dip fish into panko mixture. Place fish in lightly oiled 9x13 inch baking dish. Combine remaining 2/3 cup panko with remaining 4 Tbsp. melted buttersprinkle over fish. Bake for 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Sprinkle fish with remaining 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper before serving. Serve with your favorite side dishes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart casserole dish with shortening. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine brown sugar, flour, salt and 1/2 cup of water. Cook for 1 minute stirring constantly with a wire whisk. Remove from heatadd egg yolks to mixture. Stir until smoothpour mixture into prepared casserole dish. In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks formadd remaining 1/2 cup of water and beat until foamyfold egg whites into mixture in casserole dish. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. In a small bowl, combine remaining 2 tablespoons of water and vanilla extractdrizzle over casserole just before serving.

Cook the spaghetti according to directions on package. Meanwhile, finely chop the parsley and the hot chili peppers. Heat the oil and the butter over medium-low heat and saute the garlic and the parsley until the garlic is lightly browned and the parsley is wilted. Add the hot red chili peppers and cook for 1 minute. Add the chopped parsley and the chopped chili to the cooked spaghetti and toss well with a large fork. Serve immediately while hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 13 by 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Drizzle olive oil over the bottom of the pan. Place the chicken breasts in the baking dish and season with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Drizzle the marmalade over the chicken breasts. Sprinkle the rosemary over the chicken breasts. Pour the sherry vinegar over the top of the pan and sprinkle the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper over the top of the pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the chicken reads 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Boil potatoes until soft but not mushy. Mash with butter. Mix in watercress, peas, corn. Salt and pepper as desired.

Spray 2 qt (2 liter) casserole with cooking spray. Stir together simply mashed potatoes and chicken broth in large bowl. Stir in garlic powder and baby spinach. Stir in cheese until melted. Pour into prepared casserole. Sprinkle with paprika and black pepper. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through. Top with additional shredded cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes. Remove to serving platter. Stir in sour cream. Garnish with chopped green onions. Serve with hot biscuits or garlic toast.
Combine dry and wet ingredients. Fold in mayonnaise and eggs. Bake in a greased 9x13 inch pan at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. In large saucepan bring water and ham bone to boil over medium heat. Add split peas and simmer for about 2 hours or until tender. Remove ham bone and discard. Strain and reserve. In food processor or blender process ham bone liquid and puree until smooth. Heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté carrot and garlic until tender. Add pureed liquid, marjoram and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve.

Brown the meat with the salt and pepper. Form into four patties. Grill them over a medium heat until cooked through. In the meantime, cut the buns in half. Toast the buns in the oven. When the meat is cooked, add the butter and the mozzarella cheese to the pan and melt together. Add the cooked patties and the gravy. Fill the bottom half of the bun with the poutine and the top half with the meat. Garnish with caramelized onions and serve.

Prepare peaches. Add to a large 6 to 7 quart slow cooker (if you do not have a large one, just prepare two batches and freeze one). Add water, light brown sugar and lemon juice to the peaches and stir to combine. Cover and cook on HIGH for 2-3 hours or until peaches are softened and juices are bubbling. Discard any peach pits and cut the flesh from the peach halves. Place the flesh back into the slow cooker and discard the skin and seeds. Add the ground ginger and cloves to the slow cooker and stir to combine. Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 to 2 more hours (or until desired consistency). Serve warm with biscuits.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 8" x 4" loaf pans. In a medium mixing bowl combine 1 1/2 cups of flour with the sugar. Add the Crisco to the mixture. Add the 1 egg at a time beating well after each addition. Add the 2nd egg. Add the 1 teaspoon of vanilla. Add the 2 cups of milk to the mixture. Sift the remaining 1/2 cup of flour into the mixture. Mix until smooth. Divide the batter evenly between the two loaf pans. Bake for 45 - 50 minutes or until the tops are golden brown. Cool completely on wire rack. Enjoy.
Cook the chicken breasts. Mix the poppy seeds into the spinach. Combine all the other ingredients. Serve on a bed of the cooked chicken.

Combine all the seasonings except the brown sugar in a small bowl. Rub the seasoning mixture all over the tenderloins and place tenderloins into a 9x13 baking pan. Sprinkle brown sugar over tenderloins. Bake at 350f for about 20 minutes.
Grill brats over medium-high heat for 10 minutes. Add peppers and onionscook for 10 minutes longer. Stir in paprika and caraway seed. Cook until vegetables are soft. Serve with hot sauce.

Boil about 4 cups of water. Add dried herbs. When the herbs are about half of their original size, add the cauliflower florets. Add the cut-up carrots and celery and the chopped onions. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to simmer. Add the chicken to the pot and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the pasta according to package directions. Drain the pasta and add it to the pot. Stir in the pasta and continue cooking for 10 to 15 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the parmesan cheese and serve.

To make the onions, combine all the ingredients in a large frying pan. Bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes, covered, until the onions are soft. Add the cumin seeds to the vegetable oil and heat to smoking point. Add the garlic to the pan and stir fry for a minute. Add the lentils to the cumin seeds and garlic and stir until they are coated in the oil. Add the onions to the frying pan along with the lentils, stir and bring to a simmer. Cover the frying pan with a lid and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season to taste with salt and cayenne. Serve the curry with rice and plain yogurt.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water until just tender. Drain. Combine with ham and celery. Melt butter and add lime juice and honey. Combine with macaroni mixture and season with salt and pepper. Mound into a serving dish. Make a ring of cilantro around top of dish and sprinkle with fresh melon. Serve chilled.

Combine all filling ingredients in a bowl. Place 1/2 cup of filling on one side of each piece of chicken breast. Roll up the filling side of the chicken breast. Place in a lightly oiled 10 x 12 baking dish. Cover with extra filling. Cover with seasoned bread crumbs. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Bake for 20 minutes at 375 degrees. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Mix flour with salt and pepper. Add olive oil to make a paste. Dip the breast into the paste on each side. Dip into the flour. Sprinkle with thyme. Heat oil in a large pan. Add breast. Cook until golden brown on each side. Add olives. Pour a little wine over the pan. Cover with a lid. Cook until the wine is absorbed. Serve immediately.

Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Meanwhile, saute garlic in olive oil until lightly browned. Add fontina cheese to skillet. Stir until the cheese is melted. Stir in prosciutto. Add cooked gnocchi to skillet. Stir until gnocchi are coated with the cheese sauce. Sprinkle with basil. Serve.
Prepare pork chop. Sprinkle apple with margarine and brown sugar. Place apple on top of each pork chop. Sprinkle pork and apple with cinnamon. Bake uncovered for 45 to 50 min. Serve.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat the canola oil. Saute the garlic clove in the hot oil until fragrant. Add the cooked brown rice. Saute 3 minutes. Add the fresh snow peas and saute 3 minutes longer. Add fresh cilantro and saute 1 minute longer. Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Melt butter in medium-size skillet over medium-low heat. Add sugar, milk and flour. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in the cocoa.

In a small saucepan combine the water, soymilk, vanilla extract, cinnamon and salt. Bring mixture to a simmer over medium heat and cook for 10 minutes. Remove pan from heat and set aside for an hour or two. Pour mixture into an ice cream freezer or metal bowl placed in freezer. Stir every 20-30 minutes until mixture is almost setdo not let mixture freeze solid. Stir in almonds and mint sprig. Serve immediately or transfer to an airtight container for later use.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Prepare an 8-inch cast-iron skillet by spraying it with cooking spray and placing it on the bottom shelf of the oven. In a large bowl combine the flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt. In another bowl whisk together the eggs, canola oil, creamed corn and plain fat-free yogurt. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir until well combined. Pour the mixture into the skillet and bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve the bread warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients. In another small mixing bowl, combine applesauce with the egg whites. Add the egg whites to dry ingredients. Beat until smooth. Fold in mashed bananas and vanilla extract. Pour batter into a greased loaf pan. Bake for 60 minutes. Let cool. Serve with butter and your favorite jam. Serves 15.

Melt chocolate and butter together. Add egg and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in sugar and vanilla until well blended. Add half of the flour and half of the nuts and beat until well blended. Add remaining flour and nuts and beat until well blended. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for about 10 minutes or until set and lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheets immediately and cool on wire racks.

Mix together seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Place boneless pork chops and 1/3 of the seasoning mixture on bottom of 6 quart slow cooker. Top with apples and sauerkraut. Add remaining seasoning mixture and wine to top of mixture. Add peas to top of mixture. Place kielbasa on top of peas. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hours or until meat and apples are tender. Serve with hot bread or rolls.
In large mixing bowl, blend all ingredients together. Roll in chopped nuts. Serve with graham cracker sticks.

Preheat oven to 400f. In large saucepan cook the potatoes until tender over medium-high heat. Drain well. In a large baking dish combine the apple pie filling and the cooked potatoes. Sprinkle evenly with the apple pie spice and pecans. In a small bowl whisk together the golden raisin and sugar until the raisin are coated. Sprinkle evenly over the apple mixture in the baking dish and bake for 20 minutes or until the top is golden.

Chop the cilantro leaves coarsely and add to a bowl with the rest of the ingredients. Stir until the mixture is uniformly green. Let sit for at least an hour. Serves 6 as a dip for tortilla chips or a spread for sandwiches.

Mix together the fish sauce, cracked black pepper, crushed red chilli flakes and shallots. Put the corn kernels into the fish sauce mixture. Add the beaten egg. Stir in the cornflour. Form the corn mixture into 12 even sized patties. Heat the oil in a wok or deep saucepan. Fry the patties in the hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Remove with slotted spoon. Drain well. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heatadd garlicsaute garlic until softened about 2 minutesadd ground turkeybrown turkey until almost done about 10 minutesadd spaghetti saucebring to a boiladd sweet corn, italian seasoning, elbow macaronibring to a boilturn heat down to lowsimmer 20-25 minutesserve with breadsticks.

Boil water with the tea bags in a tea kettle or small saucepan for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags & let cool slightly. Stir in the unsweetened cranberry juice & boiling water until the juice is dissolved. Stir in the apple cider & add the brown sugar & spicesbring to a boil & boil for 1 minute more. Stir in the orange slices & serve immediately in mugs.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a large baking pan or sheet pan with a sheet of aluminum foil. Place the sweet potatoes in a large bowl. Add the olive oil and toss to coat the sweet potatoes evenly. Place the pineapple chunks in the bowl and toss to coat. Place the sweet potatoes and pineapple in the prepared pan. Sprinkle the salt evenly over the top. Roast 1 hour or until the pineapple is tender. While the pineapple is roasting, place the pecans in a small bowl. Add the maple syrup and orange marmalade. Toss well to coat the nuts. Sprinkle the pineapple and pecans evenly over the top of the sweet potatoes. Roast 15 to 20 minutes or until the pineapple is tender. Sprinkle the dijon mustard over the top. Garnish if desired.

Place a large pot over medium heat. Add the chicken, carrots and celery and cook for 4 minutes. Add the rice and cook for 3 minutes. Add the broth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 12 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove from the heat and stir in the seasoning. Serve.

Combine all the ingredients and stir to blend. Place the meat into a large plastic bag and pour the marinade into the bag. Close the bag and refrigerate for 30 minutes or over night. Preheat grill to medium and brush the grate lightly with oil. Remove the meat from the refrigerator and discard the marinade and place the meat on the grill over medium-high heat and cook about 8 to 10 minutes per side or until done. Remove the meat from the grill and slice and serve warm.

Boil 1/2 cup of water. Add 1 package lime Jello and 1 cup cold water. Stir until dissolved. Add 3/4 cup sour cream and 1 can (12 oz.) pineapple chunks. Stir. Chill. Put lettuce leaves on individual salad plates. Layer in order listed on lettuce. Top with 1/4 cup each of sour cream and pineapples.

Combine flour and salt with baking powder. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add garlic and green chiles. Add whipping cream and mix until a soft dough forms. Add more whipping cream if needed to bind dough. Flour your hands and pat dough out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into rounds with a 2 inch biscuit cutter. Place rounds on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 425 for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Peel and grate the beets and place in a bowl with the butter. Add the sugar and stir in the vinegar and salt and pepper. Cover with foil and keep in the fridge until ready to serve. You can also roast the grated beets first for extra flavor if you prefer.

Boil 1 cup of brown lentils in 3 cups of vegetable broth until very tender, about 40 minutes. Drain well and set aside to cool. In a food processor, blend 1 cup of the drained brown lentils, 1/2 cup of the vegetable broth, 1/4 cup of the diced red bell peppers and 1/4 cup of the monterey jack cheese until smooth. Season with salt to taste. Serve as a dip or spread.

Roll out puff pastry and use it to line the bottom and up the sides of a deep dish. Chop the red onions into small pieces and place them in a saucepan with a good amount of salt and a bay leaf. Heat over a medium heat until the onions are soft and golden. Drain the onions and keep them aside for later. In a large pan heat up some unsalted butter with a good amount of garlic and a bay leaf and cook for a few minutes. Add the black peppercorns and the whole cloves and cook for a further few minutes. Pour in the red onions and cook for a couple more minutes. Mix in a few handfuls of sea salt and stir well. Pour in a good amount of water and bring it to a boil. Take the pan off the heat and add the fresh thyme. Allow the mixture to cool. Roll out the puff pastry and use it to line the bottom and up the sides of a deep dish. Put the filling inside the pastry and fold over the edges. Brush the pastry with a mixture of milk and egg yolk. Bake for about 45 minutes at 1

Place chicken in a large bowl. Pour hot water over toplet stand for 5 minutes. Drain. Place chicken in a lightly greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Pour mixture from bowl over chicken. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncoversprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Stir vegetables into hot mixturesprinkle with cheese. Bake 15 minutes more or until hot and cheese is melted. Let stand for 5 minutes before servinggarnish with paprika if desired.

Pour 1 cup of cold water over the dry noodles in a medium bowl until they are completely covered. Set aside 5 minutes to let the noodles soften. Then drain the noodles well. Transfer the noodles to a serving bowl. Whisk together the remaining ingredients in a small bowl or measuring cup until they are combined. Pour the sauce over the noodles and mix well. Add more balsamic vinegar or brown sugar to taste if desired. Enjoy immediately!
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Taste and adjust seasonings.

Cream butter, applesauce, sugar, eggs and vanilla until smooth. Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt into a separate bowl. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until combined. Stir in the quick cooking oats and chopped chocolate chips. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing about 2 inches apart. Bake for about 15 minutes or until the edges of the cookies begin to turn lightly golden brown. Let cool on the cookie sheets for about 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

In large skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Add garlic, tomato sauce, water, salt and pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Place fish in shallow baking pan. Pour sauce over fish. Bake in a moderate oven for about 10 minutes. Remove from the ovengarnish with fresh parsley.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain the pasta and return to the saucepan. Add the remaining ingredients except the cheddar. Stir to blend. Cook over medium heat until the sauce is thickened. Do not boil. Remove from heat. Stir in the cheddar. Serve hot.

Prepare rice as label directs. Meanwhile, in medium nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium heat until hot. Add garlic and onion. Cook and stir 3 minutes. Add shrimp and fish sauce. Cook 2 minutes or until shrimp is done. Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Add pineapple and green onions. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir and fluff rice with fork before serving.

Pour sauce and butter into a large bowl. Add the wings. Stir to coat the wings and set aside. In a large skillet, sauté the onion in the hot butter until soft. Add the vinegar and the ranch dressing mix. Bring to a boil. Pour over the chicken and coat the chicken with the sauce. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Grill or broil the wings until hot and crispy.

Cream cheese with margarine. Add sugar. Mix in cooled pretzel sticks. Add water to boiling raspberry jello. Stir until dissolved. Add to the cream cheese mixture. Stir in cool whip. Mix until thoroughly blended. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Refrigerate until set. Top with fresh raspberries.

In a small bowl combine the sugar and the water. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add boiling water to the sugar mixture. Dissolve the red raspberry jelly in the boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add the cranberry sauce and the lemon juice. Stir until combined. Pour into a 13x9 baking pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for several hours or until firm. To serve, cut into squares.

Mix the sauce and the spaghetti noodles together in a pan. Cook them together until the noodles are soft. Then take them out and put the ravioli on the plate with some sauce on top and some cheese on top and cook it in the oven for about 15 minutes or until the ravioli is cooked through and the cheese is melted and the noodles are warm.

Remove pita bread from bag and toast lightly on both sides under broiler or toaster oven. Spread chive & onion cream cheese evenly over bread. Top with tuna & cheddar cheese. Broil 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted & bread is golden brown. Top with fresh vegetables if desired.

First make the dressing. In a small bowl, combine the dashi and soy sauces together and whisk until smooth and emulsified. In a different bowl, mix together the sesame seeds and the dressing until smooth. Next, make the spinach salad by combining the spinach and the dressing together and tossing well. Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook hash browns according to package directions. While they are cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic powder to skillet and cook for 1 minute. Then add ground turkey and seasonings to meat. Cook meat until brown. Remove meat from skillet and set aside. Drain hash browns and spread evenly in the bottom of an unbaked 9-inch pie dish. Arrange meat over hash browns. Roll out the pastry into a 12x12 square. Cut into six 3-inch squares. Place one over each of the meat-hash brown mixture. Press edges together firmly and trim off any excess pastry. Brush the top of each pastry with the egg wash. Sprinkle the top of each with cheese and bake for 30 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Serve immediately with salad.
Beat egg yolks with sugar until creamy and light yellow in color. Add vanilla and lemon rind and stir in nuts and bake for about 10 minutes at 325 degrees F or until edges are light brown.

Preheat oven to 450f degrees. Butter 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Place bread in food processor or blender and process until crumbs form (about 1 minute). Stir in half-and-half and process until mixture is smooth (about 30 seconds). Stir in egg and seasoning. Process until dough is well blended and smooth (about 30 seconds). Form dough into 8 patties. Place on greased baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and press down slightly. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and drain on paper towels. Dip cutlets in butter and serve.

Combine honey and rice wine vinegar in small bowl. Stir in poppy seeds. Whisk in mayonnaise. Toss in apples and cranberries. Place chicken in shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered at 425 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until done. Cool. Cut into thin strips. Place in large bowl. Add dressing and apple mixture. Toss well. Chill. Serve over bread.

Beat together the butter, powdered sugar and extract until light and creamy. Add the nuts and blend well. Stir in the flour until dough forms a ball. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on to an ungreased cookie sheet. Press down slightly to form a ball. Flatten slightly while warm. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the onions in a shallow nonreactive pan over medium-high heat. Cook the onions until they are golden brown. Add the butter, brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon of water to the pan. Cook the onions until they are tender. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture. Cook the mixture over medium heat until it is browned. Drain off any excess liquid. Add the beef to the pan with the onions. Sprinkle the beef with the salt and pepper. Cook the beef for 3 minutes. Place the pan in the preheated oven. Cook the beef for 15 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar. Cook the mixture for 30 seconds. Remove the pan from the oven. Sprinkle the parsley over the beef. Serve.

Mix all ingredients in a large bowl until well blended. Form into meatballs and place on a jellyroll pan. Bake at 350f for 40 minutes. Combine tomato sauce and brown sugar and pour over meatballs in pan. Bake 15 minutes. Serve on hot cooked pasta.

Pour one cup of honey into a large bowl. Add sugar, vanilla extract and water. Whisk until sugar dissolves. Pour mixture into a large baking dish. Add cranberries. Dip slices of whole grain bread into the honey mixture. Place onto a cookie sheet. Let soak about 5 minutes. Flip and repeat on second side. Whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract and 1 teaspoon sugar. Dip soaked slices of bread into egg mixture. Place into hot skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides. Top each slice of French toast with brie cheese before serving.

Cream butter and flour to a smooth consistency. Pour into pastry shell. Dice the jarlsberg cheese. Saute the mushrooms in butter. Add to the mixture. Add 10 oz. of spinach. Blend until thoroughly mixed. Spoon mixture into the pastry shell. Bake in a 350 degree oven for about 45 minutes or until the filling has set. Let the pie cool and refrigerate overnight. Cut in squares and serve.
Soak the seeds in the rice vinegar for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Place the seeds with the rest of the ingrediants into a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Serve with ham.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners or use paper cups and spray with cooking spray. Combine brownie mix, applesauce and egg whites in a bowl until smooth. Pour evenly into muffin cups. Bake cupcakes according to package instructions or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove cupcakes from muffin tins using knife or fork and allow to cool completely on wire rack before decorating. Once cupcakes have cooled, top with light whipped topping, candy corn or sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease 2 x 20cm round sandwich tins. Whisk together flour, eggs, sugar, butter, milk and vanilla extract in a large bowl until smooth. Divide mixture between sandwich tins. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown (a skewer inserted into the centre should come out clean). Leave to cool in tins for 10 minutes before turning out. Dust with icing sugar or ice with a suitable icing or frosting.

Beat in orange rind and juice. Add orange zest. Beat in orange zest and juice. Add orange rind. Beat in butter. Add salt. Beat in flour. Add vanilla. Beat well. Pour into pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes.

In a large pot over medium-high heat add olive oil. Add the onions, garlic, potatoes and cauliflower. Cook for 3-5 minutes until slightly translucent. Add chicken broth and water to pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Puree using a hand immersion blender until smooth. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Top with chives.

In a stock pot combine first 7 ingredients. Cook over medium heat until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Add chicken to the vegetables and cook for 1 minute over medium heat, stirring to separate meat from bone. Stir in corn and heat through. Serve.

In a large saucepan, combine soy sauce, rice wine, brown sugar, cornstarch, vegetable oil, gingerroot and garlic. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until thickened and bubbly, 2 minutes more. Pour into a large bowl. Set aside. In a large frying pan over medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. Add steak. Cook until brown, stirring often, about 6 minutes. Add snow peascook until crisp-tender, about 1 minute. Add cooked steak to soy sauce mixturestir until steak is coated. Cover with foilkeep warm over low heat 15 minutes. Transfer to a serving plattertop with reserved steak pieces. Serve with steamed rice.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add onions. Saute over medium heat until tender. Stir in curry powder. Cook 1 minute. Add broth. Simmer until liquid is almost completely evaporated. Place cooked chicken in a blender or food processor. Add the onion mixture. Process until smooth. Stir in aroma seasoning. Pour chicken mixture into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Cover with rice. Sprinkle with corn flake crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cook ground beef with onions and spaghetti sauce. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce. Add macaroni noodles. Sprinkle with pepperoni. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through.

Boil water in pot to cook pasta. Cook for 10 minutes. Drain and reserve 1 cup water. Meanwhile, prepare marinara sauce and eggplant by following the recipe below. Drain eggplant and cut into 1-inch cubes. Set aside. In another bowl prepare the pesto by combining the basil leaves and garlic in the food processor. Pulse until coarsely chopped. With motor running, slowly add oil to make a thick paste. Add the grated Parmigiano-Reggiano and pulse until combined. Set aside. Drain the cooked eggplant and mash with the back of a spoon until smooth. Set aside. In large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add eggplant and saute for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes more. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add basil and pesto and stir until combined. Add reserved cooked pasta and heat through. Add the cooked eggplant and 1 cup reserved cooking liquid. Season to taste. Transfer to a 13x9 baking dish. Sprinkle with the grated Romano and

In large bowl combine powdered sugar and walnuts. Cream together the remaining ingredients (except walnuts) in a mixeradd to walnut mixturemix well. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheetsbake at 350f for 15 minutes or until cookies are set. Let stand 1 minute on cookie sheetremove to wire rack to cool completely.
Place smokies in a 6-quart crock pot. Pour in barbecue sauce and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer. Serve once smokies plump up. Serve with Hawaiian rolls.

Combine butter, orange juice concentrate, chipotle chiles, molasses and salt in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until bubbling. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro. Brush ears of corn with some melted butter, and place them in a grill basket or on a foil-lined grill pan. Cook over medium heat until lightly charred and tender when pierced with a fork. Pour chipotle glaze over ears. Serve immediately.

Put flour in large bowl. Mix in lard until it is well combined. Mix in sugar & salt. Add egg & vinegar & beat until the mixture forms a sticky ball. Turn out on a lightly floured surface & divide the mixture in half. Roll each half out to fit the bottom & sides of the baking pan you are using for your pie. Fit the pies in the baking pan & bake at 450 degrees for about 10 minutes or until the pies are golden brown & the filling is bubbling.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 9x5x3 inch loaf pan or 8 muffin tins. In large saucepan melt 1/2 cup of the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the eggs and sugar until blended. Stir in the bread and pineapple. In small bowl combine remaining 2 Tbsp. of the butter with the remaining 1/4 cup of the brown sugar. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the bread mixture. In small bowl combine the milk with the cornstarch. Pour the milk mixture over the bread mixture. Pour the mixture into the greased pan or muffin cups. Bake at 350f for 40 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Season scallops with fresh ground pepper, tomatoes, shallots, basil, mushrooms. In a small sauce pan combine white wine and 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat until bubbling. Add scallops. Cook until just opaque. Add mussels in same pancook until mussels open. Add scallops to a casserole dish. Add tomatoes and white wine mixture. Top with shallots and basil. Add 1 tablespoon butter over tomato mixture. Bake in 350 degree oven until top is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Top with lemon wedge. Makes 4 servings.

Slice the green onion. Wash and cut the roma tomatoes. Spread the mozzarella cheese over the roma tomato slices. Top each slice with a green onion slice and a sprinkling of parsley. Drizzle the mozzarella with a little bit of pesto sauce. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese on top. Grill for about 5 minutes on each side.

Bake chili powder coated chicken breast in 425 degree oven for 25 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Remove from oven and let sit for 5 minutes. Cool slightly. In skillet melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in miracle whip and 1/2 cup of salsa. Cook and stir until blended. Spoon sauce onto one half of each flour tortilla and top each with 1 slice of chili powder coated chicken breast. Sprinkle each with 1 1/2 tablespoons of mexican blend cheese. Fold over each half of tortilla and press edges to seal. Heat in skillet or grill pan over medium heat for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden. Serve with additional salsa and guacamole.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit and spray an eight-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Combine the apples with the cranberries in the pan. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, the remaining half cup of granulated sugar, the oats, the all-purpose flour, and the saltmix well. In another small bowl, whisk together the eggs, the egg white, the all-purpose flour, the remaining two tablespoons of the brown sugar, the cinnamon, the nutmeg, and the vanilla extract until blendedadd to the dry mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture forms crumbs. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the fruit mixture in the panpress down gently to help it adhere to the fruit mixture. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until the topping is golden brown and the fruit mixture is tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Transfer the pan to a wire rack to cool for about 10 minutes before serving warm or at room temperature with whipped cream if desired

Slice halloumi. Divide tomatoes between two plates. Divide pesto sauce between the two plates. Place slices of halloumi on top of the tomato slices. Sprinkle with some lemon juice. Drizzle with some olive oil. Serve immediately.

Heat a large skillet over medium heatcook bulk pork sausage for about 5 minutes, until browned. Add frozen hash brownscook until browned. Add the eggscook until just set. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheesecook until melted. Serve immediately. Prep time does not include the overnight refrigeration.

Cube steaks in food processor until very fine. Season with salt, pepper and dry onion soup mix. Mix the rest of the ingredients together well. Place the cube steaks in foil packets with the seasoned meat and vegetables. Seal the packets tightly to trap the steam. Place the packets into crock pot. Cook for at least four hours on low or eight hours on high. Serve with buttered white rice or mashed potatoes.
Cut cantaloupe into cubes, mix all the other ingredients well and put the cantaloupe pieces into a bowl. Serve.

In a large saucepan, bring the broth and thyme to a boil. Add the celery and onion. Return to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the flour until smooth. Add the half-and-half and bring back to a boil. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens slightly. Stir in the potato and broccoli and cook until tender. Stir in the seasonings. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Brown hamburger and onions in skillet until browned. Stir in onion soup mix. Drain grease from skillet. Stir in biscuit mix, water, mushrooms. Pour into greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot.
Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually blend in sugar. Blend in cocoa. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into crust. Chill until serving.

Boil the new potatoes in salted water until just tender, about 15 minutes. Drain, then set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile, in a blender combine the picante sauce with lime juice, olive oil and 1 tablespoon of water. Add the cooled new potatoes to the blender with the tomato, olives and green onions. Puree until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss with the cilantro just before serving.
Drain canned beans and put into food processor with garlic powder and onion powder. Process until smooth and creamy. Add rest of ingredients and process again. Serve with your favorite crackers.

In a pan add 2 tbsp ghee and heat it. When the ghee is hot, add rava and fry till it turns golden. Remove from heat and let it cool. Add 2 tbsp ghee to a bowl and add milk. Bring it to boil. In another bowl mix 1/4 cup of rava and 1/4 cup of ghee. When milk is boiling add rava to it. Boil it for 2 to 3 minutes and then add remaining ghee. Remove from heat and let it cool. Add 1/4 cup of ghee to another bowl and add cardamom and saffron. Mix it well. Add 1 tbsp of ghee to the pan and heat it. When it is hot add rava mixture and let it cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add remaining ghee and mix it well. Now add it to the bowl with the boiled rava. Mix it well and let it cool. Now grease your hands with ghee and make ladoos. Serve it with ghee.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil. Add the shallot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the broth, wine, and tarragon. Bring to a boil. Season with salt and pepper. Reduce the heat to low. Add the chicken. Cover the skillet. Cook until the liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Add the red potatoes. Cook until the liquid has been absorbed. Add salt and pepper. Stir in the parsley. Transfer the chicken to a plate. Stir in the parsley. Serve with the cooked potatoes.

In a saucepan brown the sausage, drain well and crumble. Saute the onions in a little oil until tender. Stir in the tomatoes. Bring to the boil. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Reduce heat. Simmer covered for about 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Peel, core and slice the pears. In a bowl toss together the blue cheese, walnut halves and hazelnut oil. Arrange the arugula on plates. Arrange the blue cheese mixture on top of the leaves. Peel the parmigiano reggiano and cut into thin slices. Toss together the pears, lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Divide between 4 plates. Arrange the slices of Parmigiano reggiano on top of the pear slices. Serve.

Wash the apricots and pat dry. Peel them. Place the peeled apricots in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring the water to a boil. Let the apricots boil for 20-30 minutes or until the peels come off easily. Drain the apricots. Remove the pits. In a food processor, pulse the apricots until they are pureed. Add the water and sugar and pulse again. Add the almond extract and the almonds. Put the apricots in a jar and cover. Let cool completely.

Preheat over to 325 degrees. Mix all the ingredients together except the poppyseed in a large mixing bowl. Once the batter is blended well, add the poppyseed in with a spoon or your hand. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake for about 1 hour or until the top is a light brown color and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely before slicing.

Melt butter in heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in stock gradually. Bring to boilcook and stir 5 minutes. Add vinegar, sugar and fresh dill. Cook and stir 1 minute or until thick. Stir in egg yolkscook and stir 5 minutes or until thick and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in salt. Add cooked shrimp.

In a large bowl combine beef and seasoned stuffing mixadd eggs and beat. Stir in onion. Add salt and pepper to taste. Shape into 24 meat balls and place in a greased 11x8 inch baking dish. Cover with 1/2 cup whole berry cranberry sauce. Pour remaining whole berry cranberry sauce over the meat balls. Sprinkle with light brown sugar and ginger. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until done. Serve with hot spaghetti. Makes 24 large or 48 small.

Slice shortcut bacon into 6 strips and place onto a baking sheet and bake for 8 minutes or until cooked through and crisp. Remove bacon from oven and set aside. Place one slice of bread into each of six slices of a bread knife and cut the bread into six equal rectangles. Place two slices of bread onto the serving platter and place a slice of tomato onto each bread slice. Top each slice of bread with a strip of baked bacon and a small spoonful of mayonnaise and a little bit of garlic and parsley. Top with another slice of bread and a slice of tomato and finish with another slice of bread and a slice of tomato and a little mayonnaise and a small spoonful of garlic and parsley. Place bread knife onto the serving platter and top each sandwich with a lettuce leaf and serve immediately.

Mix softened cream cheese with salad dressing until blended. Add cocktail sauce and mix well. Layer in a baking dish with half of each ingredient, ending with the top layer of crabmeat and tomatoes. Bake at 275 for 40 minutes until heated through. Serve with crackers or veggies.

In a small bowl mix together the olive oil, red wine vinegar and sugar. In a larger bowl combine the red onions and radishes. Drizzle with the dressing and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate. Makes 4 servings.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add green beans and cook for 5 minutes. Add carrots. Cook for 3 minutes. Add 4 cups of vegetable broth. Increase heat to medium-high. Bring to a boil. Add almond milk. Add salt to taste. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in dried herbs. Pour into 4 bowls. Sprinkle each serving with fresh parsley.

Combine apples, 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup cider. Set aside. Trim fat from the brisket. Place in 5-quart slow cooker. Top with the remaining 3/4 cup brown sugar. Cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours. Add onions to the cooker. Add the remaining 1/2 cup cider. Cover and cook on low for 2 hours. Add the apples. Cover and cook for 1 hour. Add potatoes. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. Add the cabbage. Cover and cook for 30 to 45 minutes.

Dice onion into small cubes and place in cold water for 20 minutes. Drain and squeeze dry. Melt 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the onions for 20 minutes until caramelized. Add mint and cook until wilted. Drain mixture. Place flour and 1 cup water in a medium bowl. Mix thoroughly. Add egg and 3/4 cup of oil. Beat mixture thoroughly. Add 1/4 cup flour mixture. Mix well. Add remaining 1/4 cup flour mixture to batter. Add 1/2 cup cold water. Mix until batter is smooth. Pour batter into large bowl. Add caramelized mixture to batter. Mix well. Drop by teaspoon onto well oiled baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Drain well. Serve with tzatziki sauce.

Unroll dough to make 8 rectangular triangles. Top half of each triangle with 1 tbsp of cream cheese. Arrange tomatoes on bottom half of triangle. Top each triangle with 1/2 tbsp of bacon crumbles, a slice of bell pepper and another 1/2 tbsp of cream cheese. Fold dough over filling to form a triangle. Pinch edges to seal. Place 2 inches apart on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 180c/350f. Grease 2 x 20cm/8in round cake tins. Sift flour & ginger. Add butter & sugar. Rub together until mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Add eggs & beat together. Add dry ingredients & beat until mixture is smooth. Add orange juice & zest. Fold through cranberries & dried cranberries. Divide mixture evenly between tins. Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden. Leave to cool for 10 minutes. Remove from tins & cool completely on wire racks. Dust with icing sugar.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray a 9x13 pan with nonstick cooking spray. Lay the chicken breast down in the pan. Put 1/4 cup of the diced tomatoes over the top of the chicken. Add the onion and the bell pepper. Mix 2 Tbs. of the remaining tomatoes with the chili powder and cumin. Stir in 1/4 cup of the oil. Spread the mixture over the top of the vegetables. Layer 4 tortillas over the top. Spray the tortillas with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for 35 minutes.

Put beans into pot of cold water and cover with lid. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 1 hour. Drain. Place back into saucepan with 1 cup water. Add butter and let melt. Stir in onions and cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add bay leaf and cook for 1 minute. Add thyme. Add stock to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Simmer for 1 hour. Add salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Make the orange zest. Peel and cut orange into quarters and discard the peel. In the work bowl of your food processor pulse the orange and the orange zest until it's very finely chopped. Set aside. In another bowl, whisk together the cocoa and flour. Set aside. In yet another bowl, whisk together the brown sugar and confectioner's sugar until it's very smooth. Set aside. In another bowl, whisk together the egg white and vanilla. Set aside. In the bowl of your food processor add the dark chocolate and the orange zest and pulse until it is smooth. Add the brown sugar mixture and pulse until it's smooth. Add the chocolate and pulse until it is smooth. Add the egg white mixture and pulse until the chocolate is completely incorporated. Add the cocoa mixture and pulse until smooth. Add the dried apricots and the dried cranberries and pulse until smooth. Add the chopped pecans and pulse until smooth. Put the mixture into the refrigerator for 15 minutes to harden. Shape the mixture into

In large saucepan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breast halves. Saut until the chicken is lightly browned on both sides. Remove from pan. Add the onions and garlic to the pan. Saut until translucent. Add the natural-style peanut butter to the pan. Saut until melted. Add the chicken back into the pan. Add the ground coriander, red pepper flakes and the tomato sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with basmati rice.

Sweat leeks in a little butter. Add potatoes to leeks with a little water. Cover saucepan and sweat vegetables for 10 minutes. Add stock. Cook for 20 minutes. Blend the mixture and return to the saucepan. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in cream. Blend again. Add chopped chives. Serve.

Heat oil in a large stock pot or dutch oven. Add the chopped onion, jalapenos and ground beef. Season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the chopped tomatoes with juice. Add the tomato paste. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the rice. Add the remaining ingredients. Cover. Simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the bay leaves. Add the parsley.
Mix gelatin with juices until blended. Chill until softened. Stir in whipping cream until blended. Pour into individual dessert dishes and refrigerate until firm.

In a small bowl, combine butter, onion & garlic powders & lemon pepper. Melt butter in small skillet over medium heat. Stir in seasonings & pepper. Add popcorn to skillet & stir to coat evenly. Transfer to serving bowl & sprinkle with cayenne pepper & salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Mix all ingredients together in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer until well blended. Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet two inches apart. If desired, roll in extra splenda before placing on cookie sheet. Press with fork. Press again in opposite direction. Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit. Do not brown. Do not over bake.

In medium bowl combine orange zest, vinegar, juice of orange, orange juice, brown sugar, cider vinegar, and apple juice. Set aside. In large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add onion and green peppercook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add to bowl with marinadestir to combine. Add to bowl with marinadestir to combine. Add kielbasa and cook until browned on all sides. Place pineapple pieces on skewersalternate kielbasa, onion, green pepper, and pineapple pieces on each skewer. Thread skewers on metal skewer holder or soak wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes before placing on grill. Grill skewers until pineapple is soft and tender, about 5 minutes per side.

Make sure to follow all directions on pudding package for best results. Bake shell according to package directions. Let cool completely before filling with pudding. Mix vanilla protein powder with skim milk until smooth and add to pudding mixture. Blend until smooth. Add pudding mixture to cooled shell and refrigerate overnight or until set. To serve, top with sugar-free cool whip and sliced bananas.
Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash. Return to pot. Add cream, butter, salt and pepper. Stir in green garlic.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook until softened. Add wine, soy sauce and sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Place in preheated 350 oven for 20 minutes. Serve with crackers or toast points.

Preheat grill. Remove stem and seeds from jalapenos and discard. Remove green tops and slice each jalapeno into 1/4" thick rounds. Place rounds flat side down and cut into wedges. Place bacon on grid and cook until crisp. Clean grid and brush with oil. Place wedges and bacon on grid and cook until bacon is cooked through. Remove from grid. In bowl combine cream cheese and shredded cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Divide evenly onto each of 4 tortillas. Top with bacon and wedges. Roll up and place seam side down. Grill until warm. Serve with extra bacon and jalapenos.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 1/2 cup salt. Stir in 1/2 cup rice and cook for 40 minutes. Drain. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic, onions, bell pepper, cayenne pepper, bay leaves. Sauté for 5 minutes. Add 2 cups water. Add black-eyed peas and cook for 2 minutes. Add rice and cook for 3 minutes. Add salt to taste.

In a small saucepan bring broth and water to boil. Add cornstarch and stir to dissolve. Reduce heat and cook for 2 minutes whisking constantly. Cool slightly. Stir in vinegar and bring to boil. Stir in garlic, mustard and honey. Cook until mixture is thick and bubbling. Remove from heat and stir in oil. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Dip the chicken breasts into the melted butter and then into the seasoned flour mixture until each side is coated well. Set the breasts on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about 30 minutes or until done, and then transfer the breasts to a serving dish. Meanwhile, melt the sherry over low heat and then mix the rind and the lemon juice into the mixture. Stir until the rind is completely dissolved and then set the mixture aside for a minute or two so that the mixture will cool down a bit. Then mix the heavy cream and the parmesan cheese into the sherry mixture and then stir this mixture into the lemon sauce until it is fully combined and thickened. Pour the sauce over the chicken and serve hot with rice or potatoes or something similar.

Put the unthawed raspberries into a saucepan and add sugar. Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until all the sugar has dissolved. Using a potato masher, mash the raspberries and syrup thoroughly. Pour the mixture through a strainer, extract all the juice. Squeeze two of the lemons and strain the juice, add it to the raspberry juice. Add the boiling water to the raspberry juice. Allow the cordial to cool, then chill it in the refrigerator. Serve cordial with a thin slice of lemon in each glass.

Soak white beans over night in water with a little salt. Drain the water from the beans and add a little more water (about an inch). Add molasses, water, brown sugar, ketchup and mustard powder (and garlic powder if desired). Cook until the beans are soft (about two hours). Meanwhile, drain the water from the tofu dogs (if you're using a brine product, there won't be any water to drain). Drain well. Heat up some vegetable oil in a pan (a non-stick pan works best) and cook the hot dogs until they are browned on both sides (about 10 minutes). Place the cooked hot dogs in the baking dish with the beans. Bake covered in the preheated oven at 250 degrees until the hot dogs are done (about an hour). Serve with bread.

Melt the butter in a large heavy 2 quart sauce pan over low heat. Stir in the brown sugar and the walnuts. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until the mixture reaches the hard crack stage (290 degrees on the candy thermometer). Remove from the heat and stir in the melted chocolate. Pour the mixture onto waxed paper or foil spreading it into an even layer. Cool until set. Break into pieces.

In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the onion, celery rib, and garlic and saut until the vegetables are soft. Add the crushed tomatoes, chicken stock, smoked paprika, cayenne, rosemary, dried marjoram, and the sour cream. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low to medium low. Cover the saucepan and cook for about 15 minutes. Stir occasionally. If the soup becomes too thick add additional chicken stock. Serve with a drizzle of good olive oil.

Heat oil in skillet on medium heat until hot. Add ham pieces, onion, celery, carrot, bay leaf and salt & pepper. Cook for 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add water to the skillet, cover and simmer for 20 minutes over low heat. Drain broth from the skillet. Add cream to the skillet and cook over low heat until slightly thickened. Remove bay leaf. Stir in ham pieces, peas and parmesan cheese and simmer until heated through. In the meantime, boil tortellini as directed on package. Drain pasta. Add ham broth mixture to the pasta and stir to coat evenly. Garnish with parsley or chives. Serve at once.

Cut pastry into squares and bake according to package directions until golden brown. Allow pastry to cool completely on a wire rack. Cut each apple into thirds lengthwise and core. Peel the skin off and cut into thin strips. Place a few pieces of apple in the center of each pastry square. Sprinkle with brown sugar and salt, and drizzle with caramel sauce. Top with whipped cream and powdered sugar. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Spread mayo on one slice of the bread. Place two cooked chicken breasts on it and top with two slices of cooked bacon. Add the lettuce leaves and tomato slices and then the other slice of white bread. Serve with the sticks and a drink.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and lightly flour two loaf pans (8x4x2 inch). Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time and beat until light and fluffy again. Sift in the flour and blend with the other ingredients. Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 60 to 70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the loaves rest in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a rack to cool completely. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream and a drizzle of rum extract if desired.

Mix 2 cups of water and 1 1/2 cups of unsweetened coconut milk in a saucepan and bring to boiling. Stir in 2 teaspoons of green curry paste and 1/2 cup of brown sugar until dissolved and cook 3 minutes longer. Remove from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of fish sauce and 1 teaspoon of lime juice. Stir in 1 cup of red bell pepper and 1 cup of mushroom and cook until pepper is softened, about 3 minutes. Divide mixture among four serving plates and top each with 1/4 cup of jasmine rice. Broil for 2-3 minutes until bubbly and brown on top. Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve immediately with lime wedges on the side.

Arrange two rounds on serving plates. Top with two slices of cheese. Place slices of tomato on top of each piece of cheese. Place slices of the smoked salmon on top of the tomato. Add slices of the hard cooked eggs. Sprinkle each with salt, black pepper and dill. Arrange the slices of cheese on top of the eggs. Spread each slice of butter over the cheese. Place the miniature party rounds on the slices of cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Stir in melted butter. Press mixture firmly into bottom of a 13 x 9 pan. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup morsels with condensed milk. Microwave on high in 30 second intervals, stirring after each, until melted and smooth. Pour mixture over crumbs. Sprinkle remaining morsels and cashews on top. Bake 20 to 22 minutes, til lightly browned. Let them cool completely before cutting into bars.

Melt together margarine and sugar and brown sugar over low heat stirring constantly until blended and smooth. Remove from heat and add to large bowl with club crackers and milk. Stir until combined and then press into an ungreased jelly roll pan about 1 inch thick. Let cool and then cut into pieces and then sandwich with a small amount of chocolate chip and a piece of crunchy peanut butter between each piece for a twix bar cookie.

Place the carrots and potatoes and the pearl onions into a 4-6 quart slow cooker. Layer the meat over the veggies. Pour the soup over the top and stir to combine. Cover and cook for 8-10 hours or until the meat is tender and the veggies are tender. Serve with the gravy and biscuits. Enjoy!

Cut off the rind from a cantaloupe. Cut off the stem end of a cantaloupe half and cut away the netting. Slice into 1-inch-thick wedges. Cut the cantaloupe wedges crosswise into 1-inch-thick pieces. Cut the pistachios into halves. Cut the raspberries into halves or quarters. Place a small handful of raspberries on the bottom of 4 plates or bowls. Add a few wedges of cantaloupe around the raspberries. Add a sprinkling of pistachios and a few leaves of spinach around the cantaloupe. Drizzle the raspberry vinaigrette over the salads and serve immediately.

Clean 4 pounds of russet or yukon gold potatoes (about 10 to 12 medium-size) thoroughly. Rinse under cold running waterpat dry with a clean kitchen towel or paper towels. Place the potatoes in a 9-inch-square glass or ceramic baking dish. Top with 3/4 cup cheddar cheese. Cover the cheese with a thin layer of butter (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of half-and-half (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of sour cream (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of half-and-half (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of sour cream (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of half-and-half (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of sour cream (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of half-and-half (about 1/8 cup). Cover with a thin layer of sour cream (about 1/8 cup). Cover with
Mix oats with skim milk. Add dry ingredients to liquid. Add vanilla extract. Stir in beaten egg whites. Pour into greased skillet or non stick pan. Cook on both sides until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place a medium saucepan over medium heat. Heat oil. Add chicken and cook 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board and let cool 5 minutes. Dip each breast in eggthen coat with breadcrumbs. Place in a single layer in a shallow 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from the ovenset aside. Reduce the heat to medium. Cook and stir the butter in the same saucepan for 2 minutes. Add the eggscook and stir 1 minute longer or until the eggs are scrambled. Add the bacon and cook 1 minute longer. Remove from the heat. Spread the eggs over the chicken in the baking dish. Bake 15 minutes longer or until the eggs are set. Meanwhile, toast the rolls. Remove from the ovenspread the cheese over the eggs. Cut each roll in half. Top each piece of toast with one of the cut sides of the roll. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel 2 potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch thick wedges. Place wedges on a baking sheet. Bake until fork tender about 30 minutes. Brush wedges with melted butter and sprinkle with salt. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut wedges into wedges. Cut each wedge in half. Spoon out some of the filling. Place each half wedge on a plate. Sprinkle with chopped fresh chives. Top with a spoonful of sour cream and some shredded cheddar cheese. Sprinkle with chopped bacon bits.

For the tapioca pudding, boil the water with the sugar in a large pot. Add the tapioca and stir until it is completely dissolved. Simmer over low heat for 15 to 20 minutes or until the tapioca is clear. Remove from the heat and add the grenadine and pomegranates. Divide the tapioca between 6-8 dessert glasses or cups. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Just before serving add whipped cream and sprinkle with the pomegranate seeds. Refrigerated for 2 hours or overnight.

Cut beef into 1 inch cubes. In medium-size mixing bowl, combine water, seasoning and hoisin sauce. Add beef to mixture. Marinate 10 minutes. Heat 2 tbsp. Oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef mixture. Cook 4 to 6 minutes or until beef is done. Serve with rice.

Put cornflake cereal, seasonings and mustard in a large bowl. Beat eggs with honey and mix into dry ingredients. Dip chicken into egg mixture and roll in dry mixture. Bake at 375f for 20 minutes or until juices run clear when tested with a fork. Let stand for five minutes before serving with honey mustard sauce. Serve with rice or potato.

Peel and cut potatoes into wedges. Place in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to boil over high heat. Boil 8 minutesdrain. Transfer to a 9 x 13 baking dish. Stir in butter and sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add onions and cook until clear. Add garlic, chili and allspice and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the lime juice and sugar. Add chicken pieces and marinate for 15 minutes. Grill or broil chicken over medium heat. Remove chicken from pan. Add liquid to pan and heat. Simmer until thickened. Spoon over chicken.

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix shortening and sugar until creamy. In a separate bowl, combine eggs and molasses. Stir in dry ingredients (flour and spices). Blend thoroughly until all dry ingredients are incorporated and dough is well-blended. Roll into balls about 1 inch in diameter and place on greased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove to wire rack and cool completely before storing in airtight container.

Brown bacon and onion together. Add clams and water and cover tightly with foil. Place steamer on stove on high heat and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until clams are open. Remove clams to a bowl and pour beer into the steamer. Cover and steam for 5 minutes or until clams are open again. Serve on a bed of lettuce with bacon pieces on top. You can also add the clams to a salad or serve with bread for dipping into the juice.

Cream cheese and hot pepper sauce are the base for this dip. If you like it hot and spicy, add extra hot pepper sauce. If you like it mild and flavorful, use less hot sauce. Add shrimp and garlic. Add crabmeat and mix well. Add chopped parsley and freshly ground black pepper. Add salt as needed. Serve warm with crackers or baked potato wedges. Refrigerate any leftovers.

Bring water to a rolling boilremove from heat. In a large mixing bowl, add the black cherry gelatin and the cherry vodkastir constantly until the gelatin has dissolved. Once the gelatin is fully dissolved, add the red bull energy drink. Pour the mixture into small plastic shot glassesrefrigerate until set. These are also great with your favorite liquor or wine!

Heat butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender. Stir in flour and milk and cook until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. In a blender or food processor blend together spinach and 1/2 cup of the onion mixture. Spoon into the crepes and roll up. Place in a greased 9x13 baking dish. Cover with mozzarella cheese and top with a sprinkling of Parmesan. Pour remaining onion mixture over crepes. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until bubbling.

Cream together butter and cream cheese. Add eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix together the cake mix and water per directions on box. Add it in with cream cheese mixture and mix until blended. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 9-11 minutes. Cool for a minute on cookie sheet and then transfer to wire rack. Sprinkle with a little powdered sugar and serve with tea or coffee!

Cut potatoes into large wedges. Cook in boiling water until tenderdrain. In large skillet over medium heat, add oil, onion, garlic and parsleysaute for a few minutes, then add pimientocook for a few more minutes. Add potatoescook a few more minutes until lightly browned and soft. Add chicken broth, cover tightly with lidcook over medium heat until potatoes are softstir occasionally. Makes about 3 quarts.

Cut bread into cubes, place in large casserole dish. Crumble bacon into cubes. Cut bacon into cubes, add to bread cubes. Pour in eggs, milk, salt pepper and cheese cubes. Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.

In a large bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and 2 tablespoons powdered sugar. Cut 1 tablespoon butter into the crumb mixture. Press into a 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake 5 minutes. Cool completely. In a large bowl, beat instant pudding mix with remaining powdered sugar. Whisk in 1 cup milk until pudding is thick and smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Spread over crust. In a large bowl, combine 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 4 tablespoons butter. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in 1/4 cup milk. Add vanilla and beat until blended. Spread over pudding layer. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Store loosely covered in refrigerator.

In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs with the milk until well blended. Add the spices, cinnamon and ginger. Dip the slices of gingerbread in the batter until coated well on both sides. Fry in oil until browned on both sides. Serve hot with warm apple sauce or fresh berry sauce for breakfast or dessert.

Remove skin and fat from the dove breasts. Cut the breasts in half. In a small bowl mix teriyaki sauce and water and marinate the dove breasts in the mixture for at least 30 minutes. Dip each dove half in flour, shake off excess and dip in egg. Heat a skillet over medium heat and brown each dove half for 1 minute. Remove from pan and place on a baking sheet. Place the bell peppers and onions in the skillet and cook for 4 minutes. Add the tomatoes and mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from pan and place in a shallow serving dish. Place the dove breasts over the veggies and serve. This recipe is also great with other meats. Try it with chicken breasts or duck. Or use a combination of meats.

In bowl mix together 1 1/2 cups flour and seasoning. Dip chops into oil. Dip them into the seasoned flour. Heat oil in frying pan. Brown chicken on both sides. Drain on paper towel. Pour remaining 1 1/2 cups of flour into pan. Stir until coated. Add enough of the soup to cover chicken. Stir until thickened. Pour sauce over browned meat. Cover and cook on low heat for 45 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and season with the salt and pepper. Cook until tender and translucent. In a small bowl mix the steak seasoning with the garlic salt and black pepper. Sprinkle the seasoning mixture over the onions in the skillet. Cook the onions and the seasoning for another 2 minutes. Dust the steak with the steak seasoning mixture and sear the steaks for 2 minutes per side. Transfer the steaks to the pan with the onions and cook for 5 minutes more or until the steaks are done to your liking. Place a steak on each of the rolls and top with the provolone cheese. Cover the sandwiches with foil and transfer the pan to the oven and bake for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and broil the sandwiches for 2 minutes more or until the provolone is golden brown. Serve immediately.

In 12-inch heavy nonstick skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Saute bell pepper and onion until tender. Remove to bowlstir remaining oil to medium-high heat. Saute mushrooms until tender. Stir in remaining 1/2 teaspoon oil, garlic clove, cajun seasoning, rice, black pepper, and saltcook 4 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in pecans.

Blanch the courgettes in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain the courgettes and dunk in a bowl of iced water. Drain again. Heat a large pan of water to the boil. Cook the tagliatelle for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain the courgettes and add them to the pan. Add a knob of butter. Add the garlic. Drain the courgettes. Add the lemon juice. Drain the courgettes again. Toss the courgettes into the pan. Toss the courgettes in the pan. Toss the courgettes in the pan. Season with salt and pepper. Toss the courgettes in the pan. Sprinkle over the Parmesan.

Melt 1/4 cup of oil in a non stick pan. Place pancake mix, sugar and egg in a bowl. Stir until batter is smooth. Place pancake batter in the melted oil. Cook about one minute until sides are set. Flip pancake and cook until sides are browned. Remove from pan and roll in cinnamon.

Boil potatoes in a large saucepan of water until tender. Drain and cool slightly. Cut into bite-size pieces. Peel and dice the eggs. In a large bowl, whisk together the sour cream and the mustard. Add the cooled potatoes and the diced eggs. Stir in the lemon juice and the olive oil. Toss gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with the parsley leaves. Serve immediately.

Put butter on one side of each slice of bread and place on skillet over medium heat until brown on each side (about 2 minutes on each side). Put on plate and cover with saran wrap until ready to use. Spread cream cheese on one side and swiss cheese on the other side on each slice. Put on plate with brown side up and cover with saran wrap. When ready to use spread mayonnaise on one side and place on brown side. Put on skillet over medium heat until brown on each side (about 2 minutes on each side). Flip over and brown the other side (about 2 minutes on each side). Repeat with remaining slices of bread and cheeses. Put on plates and cover with saran wrap until ready to serve (can be made the day before and stored at room temperature).

In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat oil in an 11 by 7 inch baking dish. Add chicken, and cook over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes until juices run clear and meat is white throughout. Remove the chicken from pan and set aside. Add garlic to the pan and saute for 30 seconds. Add sauce and stir to mix. Add chicken to pan. Combine corn flake crumbs and egg. Stir into sauce. Place the chicken breasts in the baking dish. Combine the mozzarella cheese and parsley. Spoon over the top of each piece of chicken. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with rice or pasta.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the meatcook until browned, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Stir in the sauce, the pasta, and the waterbring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcoversimmer 10 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Stir in the cheesecovercook until melted, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with the parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the cream cheese and cook until melted. Add the milk and cook for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan and cook for 1 minute. Season with the cayenne and the fresh ground black pepper. Stir in the parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 12 cup muffin tin or line with paper liners. Mix sugar and butter in a bowl until blended well. Add in eggs and vanilla extract and beat until well mixed. Sift in flour and salt and beat until just incorporated. Fold in the bananas and the blueberries and stir until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared muffin tin and sprinkle a little extra sugar on top if desired. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 27 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for about 10 minutes before removing from the tin and serve warm or at room temperature. These are very good for breakfast and even better with a cup of coffee!

Bring a pot of water to boil and cook potatoes until tender about 12 minutes. Drain and let cool 5 minutes. Peel potatoes and cut into bite-sized pieces. Whisk together vinegar, vegetable oil, dill and salt and pepper to taste in a large serving bowl. Transfer potato pieces to dressing and toss lightly to coat with dressing. Add bell peppers and onion and toss until coated with dressing. Let stand 10 minutes to allow flavors to blend. Fold in the feta and serve. Makes 4 servings.
Combine all ingredients together in a small bowl. Using your hands or a spoon, rub mixture onto pork. Roast at 400f for 25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve.

Salt and pepper butternut squash and leek. Place in bottom of crockpot. Add beans and rotel tomatoes. Pour navy beans over the top of the other ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste and herbes de provence as well. Top beans and veggies with low fat mozzarella and bacon. Cover and cook 6-8 hours on low or 4 hours on high. Serve with warm cornbread or crackers and a tossed salad!

In a large bowl cream the butter and sugar until smooth. Add the egg and stir well. Stir in the custard powder and vanilla extract, then mix in the flour and the chocolate chips until just blended. Drop tablespoons of the dough onto the prepared sheets and then use a fork dipped in the egg yolk to press down the dough and flatten it into a squishy disk shape. Bake for about 10 minutes or until firm and the edges are golden brown.

Mix dark brown sugar, flour and 1/4 cup of the sugar in a medium saucepan. Stir in 1/2 cup of the cold water and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and begins to bubble. Continue cooking 1 to 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in remaining 1/2 cup water. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Pour into an 8 or 9-inch glass baking dish. Cool completely. Cut into squares. For custard, beat eggs slightlygradually stir in remaining 1/2 cup water and remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Bring to boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup water and 1/4 cup of the cold water. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup sugar and then pour mixture over eggs. Stir well. Pour mixture over cooled custard and chill until serving time. Refrigerate any leftovers.

Cover strawberries with water in medium saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Simmer until strawberries are tender when pierced with knife, about 15 minutes. Transfer to bowl. Cool slightly. Stir in sugar and vinegar. Whisk in oil. Add spinach. Toss lightly. Season with salt and pepper. Toss in onion and pecans. Add cheese and poppy seed. Toss until evenly combined. Arrange strawberries and spinach mixture on platter. Top with cheese and sprinkle with poppy seed.
Cut each hot dog bun lengthwise. Spread with butter and parmesan cheese, then sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl mix together water, onion and garlic cloves. Add to crockpot with salt and pepper to taste. Add the meat and cover with barbeque sauce. Cook on low for 8-10 hours or high for 4-6 hours. Shred with two forks. Serve with onions.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a Bundt pan or a round layer pan (26 centimeters in diameter). Beat the butter until light and creamy. Add the sugar gradually while beating the mixture until very fluffy (about 5 minutes). Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift the cake flour over the batter and beat until just combined (about 1 minute). Increase the speed of the mixer to medium high and beat for about 2 minutes more or until the batter is very light in color. Add the vanilla extract and beat until just combined (about 1 minute more). Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake until the center of the cake is done (about 1 hour). Let the cakes cool in the pan for about 20 minutes before turning the cakes out of the pan onto a wire rack to cool completely.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, cornstarch, and water and stir until smooth. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter until melted. Stir in the lemon juice and lemon rind. Stir in the strawberry. Serve with shortbread cookies or cake cubes.

Mix red cabbage and juice in bowl. Cover and refrigerate for two hours. Drain. Add honey, oil, vinegar and salt. Stir together. Chill. Serve over cabbage. Arrange apples, raisins and crumbled cheese over salad. Drizzle with dressing.

Saute onions in butter until tender and carmelized. Set aside.
