Bring milk and water to a boil in a large saucepan and reduce heat and simmer until milk thickens slightly and turns white in color (about 15 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in flour until smooth and bubblycook for about one minute without stirring, until thickened slightly. Stir in turnip, onion and salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately over french baguettes with melted butter and cheese as a garnish if desired.

In the bowl of a mixer, combine cheddar and cream cheeses until well blended and smooth. Gradually add the pumpkin and the pineapple preserves, beating until well blended and smooth. Place 1/3 cup of the mixture on the bottom of a piece of plastic wrap, fold the wrap and place in a plastic bowl or plastic storage container. Place a piece of pretzel stick on top of the plastic wrap and press down firmly to form a flat mound. Using the plastic wrap as a guide, place another piece of plastic wrap on top of the pretzel stick and press down firmly to form a flat mound with the pretzel stick sticking out the top of the mound. Repeat with the remaining 1/3 cup of the mixture. Place the flat mounds into the refrigerator until the cheese is firm. When the cheese is firm, remove the mounds from the refrigerator and using the plastic wrap as a guide, shape the mound into a pumpkin shape. Place a piece of pretzel stick on top of the mound and press down firmly to form a flat mound

Cut fennel bulbs lengthwise, remove outer leaves and core. Cut crosswise into 1/4 inch thick slices and place in a baking dish. Rub with butter and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with garlic and thyme. Pour in 1 cup of white wine and 2 cups chicken stock and bake uncovered in a preheated 350 degrees F oven for 30 minutes. Add 1/2 cup more stock and continue to bake for 15 minutes. Add 1/2 cup more stock and continue to bake for 15 minutes longer. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Peel baking potatoes (a large russet or Idaho is best). Boil in plenty of water until soft. Allow to cool slightly then drain. Slice thinly lengthwise and toss in a bowl with the sliced gherkins (or chopped onions). Mix with a good dressing (I use a simple vinaigrette of olive oil, red wine vinegar and mustard) and season with salt and pepper.

Beat together the eggs, milk and spices. Pour the mixture into a frying pan or skillet over medium to medium high heat. Cook until the top is lightly brown. Turn the omelet over and cook the other side. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix marinade ingredients in a large bowl. Add pork chops and toss to coat. Let marinade for 1 hour in the refrigerator. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 tbsp. of vegetable oil. Stir fry the marinade for 5 minutes. Stir in 1 tbsp. of cornstarch and 1 tbsp. of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Serve hot.

Peel and slice parsnips into evenly sized strips. Mix with herbs and season to taste. Heat a saucepan of oil until hot but not smoking and fry strips until crisp and golden. Remove from oil and drain on kitchen paper.
Mix all ingredients well and bake in a 325 degree oven for 40 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and let cool. Top with sliced almonds.

In a medium bowl, whisk ricotta cheese, cherries, pecans, 3 tablespoons of the sugar and the whipping cream until well blended. Pour mixture into a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate until cold and set, about 1 hour. Whisk the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar and remaining 1 tablespoon of whipping cream in a small bowl until well blended. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the cheese mixture into each of six 4-ounce ramekins or 3-ounce mugs. Top each serving with the whipped cream mixture, and sprinkle with the chocolate chips. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Place all ingredients in a large pot. Bring to boil then reduce to simmer for 15 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and allow the mixture to cool. Strain and discard the cinnamon stick and add the mixture to the pan. Serve warm with roast duck.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease muffin tins. In large bowl, combine cornmeal and flour. In small bowl, combine buttermilk and egg. Add to cornmeal mixture and stir until blended. Stir in sugar and mix well. Add baking soda and baking powder. Mix in margarine. Spoon batter into prepared tins. Bake until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Remove from pan immediately.

Combine the whole wheat cereal and peanuts in a large bowl and set aside. In a saucepan combine the butterscotch and chocolate chips and melt over a double boiler. Stir constantly. When melted pour over the whole wheat and peanuts and stir. Quickly drop by spoonful onto a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate until set. When set, remove from cookie sheet and put in plastic bag and store in the refrigerator.

Place the chicken breast halves in the crock pot and pour the water over the meat. Sprinkle the pumpernickel with the salt and pepper and place in the crock pot with the meat and cover with the lid. Cook on low for about 6-8 hours or until the meat is tender and cooked through. Remove the meat from the crock pot and shred with two forks. Return the meat to the crock pot and stir in the sauerkraut and Swiss cheese with the mixture in the crock pot for a few minutes before serving on the bread with the Thousand Island dressing.

In 4-quart pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and kielbasasauté until tender. Stir in black-eyed peas and navy beanscook and stir 1 minute. Add 6 cups of broth and bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 35 minutes. Add remaining 2 cups of broth. Stir in rice. Simmer until rice is tender. Add garlic powder, cayenne pepper and thymecook 1 minute. Ladle into bowls and serve.
Blend first seven ingredients together in heavy saucepan. Pour into pastry shells. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour.

In large skillet cook onion in butter over medium heat about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in zucchini and cook about 5 minutes more. Increase heat and add tomato paste. Cook about 3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, lemon juice and basil. Reduce heat to low. Cook uncovered about 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain pasta and add to onion mixture. Top with parmesan cheese.

Slice onions and cook in butter until tenderadd chopped tomato and cook for a few minutes. Add elbow macaroni and water. Bring to a boil and then turn heat down low to medium low for about 20 minutes or until pasta is cooked through. Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary with salt and pepper. Stir in breadcrumbs. Cover tightly with a lid or foil and set aside for 10 minutes to allow it to thicken up a bit before serving.

Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Pour the oil into the center of the bowl and add the cold water. Mix with a fork until the dough comes togetherknead briefly on a lightly floured surface to form a smooth ballcover and refrigerate for 30 minutes or until firm enough to roll out.

Beat eggs. Stir in milk. Add cream cheese. Stir well. Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over moderate heat. Pour egg mixture into the skillet. Cook until it begins to set. Fold in the chives. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Cut the tops off of the apples and scoop out the insides with a spoon. (Don't throw away the insides - they make great apple sauce!) Drizzle the melted butter on the insides of each apple. Sprinkle with the sugar/spice mixture. Roll the insides of the apples in the mixture. Place the apples in a glass baking dish. In a small bowl mix together the milk and the vanilla. Pour the milk/vanilla mixture over the apples. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

Place water, lemon juice, soymilk and salt into a saucepan on medium-high heat. Add cornstarch and stir. When it starts to boil, stir vigorously for about 1 minute, or until it thickens. Remove from heat. Whisk margarine into soymilk mixture until it is blended. Add vanilla extract and lemon juice mixture to margarine mixture. Blend thoroughly. Add mixture to canning jars and seal immediately. Cool before serving. Refrigerate or freeze.

Season sea scallops with salt and pepper and sear them until they are cooked through but still tender. Heat oil in a skillet and add chopped jalapeno and chopped scallions to the oil until they are lightly cooked and just beginning to soften. Add all of the chopped vegetables to the skillet and cook until they are warmed through and slightly tender (about 2 minutes). Add in chopped lime and cook for another minute or two until it starts to become slightly thick and saucy. Add in all of the juices from the mango and pineapple and cook for another minute or two until it is thick and saucy. Once it has thickened and is starting to become slightly thick and saucy, remove from heat and add chopped cilantro to the mixture and allow it to wilt for 30 seconds or so. Plate scallops and spoon some of this mixture onto each scallop.

Pre heat oven to 350f grease a 13x9-inch baking pan with butter. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the cocoa powder and stir. Add the eggs one at a time, stirring after each addition. Add the flour and stir until the batter is smooth. Pour batter into prepared baking dish. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a center comes out clean. Remove from ovencool completely before cutting into squares.
Mix garlic with paprika, salt, sage and oil in a bowl. Rub onto steaks. Place steaks on baking sheet. Bake in 325 degree oven for 45 minutes.
Bring the water to a boil. Add the onion, celery and bell pepper. Add the eggs. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the ramen noodles. Cook for an additional 3 minutes. Serve with chopped scallions.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Mix corn muffin mix according to package directions and add to baking dish. Top with diced green chili pepper, half an egg, half a cup of water, and one cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Top with 1/2 cup refried beans, 1/4 cup four-cheese mexican blend cheese, 1/4 cup cilantro, and another cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 15 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with hot sauce.

Fill a large pot with waterbring to a boil. Add the heads of garlicbring back to a boil then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook for approximately 25 minutes or until the heads are very soft when pierced with a fork. Drain the heads into a sieve set over a bowlset the bowl aside until cool enough to handle. Carefully squeeze the garlic into the bowldiscard the skins. Puree the garlic in a food processor until it is smooth with a small amount of texture. Place the bowl in the refrigerator until it is cold, about 1 hour. Place the canola oil in a small saucepanbring to a simmer over medium heat. Add the extra virgin olive oilwhisk until the mixture is emulsified. Cook for an additional minute over medium heatremove from the heat. Pour the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a bowl set over an ice bath until it is cool enough to handle. Whisk the strained oil into the cold pureed garlic until well blended. Use immediately or refrigerate up to a week in a covered container or
Cut up cabbage and mix with coleslaw mix. Chop up the chicken and put in a medium bowl. Add the mayonnaise and mix. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon onto the tortilla. Roll up. Serve.

Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add a teaspoon of salt. Cook the pasta until al dente according to the package directions. Drain the pasta and rinse it under cold water. Toss the pasta with the remaining olive oil to prevent sticking. Meanwhile, put the garlic and ginger in a food processor and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add the tahini and puree until it's smooth. Add the soy sauce and toasted sesame oil and puree again. Add the cooked noodles and the onion and puree until it's well blended. Add the cilantro and toss. Serve and enjoy.

Season fillets with salt and pepper. Drizzle fillets lightly with oil. Combine crumbs, green pepper, onion, basil. Spread crumb mixture on both sides of fillet. Top with sliced tomato. Bake at 350 degrees f for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve with rice.

Combine sugar and 1 litre of water in a large pan over high heat. Cook until the sugar dissolves, then stir through mint leaves (remove stems first). Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until slightly thickened. Cool slightly and pour into ice cream containers (or a large jug), cover and chill until ready to serve over ice cubes and with lemon slices.

Bring chicken stock to a boil. Add the raviolis and cook 6-8 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, saute onion in butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes or until tender. Add spinach to the skillet. Cook 3-4 minutes or until wilted. Season to taste. Drain the raviolis and add them to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes longer or until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with slices of the Italian bread.

Brown Italian sausage with onion and green bell peppers in a little oil in a large pan over medium heat for about five minutes. Add diced tomatoes and Italian stewed tomatoes with ketchup and cook for ten more minutes. Add ziti pasta and cook until al dente. Top with grated mozzarella cheese and serve immediately. Serves four.

Saute onions in olive oil for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic, oregano, and mushrooms and cook until soft. Stir in wine and let it cook down for about 4 minutes. Add the tomato sauce, bring to a boil and then reduce the flame to low. Add the italian sausages cut into 1/2 inch pieces and simmer for about 30 minutes until the meat is tender. Serve over penne pasta or with homemade fettuccine noodles.

Prepare an instant-read thermometer. Prepare an instant-read thermometer. In a small skillet melt butter and sautee onion and mushrooms. When tender, add flour. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Slowly add the soy and worchestire sauces and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour into a large pan and add water. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and sugar. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place the meat in the pan and cook over medium-high heat until desired doneness. Remove from the heat and keep warm. Remove meat from pan. Place in a warming dish and pour over the balsamic sauce. Makes 4 servings.

In a large saucepan over med heat, saute onions, carrots and celery in oil until onions are translucent. Add salmon and saute 2 minutes. Add rice and stir for 1 minute. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to med-low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in barley. In a small bowl, mix cilantro with pepper. Remove cover and stir in cilantro mixture. Serve.

Put raspberries, sugar and port wine into small saucepan and cook over medium heat until berries just burst. Remove from heat and add chipotle. Mix well. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. Serve over vanilla ice cream or yogurt.

Combine first five ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stirring constantly, boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate morsels until completely melted and mixture is smooth. Stir in crunchy rice krispies until well coated. Pour into greased 8x8-inch square pan and cool completely. Cut into squares and serve.

In a heavy sauce pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and saute until they are tender. Add in the flour and stir. Cook for 1 minutes stirring constantly. Gradually add in the milk. Cook and stir constantly over medium heat until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Stir in heavy cream and dry sherry. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Stir in paprika and add in cooked lobster meat. Cook and stir over low heat until heated through. Sprinkle with chives and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a medium sauce pan melt butter over medium heat. Add celery and onion and cook 5 minutes stirring occasionally until softened but not brown. Add orange rind and salt and cook 1 minute stirring constantly to remove rind. Add water and bring to a boil stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low and add rice and cook for 20 minutes stirring occasionally until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in parsley and almonds and transfer to an 8x8 baking dish. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through and toasted lightly. Serve hot or warm.

Bring water and 1/4 cup of sugar to boil. Add chopped caraway seeds and cook until they have released their fragrance. Add chopped cooking apple and simmer for 5 minutes. Add drained sauerkraut and cook for 5 minutes more. Serve hot over frankfurters. Sprinkle with parsley.

Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, balsamic vinegar, and honey in a small bowl. Bring to a boil in a medium-sized pan. Boil for 30 sec. Reduce heat to a low simmer. Add garlic and rosemary and cook for 15 min or until the marinade is thick and sticky. Add the chicken and bring the liquid to a boil. Reduce heat to a low simmer and cook for 8 to 10 min or until the meat is cooked through. Sprinkle the sesame seeds and parsley over the chicken. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 300f. Put ham in a roasting pan or dish that will hold all the liquid while it cooks. Sprinkle the bottom of the pan evenly with the brown sugar. Pour the orange juice over the top of the ham. Add the ground mustard. Pour 1 cup of water to the bottom of the pan. Cover tightly with foil or aluminum foil with a tight-fitting lid on top of the foil (to help trap steam). Cook for 2 1/2 hours until the ham is tender. Check the liquid every 30 minutes to see if the liquid needs to be replaced or if the pan needs to be covered tighter. Serve hot or cold.

Whisk first 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Gradually whisk in oil. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. Toss greens with remaining ingredients in large bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with feta. Drizzle lightly with remaining dressing. Serve.

Mix whole wheat flour, unbleached all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, white sugar and skim milk together. Mix with a fork until dough comes together. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Grease a 9x5 loaf pan with oil or spray with non-stick cooking spray. Press the dough into the pan with your hands until evenly thickened around the sides. Cover with plastic wrap again and let stand for another 25 minutes. Bake for 1 hour.

Melt butter with chopped onions in a medium sized pot over medium heat. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add baking potatoes, orange juice, orange zest, salt and cook for about 20 minutes over medium-low heat until potatoes are softened. Mash potatoes with sour cream until smooth. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream margarine and brown sugar together. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Add applesauce and stir until combined and smooth. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about 12 minutes or until lightly brown. Cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 225 degrees. Place pork shoulder in a pan (it should fit snugly) with water to cover. Place pan in oven and cook for 6-8 hours or until pork is tender (you can shred it once it's cooked). Remove from pan. Discard water from pan and set aside (or reserve for another use). Drain fat from pork shoulder into a bowl and reserve for another use or discard. Dry pork shoulder with paper towels to remove excess moisture. Rub pork shoulder all over with salt and pepper (use the same salt you used to season the pork). Place pork shoulder in the pan and add water to cover. Cook for 2 hours uncovered or until pork is very tender. Remove from pan and set aside to cool for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, add the tequila to the pan (or reserve for another use). Once the tequila has burned away (it will smell like tequila), add the brown sugar and molasses to the pan (or reserve for another use). Cook until the mixture is very thick and syrupy (it will look

Combine shortening and sugar in large bowl until fluffyadd eggs one at a time to mixtureadd flour, baking powder and salt alternately with milk to shortening mixturebeat until smoothadd vanilla and cinnamonpour into greased and floured bundt pan or tube pan and bake at 325 degrees for about an hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out cleanlet cool 10 minutes before removing from pan and cool completely before frosting.
Prepare macaroni as directed on package. While noodles are still hot, combine remaining ingredients and mix. Cover and chill for at least 2 hours. This will keep for a week in the refrigerator.

Heat oven to 375f. Place the pork chops in a large shallow baking dish. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise with the onion soup mix and parmesan cheese. Spread the mixture evenly over the pork chops. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the meat is cooked through. Remove from oven and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

In a medium mixing bowl with an electric mixer beat together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla and egg. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Slowly add the dry mixture to the wet and mix until incorporated. Stir in the chocolate chips. Scoop a tablespoon of dough into a mug. Place in the microwave and cook for about 1 minute. Cook for about 20 seconds more if desired.

To prepare cucumbers: Trim blossom ends from cucumbers. Slice into 1/4 inch thick pieces. In a large bowl combine vinegar and water. Add all other ingredients and stir. Refrigerate overnight. Drain. To prepare tomatoes: Slice tomatoes in half. Remove seeds and discard. In a medium bowl combine dressing ingredients. Mix together. Pour over tomatoes and toss. Refrigerate overnight. Drain. Combine tomatoes and cucumbers. Sprinkle with fresh black pepper.

Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Place the chicken in the mixture. Coat well. Place the mixture in the refrigerator until ready to cook. Place the marinade in a microwave safe bowl and heat for about 1 minute. Stir and spoon over the meat. Cook until done. This can be done in the microwave or in the oven or on the stove top. This can be done for a whole chicken or individual breasts. It can also be done for any other type of meat. Serve with rice.
Mix together all ingredients and chill in refrigerator for 1 hour or longer. Serve over raw or steamed shellfish.

Place the oil and onions in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook over moderately high heat until the onions are golden brown. Add the smooth peanut butter and cook stirring for 5 minutes. Add the brown sugar and soy sauces and simmer uncovered until the sauce thickens. Reduce the heat to low and add the lemon juice and liquid red pepper seasoning. Simmer for another 2 minutes. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Serve with grilled meats.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Spray muffin pans with non stick spray. Dust each muffin paper with spice cake mix. Beat together water, pumpkin and vanilla extract until well mixed. Add spice cake mix until well mixed. Bake for approximately 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely before frosting.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large mixing bowl combine the flour and salt. Cut the honey into small pieces and add them to the dry ingredients. In another large mixing bowl beat the egg yolk and milk with an electric mixer on medium-low speed for 1 minute. Add the vegetable oil and beat on medium-high speed for 2 minutes more. Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and beat on low speed for 1 minute more. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray and add the batter. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes or until the top begins to brown slightly. Remove from the oven and allow it to cool for about 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Brush both sides of chicken breasts with balsamic vinegar & olive oil. Sprinkle both sides of the breasts with rosemary sprigs, coarse black pepper, and garlic clove. Heat 1 Tbsp olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add the garlic clove to the pan & sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant. Place the breasts in the skilletcook until browned on both sides & opaque in the center (12-15 minutes). Place in a 375f preheated oven & bake for 30 minutes or until meat thermometer reads 165f when inserted in center of breasts.

In a large bowl, stir together buttermilk and seasoned with salt and pepper. Place snapper fillets in the buttermilk mixture and marinate in the refrigerator for 15 minutes. Drain fillets and pat dry with paper towels. In a small bowl, stir together instant potato flakes and garlic. Spread butter evenly over fillets. Sprinkle potato flakes over the buttered fillets. Sprinkle fillets with salt and pepper. Bake, uncovered 15 minutes. Bake 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with lemon wedges and serve.

1. Place the lean lamb fillets in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Add the onion and salt. Let sit for 1-2 hours in the refrigerator. 2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes until tender. Add the meat and broth to the skillet and simmer for 35 minutes until tender. Add the split peas and cook for 3 more minutes. 3. Place the split peas and onion mixture in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. 4. Put the puree in a large pot over medium heat and stir in the almonds and dried apricots. Cook until the almonds are lightly toasted. 5. Add the prunes and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add more broth if needed. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add frozen green beans and cook for 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain, reserving cooking liquid. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic clove and cook for 1 minute. Add the reserved cooking liquid from the frozen green beans. Add the dried rosemary. Season the beans with salt. Transfer the beans from the skillet to a shallow baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for about 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve.

Okra - trim the ends of the pods. Cut the stem off the pods. Slice the pods lengthwise into thin strips. Okra - Soak the pods in cold water for 5 minutes. Rinse with cold water and then place in a large pot filled with cold water. Bring the pot to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the pods are tender. Okra - Drain the pods well. Set aside. Okra - Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic and ginger. Cook until softened. Add the jalapenos. Cook for 1 minute. Add the cardamom. Stir for 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes. Stir for 1 minute. Add the pods. Cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt. Okra - Transfer the okra mixture to a food processor. Process until smooth. Okra - Pour the mixture into a serving bowl. Serve with injera.

Soak the wheat for half an hour then wash it well and mix it with the flour and salt then add the egg. Mix well then add the butter then stir until it is completely mixed then add the yoghurt little by little and mix well then add the parsley and the mint and stir well then add the water slowly until it is mixed well then heat the mixture until it boils then pour it into small cups and let it cool for about an hour then it is ready to serve. Serving suggestion : Serve it with fried bread sticks or pita bread or fried bread or any kind of bread or any kind of flat bread like chapattis or parathas or any kind of Indian bread.

Cook the beans with the chile guajillo. Then cook the diced white onion and the garlic with the cooked beans. Cut the avocado into small cubes. Place the tortillas into boiling water for one minute. Drain the tortillas and cut them into triangles. Mix the cooked beans with the avocado. Then mix the shredded cheese with the chopped cilantro. Place the shredded cheese over the top of the beans. Serve with tortilla triangles. You can add the chopped chile serrano to the dish.

Pastry-------------. Place diced baking apples in a bowl. Add orange zest and tapioca. Mix well. Add orange juice and stir in. Add diced cranberries and stir in. Bake in prebaked pie crust until apples are tender. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 400°F. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper. In a shallow bowl combine the flour with the salt and pepper. In another bowl combine the white wine with the sage leaves. Place the chicken in the bowl with the flour mixture. Toss the chicken until well coated. Add the olive oil to a large skillet. Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chicken to the skillet. Cook the chicken until well browned on both sides. Pour in the white wine mixture. Bring to a simmer. Cover the skillet with a lid. Transfer the skillet to the oven. Cook the chicken until the liquid is almost completely absorbed. Remove the skillet from the oven. Season the chicken with the butter and the whole grain mustard. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter. Pour the remaining liquid into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook until reduced to a thick sauce. Serve the sauce with the chicken.

Boil potatoes until very soft. Drain the water off and peel them. Mix everything together. Roll into balls and place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until they are a light golden color.

In a large bowl combine sour cream and mayonnaise. Add cheese and eggs and blend together. Add salt and black pepper and stir to combine. Add broccoli, mushrooms and ramen noodles. Gently fold together and transfer to a lightly greased baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees f.

Place pears on chopping board and cut each one into 1/3-inch cubes. Mix the blue cheese with 1/4 cup of the oil, vinegar, sugar, and saltmix well with spatula until sugar is dissolved. Add 1 teaspoon of Tabasco sauce if desired. Chop walnuts. Combine blue cheese mixture with walnutsmix well until walnuts are coated with mixture. Place one-fourth of the chopped romaine or baby spinach on each of 4 salad platestop with pear cubes. Drizzle with remaining oiltop with remaining romaine or spinachtop with blue cheese mixturesprinkle with remaining walnutsdrizzle with remaining vinegarseason with ground black pepper to tasteserve immediately. Note: The raspberry vinegar can be substituted with any other mild vinegar or with white wine vinegar if desired.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for about 5 minutes until soft. Add tomatoes with their juice. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until tomatoes are soft. Add the parsley. Stir in the spinach. Cook until the spinach wilts. Add 1 cup (250 mL) water to loosen mixture. Add penne to skillet. Cook for 4-5 minutes or until penne is tender. Season to taste.

Season mushrooms with salt, pepper, nutmeg, lemon juice. Saute in 1 Tbsp of the butter until tender. Set aside. Melt remaining 1 Tbsp of the butter in saucepan over low heat. Slowly whisk in flour. Gradually whisk in cream. Add the sauteed mushrooms, salt, pepper and parsley. Continue to simmer for 10-15 minutes or until thickened slightly. Serve hot on toasted slices of bread.

In a shallow dish combine the flour, salt and pepper and mix well with a fork. In a second shallow dish whisk together the egg and milk. Dip each piece of chicken into the milk/egg mixture and then roll each piece in the seasoned flour mixture. Heat the vegetable oil to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. In a heavy-duty fryer, deep-fry the chicken pieces for 5-6 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. Remove each piece from the oil and place on a paper towel-lined plate to drain the excess grease. Serve hot with a side of mashed potatoes and green beans.

In saucepan, combine apricot halves and water to cover. Cook until apricots are tender. Drain apricots reserving juices in pan. Add sugar to apricot pan. Cook until sugar dissolves completely. Add apricots to sugar mixture along with enough of their cooking liquor to make 2 1/2 cups of liquid. Cook until mixture becomes syrupy thick. Add apricot purée to cooked apricots in syrup along with 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice and 1 teaspoon of almond extract. Cook until syrup mixture is reduced by half. Serve as dessert or as filling for mousse or crème brulee. (Note: If desired, apricots may be roasted in hot oven first.)

In a large bowl combine the first 7 ingredients. In a small bowl combine the last 2 ingredients. Combine the two mixturesstir until smooth. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for about 10 minutes or until set.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add oil and swirl it around. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook until fragrant and softened, about a minute. Add chili powder and cumin and cook until fragrant. Add hickory liquid smoke and stir to dissolve. Add Worcestershire sauce and stir. Add beer and stir. Add chili sauce and stir. Add brisket and cook until browned, turning once. Add broth and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cover and cook until tender and juices run clear. Serve.
Cream butter and water. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well until smooth and very thick. Drop by spoonfuls into hot soup. Do not stir as they will fall to pieces. Cook until done.

Cut the top off the green onions, slice the green part into 1/8 inch slices, leaving the white part intact. Boil the red potatoes for 10 minutes in salted water or use a microwave to soften them. Once the potatoes are cooked or softened, drain the water off of them in a colander. Once the water is drained out of them, cut the potatoes into slices. Peel the carrots and cut them up into small cubes. Mix the green onions into the carrots. Mix the red potatoes into the carrots. Mix the vegetable oil into the vinegar in a large bowl. Mix the onions into the vegetable oil vinegar mixture. Mix the seasonings into the vegetable oil vinegar mixture. Mix the red potatoes into the seasoned vinegar oil mixture. Mix the yogurt into the vinegar oil red potato mixture. Mix the celery into the vinegar oil red potato yogurt mixture. Mix the mayonnaise into the vinegar oil red potato yogurt celery mixture. Serve chilled.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Roll out pie crust to a 13x9 inch rectangle. Spread sour cream evenly over crust. Top sour cream with bacon, sausage, swiss cheese. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, water, salt and pepper. Pour egg mixture over meat and cheese. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until egg mixture is set. Allow to cool 5-10 minutes before serving.

Prepare pie crust according to package directions. Cut pie crust in half and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Top one half of each pie crust with spaghetti sauce and one half of each pie crust with shredded mozzarella cheese. Top with a thin layer of cooked chicken and thinly sliced mushrooms. Cut each half of pie crust in half again. Fold half of each pie crust over filling and press edges with a fork to seal. Cut each half of pie crust in half again and press edges with a fork. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Combine the zest and juice of two lemons in a large mixing bowl and set aside. Beat the eggs until they are light and fluffy. Add the zest and juice and beat in the flour and salt until well blended. Add the butter and beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Shape the dough into one inch balls and place them two inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for approximately 10 minutes and then place them on wire racks until completely cool.

In a small mixing bowl combine the tuna with the celery, onion and mayonnaise. Fill the center of each bun with the tuna mixture, add shredded mozzarella to each, then place the remaining lettuce and tomatoes on top of each sandwich. Serve immediately. This sandwich is best served when the mozzarella is still warm. The lettuce and tomatoes will keep the sandwich from becoming soggythe sandwich will keep for 1-2 days if refrigerated but is best served fresh.

Bring 1 ½ cups of water to a boil. Add 1 tsp of cardamom and ¼ tsp of saffron and simmer for 5 minutes. Turn off heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Add 2 tbsp of coffee and stir well. Pour into cups and serve with pistachio nuts and dates on top.

Preheat oven at 350. Cook macaroni according to the box. In a separate pan melt butter. Add flour and brown slightly. Then add milk and broccoli cheese soup. Mix well. Add macaroni. Bake for 25 minutes.

Cut tomato paste in half. Add to the olive oil. Cook on low heat until tomato paste is melted. Add parsley. Stir in garlic, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Cook for 2 minutes. Add shrimp. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add butter. Stir until butter melts. Serve.

1. In a small nonstick saut pan over medium heat, melt unsalted butter with the sugar until the mixture just begins to turn golden brown and caramelize, approximately 5 minutes. Remove from heat.2. In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, heat whole milk until it just begins to bubble around the edges. Increase heat to medium-high, add long-grain rice and stir until it has absorbed most of the milk.3. In a medium bowl, beat eggs with the vanilla until well combined.4. Once rice has absorbed most of the first cup of milk, add half the caramel mixture to the saut pan along with the eggs, stirring frequently until the caramel is completely incorporated into the mixture.5. Increase heat to high and bring the mixture to a simmer. Stir frequently until it just begins to thicken, approximately 2 minutes.6. Remove from heat. Increase heat to high and whisk in heavy cream. Cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 1 minute.7. Remove from heat. Add raisins and stir until they are coated

Heat olive oil in large saucepan over medium heatsaute onion, celery, carrot, tomatoes and thyme until carrot is tenderadd broth and cook until heated through. Add salt & cayenne pepper to tastesimmer for 15 minutesadd chicken breasts and cook until tender, about 15 minutes more. Remove from heatallow to cool slightly. Transfer chicken to serving plattercover with foilrefrigerate for up to 12 hours.

Place tomatoes in a 1-quart glass jar with tight-fitting lid. Combine lemon juice, sugar and 1/2 tsp. of salt in a small bowl. Add 2 tsp. of the olive oil to lemon juice mixture. Pour over tomatoes. Add the remaining 1 tbsp. of olive oil. Cover tightly. Refrigerate for 36-48 hours. Stir mixture. Add the savory. Cover again. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Add 2 tbsp. of olive oil. Taste. Add more sugar if desired. Makes about 4 cups.

Combine all ingredients except cream cheese, cheese spread mixture in small bowl until blended. Add cream cheese mixturestir until well blended. Serve with low-fat crackers or chips. Refrigerate any leftover spread in airtight container up to 1 week.

Mix sour cream and flour. Blend in sugar and seasonings. Add onion and beef. Mix well. Place in sprayed 2 quart casserole dish. Top with mexican style corn. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered in a preheated 350f oven for 30 minutes. Serve.

Trim broccoli into bite size florets. Rinse under cold running waterdrain thoroughly in a colander. Mix all the other ingredients togetherplace in a large bowl and toss to coat evenly with the dressing. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Put all of the ingredients into the bowl of an electric mixer with the dough hook. Beat until the mixture is smooth and shiny. On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes (this is an active dough). Put the dough into a lightly greased bowl and cover with plastic wraplet rise until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down dough and knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elasticdivide dough into 16 balls. Shape each ball into a 6-inch-long oval roll (about 3 inches wide). Place rolls on ungreased baking sheets and let rise until doubled (about 30 minutes). Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes on baking sheets before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Cook sausage links in 10 to 12 inches of water to cover in heavy large saucepan or Dutch oven over high heat until browned. Transfer sausage to bowl with slotted spoonset aside. Discard all but 1 tablespoon fat from pan. Add zucchini, squash, onion to pancook 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in sausage, water, pasta sauce, bouillon cubebring to boiling. Reduce heatcook, covered, 20 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in garbanzo beansheat through. Stir in pasta. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until pasta is tenderdrain. Divide among bowlstop each with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl combine the gluten and nutritional yeast. Add the remaining ingredients and combine well. Form into a log about 2 inches in diameter and about 14 inches in length. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 350F. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown. Let cool slightly. Slice and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the oil in a medium-sized sauce pan over medium heat. Add the garlic to the pan and cook until softened. Add enough chicken broth to cover all of the garlic. Stir in the bread cubes, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until the bread has completely absorbed all of the liquid, about 10 minutes. Stir in enough broth to cover the bread. Bring to a boil. Cook until the bread has absorbed all of the broth. Add more broth as necessary. Stir in the eggs. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until just set. Serve immediately.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Cover bottom of large mixing bowl with lettuce. Place cooked chicken, celery, onion, lemon juice and salt over lettuce. Chill for an hour. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl or jar, stirring until well blended. Pour over chicken mixturestir gently but thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight before serving. Serve in a large lettuce leaf-lined bowl or individual lettuce cups.

Preheat oven to 160c and grease a cookie sheet. Mix together the butter and brown sugar until light and creamy. Beat in eggs and vanilla until well combined. Sift in the flour and baking powder and combine well. Fold in the Milo and the chocolate chips. Place teaspoonfuls of the mixture on the prepared cookie sheet and press down with the back of a spoon. Bake for around 15 minutes or until lightly golden around the edges. Cool on wire rack before removing from cookie sheet.
Wash and hull strawberries. Slice in half. Place in blender. Add ice and juice. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.

Combine powdered sugar and marshmallow cream and mix well. Roll in caramels and roll in nuts to coat. Press in greased cookie sheet to make logs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Makes about 20 logs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onions in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onions are translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, low fat cottage cheese, all purpose flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish. Bake for 1 hour.
Combine all ingredients into a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cut cod into cubes. Cook with the bacon until almost done. Add green pepper and tomatoes. Cook for five minutes then add eggs. Stir until eggs are almost done then season with salt and black pepper. Serve with boiled potatoes.

Peel and trim the eggplants and cut into 1-inch thick rounds. Place them in a baking dish and pour the coconut milk over them. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the sugar over the top of the dish and roast for about 10 minutes until the eggplants are tender and the coconut milk is reduced to a sauce consistency. Whisk the chili paste with the lime juice and add to the dish. Stir in the green onions and fresh herbs and serve with rice and roti.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with foil or a silicone baking matlightly grease with cooking spray or oil. Place asparagus on baking sheet, and season with salt & freshly ground black pepper to taste. Place shiitakes on the asparagus. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and toss gently so that all sides of the vegetables are covered. Bake for approximately 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender and the shiitakes are golden brown on top. Remove from the heat and drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Combine water and coconut extract in a saucepan. Add oats and mix well. Bring mixture to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add coconut and stir well. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Spoon mixture into serving dish and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until firm. Cut into small squares.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add onionsaute 10 minutes or until tender. Stir in leek. Cook 10 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 1 minute. Stir in saffron. Add broth. Increase heat to highbring to a boil. Add 1 1/2 cups hot broth mixture to risotto. Stir until all liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups hot broth mixture. Cook 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups broth mixture. Cook 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups broth mixture. Cook 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups broth mixture. Cook 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups broth mixture. Cook 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in peas. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large skillet, cook the rice as the directions on the package. In an ovenproof 2 quart casserole dish layer the rice at the bottom. Layer the chicken on top of rice. Sprinkle cheddar cheese on top of the chicken. Mix together the soup and milk. Pour over the top and bake 35 minutes at 375. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve with the reserved rice. Makes 4 servings.

Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift together flour and lemon rind. Fold into mixture in three parts, beating well after each addition. Spoon into lightly greased and floured 20cm round springform tin. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until tester inserted in centre comes out clean. Cool in tin for 10 minutes before turning out onto wire rack to cool completely.
Bake uncovered 1 hour 30 minutes at 350 degrees. 8 servings

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Melt butter in the empty pot. Add thyme leaves and saut till fragrant. Add basil leaves. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley and chives. Toss with noodles. Serve.

Mix flax seed meal, almond flour, splenda granular, cinnamon and water together. Press mixture into greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Store in air tight container.

Combine all ingredients except chicken in a plastic zipper bag. Add chicken and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before grilling over medium high heat until done. Serve over rice or with vegetables on the side.

Saute the garlic in butter until tender. Add the broccoli and cook until soft. Add the onions. Add the chicken. Stir in the milk and broth. Cover the pan. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the seasoning. Pour in the rice. Cover the pan. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the peas. Top with the provolone. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Boil the red skinned potatoes in a large pot of water for about 15-20 minutes or until fork tender. Drain the potatoes and allow to cool. Chop the potatoes into bite size pieces. In a large bowl add the sour cream and mayonnaise. Stir in the remaining ingredients until thoroughly mixed. Chill until ready to serve. Taste and adjust the seasonings to your liking.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat the butter. When hot add the shallots and garlic. Cook for about 3 minutes. Add the white wine vinegar, mustard, the white beans, salt and pepper. Cook uncovered for about 3 minutes. Toss in the parsley. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Drain the soba noodles and then cook in boiling water for 3-4 minutes. Add the drained noodles to the bowl with the spinach. In the same pan used for the noodles, sauté the garlic in olive oil until tender. Add the mushrooms to the garlic. Cook until the mushrooms are soft. Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover the pan. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the noodles to the pan and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the spinach to the pan. Stir until wilted. Add the soy sauce and lime juice. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.

Cut 1 garlic clove into small pieces. Chop remaining garlic clove. In small saucepan over medium heat saute garlic in olive oil until tender. Remove from heat. Heat italian bread in toaster oven until toasted. Remove crust from bread. Chop crust into small pieces. Cut bread in half lengthwise. Remove seeds from zucchini with spoon. Slice squash. Place bread pieces in a small bowl. Add garlic. Drizzle with dressing. Stir to coat. Place squash on bread. Sprinkle with toasted bread pieces. Place zucchini on platter. Sprinkle with crumbles of cheese.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onionsaute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add rice and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Add enough hot water (not more than 1 cup) to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over medium heatreduce heat and simmer covered for about 10 minutes until liquid has been absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in bay leaf. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes more. Add salt, pepper and pepper saucestir well. Add frozen peascook for about 2 minutes or until peas are tender. Stir in parsleyserve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Clean and cut butternut squash into 1-inch cubes and place them in a greased baking pan. Place pan in oven and roast for about 1 hour or until tender and the skin is easily removed with a fork. Remove from oven and place the squash in a large mixing bowl and set aside for later use. Heat a large skillet over medium heat with cooking spray and add chopped onion and red onion and cook until tender, about 2-3 minutes. Add chopped rosemary and cook for an additional minute or so. Add cooked rice and stir until combined and continue to cook for another minute or so stirring constantly. Add chopped garlic and cook for 1 more minute or so. Add butter and light cream cheese and stir until butter is melted and cream cheese is blended in with the rice mixture. Stir in roasted butternut squash and cook for an additional minute or two until heated through and slightly thickened. Pour in broth and stir until combined and bring mixture to a boil. Cook and stir until broth is

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium saucepan, heat butter over medium-low heat. Add milk chocolate and cook stirring occasionally until melted. Pour into graham cracker crust. In a large mixing bowl, beat sweetened condensed milk with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold in eggs and vanilla. Pour into crust. Top with chopped nuts and drizzle with caramel ice cream topping. Freeze for 2 hours or until firm. Refrigerate overnight before serving.

In a 4-quart saucepan combine dry lentils and 3 cups cold water. Bring to a boilcover and cook for 30 minutes or until tender. Drainreturn to saucepan. In a large skillet cook meat and onion soup mix over medium heat until meat is browndrain. Stir remaining 1/2 cup water and ketchup into beefmix well. Stir meat mixture into hot lentilsadd remaining 3/4 cup cold water and mustard mixture. Simmer covered 20 minutesadd vinegarstir well. Season to taste with salt and pepperserve warm. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl mix together the potatoes, condensed soup and sour cream. Stir in the cheddar cheese and butter. Place the mixture into a 2-quart casserole. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit or until heated through and bubbly. Sprinkle the top with grated cheddar cheese and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from the oven and serve hot.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowlstir. Heat 1/3 cup oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tunacook 3 minutes or until browned. Reduce heat to mediumcook 2 minutes. Add butter and garliccook 1 minute or until butter melts. Remove from heat. Add 1/2 cup of the lime juice mixture and remaining 1/3 cup oil. Coat fish with mixture and serve.

Soak dried navy beans in water overnight. The next day drain the soaking water and rinse the dried beans. Put all of the dry beans into a pot with enough water to cover. Bring the water to a boil and cook the beans until tender. Drain. In a large bowl mix together the following: beans with their cooking water, barbecue sauce, catsup, brown sugar, dry mustard, and bacon. Bake uncovered in a slow oven (250 degrees) for two hours or until the mixture thickens. Serve hot with biscuits or cornbread. You can also use a crockpot. Place all of the dry beans into the crockpot along with the barbecue sauce, catsup, brown sugar, dry mustard, and the cooked and crumbled bacon. Cook the beans in the crockpot for three or four hours.
Peel the oranges, cut into segments and remove seeds. Place segments on top of the greens. Toss with the dressing. Serve.

In a large pan or skillet saute the chicken in the butter until brown and tender. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan combine the milk, soup and seasonings. Bring to a boil and add the ham. Cook until the ham is hot. In a bowl combine the bread crumbs with the ham. Add the chicken and stir. Place the mixture in a greased 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Top with the sliced swiss cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Cut the broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces. Toss with the almonds. Put the broccoli in a large bowl. Add the orange juice and zest. Squeeze the juice from one of the oranges over the broccoli. Mix in the sugar and the olive oil. Chop the green onions and add them to the mixture. Toss to coat the broccoli with the dressing. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 170c/340f/gas 3. Grease 8x12cm cake tin with margarine or butter. In a large bowl combine the melted butter with the brown sugar and golden syrup then mix until smooth. In another large bowl beat the eggs and add them to the sugar mixture with the white chocolate and the gluten-free flour mixed with the baking powder. Blend with a whisk until smooth then stir in the thickened cream. Pour the mixture into the greased tin and cook for 45 mins or until a skewer inserted in the centre of the cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 mins then remove the cake from the tin then decorate with the chopped white chocolate.

Soak the chick peas for 2 hours in water. Drain and transfer to a bowl. Add the garlic and herbs and pulse to mix. Add the water and mix. Add more water if needed. Add the spices and mix. Transfer to a shallow baking dish and place in the refrigerator for at least an hour. Melt the butter in a pan. Shape the pea mixture into balls and shape into croquettes. Fry the croquettes in the butter until brown. Drain and serve with a sauce.

Clean and peel apples. Core the apples and cut into slices of 3cm width. Cut each slice into 5 slices and then cut each slice into quarters again. Mix all other ingredients with the apples. Heat the butter and mix in sugar, cinnamon and cardamom. Put the apples in a single layer into a heated sauté pan with a lid and drizzle with half of the sauce. Let it stew for about 5 min on low fire or until all liquid is absorbed by the apples. Turn the fire up to medium and let it stew for another 5 min. Do not stir during stewing. Turn off the fire and let it cool down slightly on its own. Take the lid off the sauté pan and sprinkle with raisins and mix them well into the mixture with a spatula or wooden spoon. Transfer to a serving dish. Serve hot or cold.

Heat the butter in a small frying pan over medium heat. Add bread and cook for about 2 minutes each side until golden brown. Add ham and cook for about 1 minute each side. Spread each half with butter. Place half on a plate. Top each half with a slice each of pickled onion and chutney. Place the other bread half on top. Place on a baking tray. Toast under a hot grill until golden brown on top and bottom. Serve with salad.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add white asparagus and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until just tender. Drain and cool. Slice the lean ham into thin pieces. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the butter and the salt in until the butter is melted. Add the white asparagus and the ham. Cook and stir until the white asparagus is heated through. Transfer the mixture to a serving dish. In a medium bowl whisk the eggs until frothy. Whisk in the salt and pepper. Pour the eggs over the white asparagus mixture. Sprinkle with the grated parmesan. Serve.

Place 3/4 c lukewarm water into mixing bowlsprinkle on top 1 tsp of dry yeastcover and let stand 10 minutes for yeast to proof. In another bowl stir together 2/3 c sugar and 1/4 c oilbeat with beater on medium speed until creamy. Beat eggs with beater for 1 minute on medium speedstir into oil mixtureadd 1/2 c hot milkbeat until blended. Combine 3 cups of flour and 1/4 tsp saltadd 3/4 c of this mixture to yeast mixturestir until blendedgradually add 1/2 c of milk mixturebeat until blendedadd remaining 2 cups of flourmix until blendedcover and chill 2-3 hoursor 2-3 days for longer rise. Turn onto lightly floured surfaceknead 10 minutesor knead into bread machineshape into ballsplace on greased panscoverlet rise 1-2 hours. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes until done
Cut tomatoes in half, lengthwise. Put in small bowl. Mix in the yogurt, mayo and zest. Season. Spoon mixture into a small serving bowl or individual ramekins. Serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter, sugar, and amaretto together. Remove from heat and add the eggs, one at a time. Blend in the flour and cocoa together in a large bowl. In a medium bowl mix together the almonds and the cocoa mixture. Stir the almond mixture into the egg mixture until evenly blended. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 35 minutes or until lightly browned and center is set. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a large skillet brown the ground beef with the onion. Drain the fat from the beef mixture and place in a 1-quart baking dish. In a large bowl combine the bisquick mix with the milk. Whisk in the eggs. Pour the bisquick mixture over the beef mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes or until set. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain off bacon fat from pan. Dice bacon and return to pan over low heat. Cook until fat is rendered. Remove pan from heat and cool slightly. In large mixing bowl, combine bacon with milk, eggs, potatoes and flour. Stir in breadcrumbs, cheese and bacon fat. Pour into 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining breadcrumbs. Bake in preheated 350 degree F oven for 1 hour or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Serve hot.

Mix buttermilk and Dijon mustard in a large bowl until combined. Whisk in garlic powder, ground red pepper, salt and pepper until well combined. Add chicken breasts to the buttermilk mixture and coat well on both sides. Place chicken in a 9x13 baking dish. Dredge each piece of chicken in the Crackers/Parmesan mixture. Place each coated piece of chicken on top of the buttermilk mixture in the baking dish. Sprinkle the Dried Sage & Rosemary over each piece of chicken in the baking dish. Bake at 400F for 25 minutes or until the coating is golden brown and the chicken is no longer pink in the center. Remove from the baking dish and serve with a side of the melted butter or your choice of dipping sauce if desired.

Spray 13 x 9-inch pan with cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut biscuits in half and place in pan with 1/2 cup of butter evenly over biscuits. Sprinkle sugar and cinnamon evenly over butter and biscuits. Place nuts evenly over sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool slightly and serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Beat egg whites in a mixer at medium speed until frothy. Gradually add cocoa, brown sugar & vanillabeat until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat sour cream at low speed until soft peaks formbeat in instant coffee granules until thickened. Fold sour cream mixture into cocoa mixture until combinedrefrigerate until set, about 2 hours.

Slice off the stem of each fig & remove any stems & seeds. In a large non-stick pan, saut the figs with the honey & marsala wine for 3 minutes or until softened. Add the orange blossom water & creme fraiche. Squeeze some of the orange segments into the pan & gently stir in the rest of the segments. Serve at once with a mint leaf per person on top of each fig --.
Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan and stir well to moisten mixture. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed (about 30-40 minutes). Serve warm.

In a medium bowl, combine the cherry pie filling and the dark sweet cherries (drained). In another medium bowl, combine the quick oats and the dry bisquick mix (toasted), stirring until blended. Spread half of the mixture in the bottom of an ungreased 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Top with the cherry pie filling and the remaining mixture. Cut the butter into small pieces and dot the top with the pieces of butter. Sprinkle with the nuts and cinnamon (optional). Bake at 350 degrees for about one hour. Let the bars cool for several minutes before cutting into squares. Serve warm with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Melt clarified butter in a sauce pan on medium heat. Add onions and garlic to pan. Add chicken base and stir until dissolved. Whisk in whipping cream and sour cream until combined. Whisk in flour until combined. Cook until sauce thickens slightly, approximately 3 minutes. Add jalapenos and juice from the jar of jalapenos. Stir until blended. Add the cheddar/monterey jack blend until melted.

Sift flour, baking powder & salt into a bowlset aside. Cream butter & egg whites until light & fluffy. Gradually add 1 cup of powdered sugarcontinue to add remaining powdered sugar until icing is stiff enough to hold its shape (about 2 cups). Add vanilla & almond extractmix well. Fold almonds into icingroll into 1/2-inch balls & place onto waxed paperpress down lightly with a fork to flatten balls slightly & make a small indentation on each ball with your fingertip. Bake 8-10 min at 375let cool slightly on wire rack & dip into melted chocolateplace onto waxed paper & let cool. Makes approximately 120 sticksstore at room temp or refrigerate.
Slice tempeh into bite-size pieces. In a large frying pan over medium heat, sauté tempeh until browned and cooked through. Stir in remaining ingredients and simmer 20 minutes.

In a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the oil, the cocoa powder, the granulated sugar, the eggs, the pure vanilla extract and the flour with the baking powder until smooth. In a small bowl, dissolve the salt in the milk. Add this to the cocoa mixture. Using a small ice cream scoop or a teaspoon, drop the cookie dough onto the parchment paper. Bake for 12 minutes at 350 degrees F or until the cookies are set but still soft. Let the cookies cool slightly on the parchment paper before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Fry the sausages and the vegetables together for 3 minutes in a large skillet or saucepan. Add curry powder and flour. Cook for 1 minute, then pour in 1/2 cup water. Cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Add 1/2 cup more water and cook for 1 minute more, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1/2 cup more water and cook for 1 minute more until vegetables are tender but not mushy. Serve over rice or noodles and top with a hard-boiled egg or two. This recipe makes a nice lunch or dinner for 2 people.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.

Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add snow peas and tiny peas, stirring occasionally, until almost tender (do not overcook). Meanwhile, in a small bowl whisk together remaining 1/2 tablespoon of butter, remaining 2 teaspoons of chives and a pinch of salt and pepper. Add to panstir to coat vegetables well in butter sauce and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line 8x8 pan with foil. Grease with cooking spray. In a small saucepan melt butter, brown sugar and 1/2 cup chocolate chips over medium low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heatadd to bowl with egg yolks and vanilla. In separate bowl with whisk beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold egg whites into brownie batter. Sift together flour, salt and baking powder. Gradually fold into brownie batter until smooth. Stir in 1/4 cup mini chocolate chips. Pour batter into panspread evenly. Bake 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutesremove from pan. Cut into bars.

Cream shortening and sugarsadd egg and beat thoroughly. Add remaining ingredients alternately with the milk, beginning with the dry ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls two inches apart on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Layer in moldsfirst half of jello in mold, add 2 tblspns of nuts and pour 4 tblspns of cola over it. Then add 1/2 cup of cream cheese and 2 tblspns of nuts and pour 4 tblspns of cola over it. Repeat with second layer. Chill for 6 hours or overnight before removing from molds. Serve with whipped cream or cool whip. Prep time does not include chilling time.

Bring cream of chicken soup to a boil in a small pot. Add the cream of mushroom soup. Remove from heat. In a large saucepan or pot, bring half-and-half to a boil over medium heat. Add the creamy soup mixture to the half-and-half. Stir in the butter until melted. Add the garlic. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the frozen broccoli. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the shell noodles. Cook until noodles are tender. Stir in the Parmesan cheese.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the orange roughy fillets, sprinkle with salt & pepper, and cook for 2 minutes per side. Remove the fillets from the pan and set aside. Add the garlic to the pan and stir in the dry crushed red pepper, cook for 2 minutes, stirring often. Add the cherry tomatoes, olives and capers and cook for 5 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Transfer the pan to the stove top to keep warm while you cook the pasta. Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water according to the package directions. Drain the pasta in a colander and transfer to a serving bowl. Add the orange roughy fillets to the serving bowl and pour the sauce over them. Toss well to coat the fish fillets with the sauce. Sprinkle the pasta evenly with the chopped parsley and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tbsp. butter. Add olive oil. Add garlic cloves to skillet. Cook 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add figs and horseradish. Cook 30 seconds. Add shrimp. Cook 30 seconds to 1 minute until just opaque. Remove from heat. Add 1 tbsp. Dijon mustard to shrimp mixture. Stir to coat. Serve warm.

Add bacon to a heavy large skillet. Cook until crispy. Set aside. Saute the onions until translucent. Add tomatoes. Stir in peas. Season with garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Cover and cook over medium heat until the tomatoes have broken down and you have a thick sauce. Stir in rice and hot sauce. Cover and cook for about 15 minutes until rice is tender. Stir in cooked rice. Toss with salsa. Serve.

Boil the eggs in salted water. Cut the cooked eggs in half. Peel the potatoes and cut them in half. In a large bowl, combine the eggs with the potatoes, Italian dressing, mustard, horseradish, salt and pepper. Toss in the green onions. Add the mayonnaise and sour cream. Mix well. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Prick potatoes with fork all over. Bake in 375 degree f oven about 1 hour until tender when pricked with fork. Meanwhile combine all ingredients for topping except feta in food processor until smooth. Remove from processor add feta cheese and stir to combine. Cool 15 minutes before adding to warm potatoes.

Butter one side of each slice of breadtoast under broiler until golden brownspread one side of each slice with mozzarellaarrange roasted red peppers in center of each slicetop with parmigiano-reggiano cheesetop with basil leavespress together with a platecut in halfserve.

Cook bacon until crisp. Set aside. Slice green beans and add to saucepan with chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain well. Add slices of bacon and chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in butter and add salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Boil potatoes until done, drain and cool. Slice potato halves lengthwise into 1/4" thick strips and place in 9x13x2" baking dish. Mix all other ingredients together and add to baking dish on top of potato stripspour melted butter over all and bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve hot or cold as a side dish or snack. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Brown pierogies in hot water. Drain. Heat oil in skillet. Add garlic and saut� for 1 minute. Add bacon. Cook for 2 minutes. Add onions and cook for 2 minutes more. Add savoy cabbage. Cook for 2 minutes more. Add water. Cover. Simmer for 5 minutes more. Add salt. Sprinkle with fresh dill. Serve.

Pour over the flounder pieces and stir to coat. Place fish fillets into a shallow pan. Pour the egg yolk over the top and sprinkle with parsley and soy sauce. Bake for 40-45 minutes at 375 degrees fahrenheit. Turn the pieces over every 10 minutes to brown evenly. Bake until the fish flakes easily when tested with the tip of a knife. Serve with rice or potatoes and steamed vegetables.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla and continue mixing until blended well. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt and gradually mix into creamed mixture. Add baby ruth candies and stir gently by hand until evenly distributed. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for about 10 minutes or until set. Let cool on rack.

Slice oranges thinly. Boil water and sugar together 15 minutesstir in egg yolks. Remove from heatstir in orange juice, milk and salt. Cool. Cream butter with egg yolksbeat in flour, baking powder and vanillabeat in cooled syrup. Cooladd nuts. Bake in two greased pans at 350 degrees 1 hour and 15 minutes. Frost with butter cream frosting.

Cut the eggplant into 2 inch pieces. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Saute eggplant until lightly browned. Remove from pan and reserve. Put the remaining vegetables in the pan and saute until tender. Add the sweet basil and remove from heat. Blend the spaghetti according to package directions. Add the cooked pasta to the vegetables and toss to combine. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish each serving with a few pieces of eggplant.

Boil potatoes in a large saucepan of water for 25 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes and transfer them to a large bowlmash the potatoes with a potato masher or fork. Add the butter spread and sour creamseason the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper, adding more sour cream and butter spread if desired. Stir in the bacon bits and the chivestop the potato mixture with additional bacon bits and chives if desired. Serve immediately. This is a great low fat and low calorie way to make loaded baked potatoes for a crowd! Serves about 8 people.

Cook hamburger and drain well. In a saucepan melt butter and add onion and mushrooms and cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add water and tomato paste and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add seasonings and cook for 3 minutes longer. Drain pasta and add to saucepan with meat and vegetables. Toss well. Serve in a bowl and top with cheese or mozzarella and serve hot.

Mix together ingredients except olives and pimentoes. Turn onto lightly greased board and knead well to develop gluten in dough. Flatten out and fold in half and turn dough 90 degrees and repeat until dough is smooth and elastic and has about 9 layers of dough. Flatten dough to about 1/4 inch thick and cut to desired shape or size with dough cutter. Roll dough in stuffed green olives and chopped pimientos and place on buttered cookie sheet or pan and bake in 400 degree oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown on top and bottom.

Beat cream cheese with 1/2 cup powdered sugar until smooth. Fold in pudding. In another bowl, beat 2 cups powdered sugar with butter until light. Spread on bottom of 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, mix 1/2 cup powdered sugar with 1/2 cup melted butter. Stir in oreo cookie pieces. Spread on top of crust. Add 1/2 cup cream cheese mixture to remaining 1/2 cup powdered sugar. Spread on top of cookie layer. Spread with remaining cream cheese mixture. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Top with remaining 1/2 cup powdered sugar.

Preheat the oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. Cut the butter in half and put it with the chopped chocolate in a bowl set over a pan of simmering water (do not let the bowl touch the water). Stir until melted then allow to cool a little. Using a sharp knife, cut the top off each loaf so that the hollowed-out centres measure 12cm wide and 3cm deep each. Place the loaves on a large baking sheet in a large shallow ovenproof dish (the dish needs to be about 10cm deep). Spoon a little of the cooled melted chocolate over each loaf then scatter with the cinnamon and nutmeg. Beat together the egg yolks and 100g (2/3 cup) of the caster sugar until pale and thickened. Pour the egg mixture into the bowl with the melted chocolate and stir well to combine. Pour over the loaves then break the egg whites and stir until well combined. Spoon the mixture evenly over the loaves

Cook penne according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Transfer to a paper bagcrumble. Keep warm. Stir sun-dried tomatoes and basil into the penne. Stir in the crumbled bacon and alfredo sauce. Cook and stir over medium heat until heated through. Season with black pepper.

Melt margarine in a saucepan. Stir in golden syrup. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add coconut essence. Stir well. Combine rice bubbles and desiccated coconut. Mix well. Pour into greased tray. Spread margarine mixture over cooled rice mixture. Sprinkle dark chocolate chips over top. Press down firmly. Cool for approximately one hour. Remove from tray and cut into squares. Store in an airtight container.

In a large bowl, combine ricotta cheese, flour, eggs, and tomato sauce. Beat well. Heat butter in a 10-inch skillet over low heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the mixture to each of 4 skillets. Cook over moderate heat for 1 minute. Turn with a spatula. Cook over moderately low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until browned on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with a sprinkling of Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

Combine sugar, cornstarch and salt in a medium microwavable bowl and stir in the half-and-half. Microwave on high for 8 to 10 minutes, stopping to stir every 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Pour the mixture into the baked 9-inch pie shell and sprinkle the top with cinnamon. Serve at room temperature.

Place brown sugar and salt in blender. Add vanilla ice cream. Blend on high until sugar dissolves. Add fresh peach halves and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and garnish each glass with a piece of fresh peach and mint sprig. Makes about 8 servings.

Combine braunschweiger with cream cheese and blend until smooth and creamy. Stir in milk and worcestershire until blended. Stir in garlic powder and spread over crackers. Garnish with sliced green onions and serve with crackers or celery sticks. Makes 10 cups.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a large pot, combine the onions and bacon. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until soft. Add garlic powder and paprika. Cook for 1 minute. Add potato and water. Cook for 15 minutes. Add the cream. Cook for 2 minutes. Transfer half of the potato mixture into a blender. Add 1/3 cup of milk. Blend. Transfer blended mixture into a bowl. Add the remaining potato mixture. Whisk together. Transfer into a large baking dish. Top with crushed tortilla strips. Whisk together the eggs. Pour egg mixture over top. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center of the potatoes comes out clean. Let rest for 15 minutes before serving.

Mix dry ingredients together. Add wet ingredients and mix well. Pour batter into 9 x 5 inch loaf pan that has been greased. Bake at 350 for 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Cook the carrots and onions in a large pot of boiling water until softened, about 5 minutes. Drain the vegetables well, reserving the cooking liquid. Cook the quinoa according to package directionsdrain well and fluff with a fork. In a large skillet heat the vegetable oil. Add the carrots and onions to the skillet with the oreganosaute for 5 minutes. Add the quinoa, reserved carrot-onion liquid, the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to lowcover the pan and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the frozen peassimmer for an additional 5 minutes. Serve the quinoa pilaf garnished with the lemon juice and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serves 6 to 8 people as a side dish with grilled meat or as a main dish with a green salad.
Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into patties. Cook and brown patties. Add mushrooms and broth. Cover and simmer until patties are done. Add salt to taste.

In a saucepan add pigeon peas to the water and boil until soft. Add meat and boil for about 25 minutes. Then add seasoning and the thyme and marjoram. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add cornflour and boil for about 2 minutes until the pigeon peas absorb the cornflour. Stir in the butter and season with salt and pepper.

Sift the flour into a large mixing bowl. Mix in the onions and curry powder. In a separate bowl beat together the butter and vinegar until light and fluffy. Stir this into the flour mixture until it is well blended. Season with the salt and ground black pepper. Cook over a medium heat stirring constantly until a thick paste is formed. Pour this over the hard-boiled eggs and stir until all the egg whites are coated. Place under a hot grill until the egg whites begin to brown. Serve immediately with toast.

Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Saute scallion until softened. Add the egg whites and whisk until scrambled. Add the egg and continue to whisk until scrambled. Stir in the bay shrimp and continue to cook and stir until the eggs are set. Sprinkle with low-fat swiss cheese and serve immediately.
