1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.2. Place whole squash on a rimmed baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until very tender.3. Cool and scoop out the flesh and discard the seeds.4. Transfer to a large pot.5. Add the broth and the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil.6. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.7. Blend the mixture with an immersion blender or purée it in a food processor or blender.8. Season to taste.

Season fish generously with salt. Drain the juices from the orange. Add tomato paste, vinegar, brown sugar, garlic cloves, orange zest, hot red pepper flakes, and orange juice. Bring mixture to boil. Cook for 3 minutes. Add fish. Cover. Cook for 15 minutes over medium-high heat. Transfer fish to plate. Add cooking liquid. Serve at once.
Boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain water and add butter and oil. Mix well and add salt. Mix well and grill in a pan under the broiler until browned on both sides.

Combine 1 1/2 Tbs. softened butter, 1/2 minced garlic, 1/2 cup sliced fresh basil leaves, 1/2 cup sliced fresh tomato, 2 Tbs. chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 tsp. finely chopped fresh hot chili peppers, 1/2 tsp. minced fresh cilantro leaves, 1/2 tsp. minced fresh thyme leaves, 1/4 tsp. minced fresh rosemary leaves, 1/2 tsp. minced fresh marjoram leaves, 1/4 tsp. minced fresh oregano leaves, 2 Tbs. olive oil, 1/4 tsp. minced fresh ginger root. Combine all ingredientsrefrigerate for 1 hour. Stir together 1 Tbs. softened butter, 1/2 minced garlic, 1/2 cup sliced fresh basil leaves. Stir 1 Tbs. softened butter, 1/2 minced garlic into hot sauce. Heat

Combine water with brown and white sugarswhisk until smooth. Place the egg white in a large bowl and whisk until frothy. Stir in the brown sugar mixture until smooth. Add pecan halves and toss until evenly coated with the glaze. Spread the pecans on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer. Bake until the glaze is dried but soft, about 18 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through the baking time. Remove from the oven and transfer the nuts to a plate lined with paper towelslet the nuts cool completely, about 15 minutes.

Melt butter and sugar over low heat, stirring until the mixture is smooth and the sugar is dissolved. Stir in heavy cream and salt and bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil until mixture begins to turn a golden color and a candy thermometer reads 245 degrees F (118 degrees C). Remove from the heat and stir in almonds. Pour the mixture into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish and cool completely before cutting into squares.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, heat olive oil. Add onion and garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms to pan. Saute 3 minutes longer. Add in broth, wine and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add herbs. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook about 5 minutes more or until slightly thickened and mushrooms are cooked through, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes and beans to pan. Stir to coat with sauce. Cover pan and simmer 5 minutes or until most of liquid is absorbed. Serve over pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Cook bacon until crisp, drain on paper towels and crumble. Place pizza crust on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Top pizza crust with spinach. Drizzle olive oil over spinach and sprinkle with black pepper and parmesan cheese. Top with bacon bits and shredded cheese. Bake pizza at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 10-15 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the cake mix and pudding mix. Beat in the oil, water, eggs, and nuts until smooth. Pour into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on a wire rack. Sprinkle with chocolate sprinkles if desired. Enjoy!

Boil water in a saucepan. When water comes to boil add grapeseed oil. Cook ginger, onion and garlic for two minutes over medium heat. Add spinach and cook another minute or two. Add all spices and cook for another minute or two. Drain liquid from cooked spinach into measuring cup to determine amount needed to prepare other ingredients. Add enough water to measure one cup to mixture from step two. Cook vegetables and spices another minute or two, adding water from step two to liquid until mixture is reduced by half. Add yogurt slowly while stirring with whisk or spatula. Cook another minute or two. Serve with rice or naan.

Boil 2 lb. potatoes. Mash. Beat eggs and add to mashed potatoes. Add salt and 1 cup flour. Stir in 1/4 cup milk. Add grated Cheddar and a little more flour if necessary to make a firm dough. Roll out into small cakes. Fry in hot fat until brown. Serve with butter.

Saute scallion in a little butter in a hot skillet, add the veal sliced to it, brown it lightly and transfer it to a shallow baking dish. Add the mushrooms sliced, paprika, the flour that has been rubbed through a sieve with a little water into the skillet where the scallion was sauteed, add the white wine and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Then add the cream and stir until it has thickened. Season with salt and pepper, add the cooked veal to the dish in which it was browned and pour the sauce over it. Cook in a hot oven until the meat is tender- about 1 hour. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch round or square pan and dust with flour or line with parchment paper. In a food processor, combine pecans and brown sugar. Pulse until nuts are crumbly and coated with brown sugar. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, salt and spices. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat the eggs, maple syrup and melted butter until light and fluffy. Add the nuts with the flour mixture. Mix well with a spatula, then fold in the pecans with the nuts mixture. Pour into prepared pan. Bake until a tester inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack before serving with ice-cream or whipped cream.

Boil potatoes and broccoli in salted water until tender. Drain. Set aside. While they are still warm, toss with dill, olive oil and salt. Slice green beans. Toss with olive oil and salt. In a large bowl combine broccoli and potatoes. Add green beans. Mix in goat cheese and pine nuts. Add lemon juice and zest. Toss and serve.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and the poblano chile (with the stems removed). Cook for about ten minutes until the onion begins to soften. Add the red bell pepper and stir until it softens as well. Add the turkey sausage and break up with the back of the spoon. Cook until the sausage is lightly browned and the onions are softened. Add the tomatillos and cook for about ten minutes, stirring frequently so they do not stick to the pan. Add the white wine, cover the pan and cook for about two minutes or until the tomatillos have released their juices and are softened slightly. Add the rice, stirring until the rice is heated through. Serve with tortillas, salsa and cilantro.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 9x13 pan. Slice squash into half rings. Cut onions into halves. Add all ingredients to pan. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over top. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot. This is a very popular dish in my family. I hope you enjoy it.

Wash fish. Salt & pepper to taste. In a skillet heat the oil. Saute the fish until it just starts to flake. Add the zucchini & saute about 5 minutes. Add the onions & garlic & saute until the onions are translucent. Add the tomatoes & saute for 3 minutes. Add lemon juice & saute for 2 minutes more. Add the parsley & serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Beat butter until creamy. Beat in powdered sugar, one cup at a time until light and fluffy. In a separate bowl, beat the yolks until thick and lemon colored. Gradually add the beaten yolks to the butter mixture, beating until completely incorporated. Stir in the remaining ingredients (except the pecans). Spoon 1/4 cup of the batter into 16 ramekins. Place 1/4 cup of pecan halves in the center of each ramekin. Top with remaining batter. Bake for 25 minutes or until firm. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle each tartlet with powdered sugar and place on wire rack to cool completely.

Trim fat from the skinless duck breast. Sprinkle the inside of the skin with a little olive oil. Season with a generous amount of the lemon pepper seasoning. Place a whole head of garlic on the top of the breast. Drizzle the top with a little more lemon juice and olive oil. Put in the refrigerator overnight. When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Place the breast in a shallow pan with a lid. Roast uncovered in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes depending on the thickness of the meat. Check to see if the meat is done by inserting a meat thermometer. The internal temperature should reach 165 degrees. Remove from the pan and let it rest for 5 minutes. Serve with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice.
Sautee white onions and garlic in vegetable oil. Add dry ingredients and cook for 15 minutes. Add stock and cook 2 hours or until thickened.

In small saucepan combine margarine with brown sugar and water. Bring to boil, stirring to blend well. Remove from heatcool slightly. Stir in slices of bread. Arrange bread mixture on parchment paper or foil on baking sheetlet stand for several hours to absorb liquid (or overnight). Peel applescut into eighths or quarters depending on size of apples. Drain bread mixturepat dry with paper towelscut into eighths or quarters. Dip each half into egg beater or egg whitescoat with bread mixturefry in hot oil in heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer (375f) for 2 to 3 minutes or until bread is lightly browned. Drain on paper towelssprinkle with cinnamon.
Make sauce. Mix cornstarch and water together and add to boiling water. Stir until thickened. Remove from heat and add to crepes. Top with ice cream.

Preheat skillet over medium heat. In a bowl beat eggs and milk together. Add flour and brie and stir until smooth. Add seasoning and chives and stir gently to blend. Pour about 1/3 cup batter onto skillet and cook for about 2 minutes or until bubbles form on the top. Turn with a spatula and cook another minute or two or until light brown on bottom and set on top. Serve hot with butter and cayenne pepper.

In 2-quart saucepan combine cream of mushroom soup and water. Cook and stir over low heat until heated through and bubbly. Stir in sour cream. Remove from heat. Place potatoes in 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer 4 slices of cooked pork chop over potatoes. Spoon soup mixture over potatoes and pork chop. Sprinkle with dill weed and parsley. Cover and bake in preheated 350f oven for 35-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Saute onions with garlic over medium heat in a large frying pan until tender. Stir in tomatoes, capers, anchovies and red pepper flakes. Cook until thickened. Reduce heat to low. Drain pasta. Transfer to a large bowl. Pour sauce over pasta. Toss to coat. Serve garnished with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large skillet over medium heat brown ground beef. Drain fat. Add hash brown potatoes. Season with salt, black pepper and onion salt. Cook until potatoes are tender. Set aside. In a medium bowl beat eggs with heavy cream until light. Stir in cheese. Pour into pie shells. Sprinkle with ground beef and potato mixture. Bake for about 1 hour or until set. Let stand for about 10 minutes before cutting.

In large bowl beat together with electric mixer until well blended the cake mix and 3 eggs. Stir in the sugar, vanilla and oil until well blended. Pour mixture over crumbled pineapple and cherry pie filling. Spread coconut evenly over mixture. Bake at 375 for about 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

Microwave soup in 1-qt microwave safe bowl on High 3-1/2 minutes. Stir in 2 cups waterstir in remaining 1 cup water. Add the rice. Microwave on High 3-1/2 minutes. Stir in remaining 2 cups water. Add vegetables. Microwave 5 minutes more. Microwave on High 3-1/2 minutes. Add the cheese. Microwave 2 minutes more. Microwave on High 3-1/2 minutes. Microwave 4-1/2 minutes more. Stir in remaining 2 cups water. Add the chicken. Microwave 4 minutes more. Microwave 4-1/2 minutes more. Microwave 2 minutes more. Stir in remaining 2 cups water. Add the butter. Microwave 1 minute more. Microwave 3-1/2 minutes more. Microwave on High 3-1/2 minutes. Stir in remaining 2 cups water. Add the salt. Microwave 2 minutes more. Microwave 3-1/2 minutes

Preheat the oven to 180c. Grease an 8inch round loaf tin. Melt the butter in a small saucepan then stir in the brown sugar. Add the boiling water and stir until dissolved. Pour the mixture into the prepared tin. Place in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool slightly then turn out onto a wire rack. Meanwhile make the frosting. Melt the butter in a small saucepan then stir in the brown sugar. Add the boiling water and stir until dissolved. Pour the mixture into a bowl. Add the icing sugar and stir until smooth. Spoon over the cakes. Top with a sprinkling of coconut.

Melt chocolate morsels in a large bowl over a pan of boiling waterremove from heat, stir until smooth. In a large bowl, beat eggs with an electric mixer until light yellow in color and foamy. Beat in oil and vanilla extract until combined. Mix in the sugar and melted chocolate. Sift the flour over the mixture and fold in with a spoon until just combined (batter will be very thick). Stir in the pecans. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch pan. Bake for 18 minutes or until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. Soak 3/4 cup of white rice in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Dry with kitchen paper. Heat margarine or oil and brown onion, garlic, capsicum, pepper with tomato (chopped) for 5 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of white wine or stock if you need some liquid. Add drained white rice, season with salt and pepper to taste and stir through. Transfer to a 30cm square baking tray or 25cm round baking tray lined with greaseproof paper or baking parchment. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan or Cheddar cheese if you wish (optional). Cook for 15-20 minutes until golden brown on top. Cool slightly before serving. Serve with green salad and fruit.

Mash together the avocados, cilantro, corn kernels, onion, bell pepper and jalapeno jack cheese in a large bowl with a fork until combined. Stir in the lime juice and hot sauce. Season with salt to taste.

Mix together the first seven ingredients in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in the next three ingredients until well blended. Spoon into a 1 quart baking dish and bake at 350 for approx 45 minutes until set.

Melt honey with puffed millet in a microwave or stove top. When melted, add mini chocolate chips. Mix thoroughly. Spread mixture into an 11x8 pan. (Can be done in a large bowl too. Just have to be careful as it may fall apart). Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly before cutting into bars.

Peel the potato. Cut it into cubes. Peel the garlic. Slice the onions. Peel the zucchini. Cut it into cubes. Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the garlic. Sauté until the garlic is lightly browned. Add the curry powder. Stir for a minute. Add the zucchini. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the potato cubes. Cook for about 5 more minutes. Add the broth. Cover. Bring to the boil. Simmer for about 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Season the soup with salt. Serve warm.

Mix horseradish and mustard together in a bowl. Season with pepper, salt and the fennel and garlic seeds. Place the fillets skin-side up on a plate. Cover the top of each fillet with the horseradish mixture. Roll the fillets in the panko bread crumbs. Place the rolled fillets on a greased baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees F for approximately 25 minutes.

Bring the water and brown sugar to a boil. Add the carrots and continue to cook over high heat for about 5 minutes. Drain. Add the vinegar and melt the butter. Combine and pour over the hot carrots. Serve warm.

Mix the first 5 ingredients in a bowl and let stand for 30 minutes. Heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the button mushrooms in a single layer. Cook until the liquid has evaporated, about 15 minutes. Season to taste.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together margarine and peanut butter until blended. Add in eggs, vanilla and beat well. Stir in flour, splenda granular, baking soda and salt until blended. Stir in mashed bananas until combined. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets about two inches apart. Bake for 10 minutes or until edges are set. Cool for five minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on wire racks.
Put oil and garlic in food processor and puree until smooth. Add mint and process until minced. Add tomatoes and process until desired consistency. Sprinkle with cayenne.

Mix all of the filling ingredients together in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the filling is thickened. Do not let it boil. Pour into a deep dish pie shell. Bake at 400F for about 10 minutes.

In a bowl mix flour, sugar and oil, add the milk and mix well. In another bowl beat the eggs and add to the other bowl. Add the vanilla and mix well. Now add the baking powder and mix well. Add the apples and the cinnamon and mix well. Bake in a 180c pre-heated oven for about an hour. (Don't forget to grease the pan)

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with shortening or oil. Combine brown sugar, all-purpose flour and cinnamon. Cut in shortening with a pastry blender or fork until mixture is crumbly. In a small bowl combine morsels with butter. Spread morsels evenly over crumb mixture. Top with apples and nuts. Pour apple juice over fruit. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until topping is browned. Serve warm with ice cream if desired.

Heat sunflower oil in a large frying pan. Cook garlic cloves over a medium heat until fragrant. Add oregano. Toss in chopped tomatoes. Cook until liquid evaporates. Add beef stock. Simmer for 3 - 4 minutes. Place sausages in frying pan. Cook over a medium heat until browned. Add garlic cloves. Toss in chopped tomatoes. Cook until liquid evaporates. Add beef stock. Simmer for 3 - 4 minutes. Add dried oregano. Stir in sunflower oil. Add chopped tomatoes. Cook until liquid evaporates. Add black olives and mushroom. Cook until mushroom softens. Stir in sunflower oil. Add chopped tomatoes. Cook until liquid evaporates. Add dried oregano. Stir in sunflower oil. Season to taste. Serve with rice.

Brown pork chops in hot vegetable oil. Add red wine and bring to a boil. Add salt, pepper and flourcook and stir for 2 minutes or until mixture thickens. Gradually stir in beef broth. Simmer for 4-5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in peeled and chopped onionscover and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Add cornstarch to mixture. Bring to boilingcook and stir for 2-3 minutes or until thickened. Serve with noodles or rice.

In a large frying pan melt olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender. Add celery and cook until tender. Add vegetables and cook until tender. Add tomato sauce and cook until thick. Add cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased 9 inch pie plate. Top with a second crust. Bake at 425 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 degrees and bake until golden brown.

Rub fish fillets with lemon wedge and salt. Heat butter in a pan. Saute almonds for 1 minute. Remove from pan. Saute fish for 1 minute. Add almonds and simmer for 2 minutes. Serve fish in a martini glass. Garnish with parsley.

Prepare beets by peeling and slicing into thin rounds or slices if large enough. Heat margarine and stir in maple syrup and lemon juice and pour over beets in large dish. Bake at 400f for about 20 minutes or until golden brown and tender. Serve as a side dish or with grilled chicken or ham.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well and shape into 12 small loaves. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until cooked through and browned. Serve with barbecue sauce.

In a medium bowl combine the orange juice concentrate and lime juice and stir well. Add the curry powder and mix well. Dip the tofu pieces in the mixture and place on an ungreased jelly-roll pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with your favorite dip.

Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Add the sprouts. Cook, stirring occasionally until the sprouts are tender. Drizzle over the warm sprouts.

Wash and trim fresh green beans of their ends. Heat bacon slices until they are crispy. Drain on paper towels. In a medium bowl, combine the bacon, brown sugar, butter and soy sauce. Mix well together until the butter is melted. Pour the mixture evenly into the cooked and trimmed fresh green beans. In a small bowl, mix together the remaining ingredients except for the green beans. Pour the mixture evenly on top of the bacon mixture in the cooked green beans. Cover the top of the pan with aluminum foil to prevent the green beans from burning or sticking to the bottom of the pan. Place the pan on top of the stove. Cook for 10-15 minutes or until the bacon mixture is bubbling and the green beans become tender. Serve immediately.

Combine shallot and olive oil in a bowl. Add bread crumbs. Coat both sides of the chicken with the mixture and place into an oven-safe pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Top with mozzarella and parsley. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake for another 5 minutes. Garnish with mushrooms and serve.

Combine walnuts, cranberries, sugar and 2 tablespoons water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook until most of the water has evaporated. Place a strainer over a bowl. Pour walnut mixture into strainer. Press mixture through strainer. Let cool. In a large bowl, beat whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold in walnut mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Drizzle with powdered sugar if desired.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and add the onions and the bell peppers. Cook for about 10 minutes or until onion is translucent and the bell peppers are tender-crisp. Add the garlic cloves and continue saute for about 1 minute or until fragrant. Add the frozen hash browns and stir well to coat with the onion mixture. Continue sauteing for about 10 more minutes or until the hash browns are browned and crispy and the onion mixture is tender-crisp and translucent. Stir in the salt, black pepper and the ham. Cook for about 1 more minute or until the meat is heated through and the spices are incorporated into the vegetables. Pour in the eggs and stir gently until the eggs are just incorporated and the mixture is somewhat lumpy. Remove from heat and sprinkle with the cheddar cheese and stir gently until the cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Spread each slice of bread with 1/4 cup honey mustard. Spread a layer of tuna over one slice of bread. Spread relish over second slice of bread and place on top of tuna. Place remaining slice of bread over relish and press down to close. Spread with 1/4 cup of honey mustard. Serve.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for 1 minute. Add the apple and cook until tender but still firm. Stir in flour, curry powder, salt and pepper. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in broth, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, cook for 5 minutes or until thickened and flavors blend. Add the celery and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt if desired. Serve hot or cold.

Pre heat oven to 350f. Grease baking pan. Cream together dark chocolate and butter. Beat eggs and sugar together and then add to dark chocolate mixture. Add flour, espresso and salt and mix well. Pour into prepared baking pan and bake for approx 30 mins until firm. Allow to cool and then cut into squares to serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute garlic, carrot, celery rib and onion with 1 tbsp vegetable oil until softened, 5-7 minutes. Add apple to pansaute 1 minute more. Add red wine, port and broth to panbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover pan with a lid. Simmer until vegetables are softened and liquid has reduced by half, 35-40 minutes. Remove from heatdiscard lid. Add reserved vegetable mixture to a food processorpuree until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 cups white sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1 cup chopped carrots, 1/2 cup chopped walnuts. Spread in a greased 10-inch round cake pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes before removing from the pan. Cool completely before frosting.
